loans.name: Mwansifu

texts.en:
Mwansifu is a widow with three children (ages 12, 10, and 8). She has been selling shoes for ten years, giving her a monthly profit of about $230.

Mwansifu has previously secured a loan and met the payback requirements. This new loan would be used to purchase additional shoes for resale. She is a member of loan group W/na Maznelidu, whose members guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To purchase shoes for resale.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia N. sells palm oil. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient to cover the expenses of Cynthia and her three children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Ingrid Giovanna

texts.es:
Ingrid has taken advantage of the different opportunities that life has presented to her to the maximum for the well being of her 2 children who are her reason for living and also because of her desire to feel like an active woman. This is why she decided to rent a storefront and open a call center, which brings her the satisfaction of independent work. Her desire is to continue implementing it and in the near future open a candy business, and meanwhile she continue working hard and consolidating her family’s economic situation. In this opportunity she request of loan of 800 soles to buy calling cards and virtual recharges that she will then re-sell in her call center. Act in solidarity with the credit that Ingrid is requesting for the well being of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Las diversas oportunidades que se presentan en la vida de Ingrid han sido aprovechadas al máximo por el bienestar de sus 2 hijos que son su razón de vivir y también por el deseo de sentirse ella misma una mujer activa. Es así que decide arrendar un local y abrir un locutorio, el cual le trae las satisfacciones de un trabajo independiente. Su deseo es seguir implementándolo y en un futuro próximo incrementar un negocio de confitería, mientras tanto ella seguirá forjando y consolidando la economía de su familia. En esta oportunidad ella solicita un préstamo de 800 soles para comprar tarjetas telefónicas y recargas virtuales que luego seguirá comercializándolas en su cabina. Se parte solidaria en el crédito que solicita Ingrid para el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: To increase the size of her call center and buy inputs for telephone service.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer, 33 years old, is married with 5 children. He lives in the North of Lebanon.

Amer owns a shop where he sells vegetables, fruit juices and cocktails. He needs a loan of $1,200 so he can purchase more fruit and other merchandise for his shop. With the beginning of the summer season, there is an increased demand for fresh juices. This inventory increase will allow Amer to expand his business by attracting more clients. Therefore, it will help to ensure a better livelihood for his family.

This is the first time Amer has requested a loan from A. Majmoua.

loans.use: Working capital to purchase an inventory of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julián is 34 years old and lives with his wife and two of his seven children. He is a very persevering and hard-working man who has dedicated himself for many years, since his childhood, to farming. He plants a number of crops including a variety of potatoes, peas, beans and corn. He thinks that business is mediocre given the low prices that are being offered in the markets and, due to this, he doesn’t allow his vegetables to be sold by means of intermediaries. Instead, he takes them directly to the city where he can sell them himself for a better profit. He also dedicates himself to raising farm animals such as horses. Julián conducts these activities because they are a lifestyle to which he is accustomed, even though he doesn’t have the same energy he used to. Additionally, several years ago Julián opened a small store in his home. Julián continues to make great efforts in his work because he wants to continue to support his two children who remain at home. He seeks a loan to invest into his farming endeavors, specifically to buy fertilizer, as well more merchandise to better supply his small grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Julián tiene 34 años y actualmente vive con su esposa y 2 de sus 7 hijos. Es un hombre muy perseverante y trabajador, se dedicado durante muchos años, desde su niñez, a las actividades agrícolas, siembra diversos productos, tales como la papa en sus diversas variedades, arveja, habas y maíz, él considera que le va regular porque son muy bajos los precios que se ofertan en el mercado, es por eso, que no admite vender sus productos por medio de intermediarios y directamente los lleva a la ciudad, donde puede recibir la ganancia, también se dedica a la crianza de animales, tales como el caballo, Julián realiza estas actividades porque es su estilo de vida, a las cuales está acostumbrado, a pesar que ahora sus fuerzas no son como antes. Adicionalmente hace pocos años, Julián abrió una pequeña tienda en su casa.} Julián sigue esforzándose porque quiere seguir apoyando a sus dos últimos hijos, quienes viven con a su lado. Solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la agricultura, comprando sacos de abono, además, también comprar mercadería para su pequeña tienda y surtirla de productos.

loans.use: Purchase bags of fertilizer for his crops, as well as merchandise to stock his small grocery store.

loans.name: Miguel Aparicio

texts.es:
Miguel tiene una empresa de serigrafía llamada Maranatha desde hace 9 años, él se dedica a hacer cualquier tipo de articulo de publicidad como lo son, tazas, llaveros, impresión de lapiceros, camisas y uniformes escolares, deportivos.  El es casado y tiene 3 hijos, 2 de ellos están estudiando.  Su esposa le ayuda en la atención del negocio.  El préstamo él lo necesita para comprar materia prima como lo es telas y otros materiales, ya que en esta época hay muchos pedidos.

Su deseo es hacer cada día más grande su empresa, y brindarle a toda su familia la protección económica y apoyo que ellos necesitan.

loans.use: Compra de materiales para su empresa de serigrafia, como telas y otra materia prima,

loans.name: Felipa's Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Semillas D. Accopuquio pertenece a la comunidad D. Castilla Pata en el distrito D. Yauli en Huancavelica. La comunidad es una zona donD. las mujeres realizan tejidos D. chalinas, gorras, etc.

Felipa A., es casada, ante sufría mucho porque no contaba con capital, vendía D. 2 a 3 pares D. medias, ahora con los prestamos que recibe a invertido mas en su negocio y sus ventas son mayores, también trae sus mercadería a Lima a vender. Este año tuvo que afrontar la perdida D. su hija que falleció en un accidente, sin embargo ella quiere salir adelante y aprovecha las reuniones D. su bancomunal para aprender a ser solidaria.

Gloria Núñez, es casada tiene 2 hijos, su negocio es una tienda que antes no estaba muy surtida, ahora esta bien implementada D. productos gracias a los préstamos que recibe, antes su esposo no le dejaba realizar sus ventas, ni traer sus productos a Lima, ahora ella conversa mas con su esposo y le hace entender que es su negocio.

Verónica Q., es casada, tiene 5 hijos, se dedica a la venta D. quesos, huevo, también granos y artesanías como gorros y guantes. Solo algunos D. sus hijos están estudiando otros no por la falta D. dinero. Con el terremoto del año pasado se derrumbo una D. las paredes D. su casa, perdió todo, pero le ayudaron los comuneros. Ahora es mas responsable con su capital, sus prestamos los utiliza en comprar baldes D. queso y materiales para tejer sus guantes y gorros.
texts.en:
The communal bank Semillas D. Accopuquio belongs to the Castilla Pata community located in the Yauli district in Huancavelica. The community is located in an area where women knit scarves, hats, etc.

Felipa A. is married. She used to suffer a lot because she did not have any money to count on. She used to only sell two to three pairs of stockings but after receiving loans she has been able to invest in her business and her sales have increased. She has also been able to take her merchandise to Lima to sell. This year she had to face the loss of her daughter who died in an accident. However, she wants to succeed and she takes advantage of the meetings at the communal bank to learn to be responsible.

Gloria Núñez is married and has two children. She has a store which previously was not well stocked. Thanks to the loans she receives, it is now well stocked. Previously, her husband did not allow her to make her sales or to travel to Lima to bring her merchandise. However, she now speaks to him frequently and helps him understand that this is her business.

Veronica Q. is married and has five children. She sells cheeses, eggs, grains and crafts like hats and gloves. Only some of her children are in school and the others are not because there is not enough money. After last year's earthquake one of the walls of her home collapsed. She lost everything but the people in her community assited her. She is now more responsible with her money and she uses the loans she receives to purchase containers for the cheese and materials to knit her gloves and hats.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for various businesses.

loans.name: Kosar Parveen Chiragh Muhammad Group

texts.en:
Kosar Parveen baji is a 49 years old widow and a mother of two sons. Kosar baji struggled hard after the death of her husband. She worked day and night to give their children good education. She started sewing clothes for her neighbors, and then one of her neighbor made helped her contact a clothing factory. The factory owner gave her orders to sew trousers on weekly basis. She invested her earnings in her sons' education. Both her sons completed their education through the 10th standard, and now they both work. The youngest son started a plastic bead-selling business. He buys plastic beads from a factory and sells to different shops. Kosar baji successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more plastic beads to expand her son’s business. 

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Shahla R. baji and Haleema baji and Irshad baji each request a loan to buy clothes for their clothes-selling business. Norseen baji requests a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy plastic beads wholesale

loans.name: Elicia

texts.es: Elicia tiene 28 años, es madre soltera de dos niñas, Yesenia de 7 años y Rosalinda de 3 años. La venta de ropa es el negocio al cual se dedica Elicia para poder mantener a su familia sola. El arduo trabajo que realiza desde hace 8 años va arrojando sus primeros frutos, los cuales son muy representativos para Elicia, ya que la motivan a seguir trabajando a favor de sus hijos, sabiendo que poco a poco va forjándoles un mejor futuro. Elicia no le encuentra dificultad en realizar su trabajo, es más le agrada mucho hacerlo, en compañía de sus dos pequeñas. Se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará gran cantidad de ropa para aumentar sus ingresos y pasar una bonita navidad al lado de su familia.
texts.en:
Elicia, 28, is a single mother of two girls: Yesenia, 7; and Rosalinda, 3. Elicia's business is the sale of clothing. Being the sole supporter of her young family, Elicia's has worked very hard for the last 8 years to see her business grow. Good sales motivate her to continue working, knowing that little by little she is providing for her daughters' future. Elicia has no trouble running her business, in fact, she really enjoys sales, specially because her daughters can go with her. This is her first loan with Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma. The loan will be used to purchase more clothing to increase her sales during the holiday season. With your help, she will have a nice Christmas with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restocking for holiday sales

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
Candida D. es una dama originaria del municipio de El Viejo de la ciudad de Chinandega y se dedica a su negocio de venta de comida preparada por ella misma destacándose en la preparación del baho que es un platillo que vende en su establecimiento a la intemperie pero en busca de cómo obtener su propio tramo en el mercado.

Hoy en día ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito el cual le permita la compra de la carne para preparar el platillo y venderlo en el mercado donde se desempeña día a día.
texts.en:
Candida D. is a lady originally from the municipality of El Viejo in the city of Chinandega and is dedicated to selling prepared food. She is known for preparing 'baho' (a traditional Nicaraguan dish made from a mix of meat, green plantains and yucca cooked in banana leaves) that she sells from her place out in the open, but she is searching for a her own place in the market. Today she is seeking support from Ceprodel to benefit from a loan which will allow her to purchase meat to prepare her dish and sell it in the market where she is everyday.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meat

loans.name: Marvin German

texts.es:
El Señor Marvin German Ríos S. tiene la edad 38 años, su estado civil es casado, Don Marvin tiene 3 hijos su edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 12 años de edad cursa el 1 año de secundaria su otro hijo de 10 años cursa el 5 grado de primaria y su hija de 8 años cursa el 4 grado de primaria, su compañero de vida labora en la venta de repostería y además de cosméticos, los propósitos de Don Marvin son de incrementar su negocio para prevalecer lo suficiente ya que siempre ha sido una persona que no descuida  sus responsabilidades como lo es la manutención de su familia, sus sueños son de comprar una propiedad para sus hijos ya que en la que habitan recientemente  es de su suegra ya que no tenían los recursos necesaR. para alquilar una casa donde pudieran vivir también le gustaría establecerle a su esposa un negocio completo de repostería ya que este seria una buena fuente de ingresos.

La actividad económica de Don Marvin es la venta de mercadería en general como: shorts, camisas, pantalones y ropa interior, la ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 9 años, Don Marvin inicio este negocio por familia ya que desde muy pequeño su familia le enseño a ganarse el dinero de una forma muy honesta por lo que a la corta edad de 18 años empezó a vender productos de mercadería como ropa interior y calcetines para varón por lo que recorría los diferentes mercados en busca de clientes a quien ofrecerles su mercadería una de las cosas que mas difíciles que atreveso fue empezar sin el apoyo de su familia por lo que decide por cuenta propia superarse el mismo y sacar adelante a su familia pero su amor por el trabajo logro que obtuviera el negocio que actualmente conserva por lo que ahora necesita el financiamiento para la compra de sus productos ya que el piensa invertir muy bien este dinero para que sus hijos no tengan que pasar las mismas dificultades que atreveso el para poder mantener el negocio que posee actualmente.
texts.en:
Marvin German Ríos S. is 38 years old. He is married. Marvin has three children whose ages are the following: his eldest son is 12 years old and is in his first year of secondary school. His other son is 10 years old and is in the 5th grade. His daughter is 8 years old and is the 4th grate. His life partner sells pastries and cosmetics. Marvin's goals are to increase his business enough to prevail since he always has been a person who does not neglect his responsibilities such as the support of his family. HIs dreams are to purchase a property for his children since where they live now belongs to his mother-in-law since they do not have the necessary resources to rent a house where they may live. He would also like to establish a pastry business for his wife since this would be a good fountain of income. Marvin's economic activity is selling general merchandise such as shorts, blouses, pants and underwear. He conducts business on foot. He's owned this business for nine years. Marvin started this business through family since, since he was young, his family taught him to earn money in an honest way. At the young age of 18, he began to sell products such as underwear and socks for men for which he traveled to different markets in search of customers to whom he could offer his merchandise. One of the most difficult things that he came across was starting without the support of his family. He decided to overcome this on his own and get his family ahead. His love for the work helped him obtain the business that he currently runs and for which he now needs a loan to purchase products since he thinks he will invest this money well so that his children will not have to go through the same difficulties that he encountered in order to support the business he possesses now.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Lorelyn

texts.en:
Lorelyn F. is a rice grower. She is 35 years old and both of her children are studying. She humbly started her business in 2001 using her own savings. Now she has her farm with an abundant harvest and machinery too, like tractors and threshers, which other farmers rent and use to plow their fields. She uses her harvest to raise her children. In addition to her husband's income, Lorelyn is making a profit from the machines she rents to other farmers. She is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. The loan will help her increase her yield. She is also considering buying more land to increase the size of their farm.

CEVI helps Lorelyn be more successful in her business. She has access to the credit assistance, training and insurance coverage CEVI gives to all their clients.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Nueva Jerusalen Group

texts.es: El grupo " Nueva Jerusalén " esta representado por la señora Elvira y conformado por 14 miembros en los cuales existe un parentesco familiar entre la señora Elvira  y la señora Maria luisa las cuales son hermanas pero con actividades económicas diversas. En general las socias se dedican a la venta de productos como cerveza, cosméticos, ropa, joyas, hamburguesas, pan y al servicio de limpieza y lavandería. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia pero gracias  a los años de experiencia de los socios saben como salir adelante. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra d insumos y materiales para mejorar la calidad de sus productos y hacerle frente a la competencia y poder mejorar sus ingresos para brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. En general una mayoría de los miembros del grupo ya tiene experiencia abajando con grupos solidarios en entidades financieras similares a la fundación agrocapital por lo que saben de la responsabilidad de sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
The "Nueva Jerusalén" group is represented by Elvira and made up of 14 members, of which Elvira and Maria Luisa are sisters but have different sources of income. Generally, the members sell products such as beer, cosmetics, clothing, jewelry, hamburgers, bread and offer cleaning and laundry services. As with all businesses, there is always competition for their business but thanks to the years of experience of the members, they know how to keep their businesses going. The loan will be used to buy ingredients and materials to improve the quality of their goods and face the competition as well as to improve their income in order to give their families a better quality of life. In general, most of the members of the group have already had experience working with groups in financial institutions similar to Fundación Agrocapital and so are aware of their responsibilities and obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mr. Sopheap P., twenty-seven, and his wife, Mrs. Mon Dav, twenty-three, were married in 2003 and have two young daughters. The family lives in a small village off of National Road Number Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sopheap has been a mason since 2000. He learned the skill from his brother-in-law. His wife has been a farmer for two years. Sopheap doesn’t have enough construction tools for his work, so he is requesting his first loan of $300 to make the purchases.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools and a cart to carry them.

loans.name: Obidchon

texts.ru:
Обидчон удачно без проблем закончил свой очередной займ и хочет получить следующий кредит, который хочет использовать на закуп угля и мяса.У него хороший поток клиентов, которые на обед покупают у него шашлык.Шашлык Обидчона очень вкусный и качественный, он готовит шашалык из бараньего мяса и говяжьего.
Обидчон за время своей кредитной истории отремонтировал свой ларёк, который выглядит как летняя столовая.
texts.en:
Obidchon has successfull completed his previous loan and wants to get a new loan which he wants to use to buy coal and meat. He has a high stream of customers who buy his shish kebab for lunch. Obidchon makes very delicious and good quality shish kebab which he makes from lamb or beef. During his credit history Obidchon has repaired his stand which looks like a summer cafe.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat and coal

loans.name: Women Of Vision Group

texts.en: The group members will use their loans to expand their businesses by increasing and diversifying their merchandise. One member will improve the premises by adding an ablution block (indoor toilets) to make the business area more friendly to customers.

loans.use: To buy additional items, diversify stock, and improving business premises

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes 3 Group

texts.en:
Luz is hard working and determined. She will use this loan to buy fruit and vegetables to increase her sales and variety for her produce stand. She has an eleven year old son that she loves and cares for. She hopes to one day have another child when she is more economically stable and also aspires to one day travel to see the big cities. Please help Luz and her group increase their businesses.

Thank you for support!

loans.use: To buy vegetables in bulk to resell

loans.name: Oralia Enriqueta

texts.es:
La señora Oralia Enriqueta J. tiene ya mas de dos dedicándose a la venta de ropa usada y nueva lo tiene afuera de su casa para no descuidar a sus hijos. 
Al negocio le está haciendo falta más variedad de mercancía de temporada de verano pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder surtir el negocio.
 Es por eso que solicita el préstamo para surtir el negocio ya que es la fuente de ingresos de su familia.
texts.en:
Oralia Enriqueta J. has been selling used and new clothing for more than two years. She has the business in front of her house so that she can take care of her children. The business is in need of a greater variety of summer clothing. However, she doesn’t have the money necessary to stock her business. She is requesting the loan so that she can stock her business because it is the source of income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seasonal clothing

loans.name: Saom

texts.en: The two people shown in the picture are Mr. Saom B., 36, and his wife, Kong Chan Veasna, age 30. This couple earns a living by selling fish and some vegetables in the market. Aside from this, they own a few equipment to provide decorating service for wedding parties and other ceremonies. The couple has three young children who are of school age in Pursat Province. Saom B. and his wife is seeking for a loan to buy a cow which can be rented out to farmers for additional income. The cow can also be used for breeding purposes so they can also raise its offspring.

loans.use: To buy a cow to raise offspring and for renting it as draft animal to farmers

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean H. is a 37-year-old store owner and rice retailer in Sto. Nino, South Cotabato Mindanao. She has been selling various goods in her store. Because rice is a much-purchased commodity, she started selling rice in her store as well, to augment their family income.

She is requesting a loan worth Php 25,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. The loan will go far in buying the additional merchandise to grow her business.

She chose CEVI for its wide services. CEVI helps their clients sustain and grow their livelihood. Aside from loans, it also gives training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase assorted groceries

loans.name: Frederick

texts.en:
Frederick takes pride in serving his customers well, which is why he is starting his own business. Previously, as a fire inspector for government agencies, he spent a lot of time checking day care centers and other commercial outlets for fire hazards. However, he wanted to be able to show his customers he appreciated their business by offering them discounts or giving them free services in exchange for repeat business. At government agencies, bureaucratic red tape made this impossible, so Frederick had to explore some other options.

Vehicle emissions inspection seemed a natural career course for him, because it would enable him to work for himself and use his prior training. A year and a half ago, with the idea to start an emissions testing center, he enrolled in and completed an emissions testing certification course.

Though Frederick deals with typical business challenges like finding a visible location for his center, he is so much happier now that he is able to offer his customers better service. After using his first ACCION USA loan to purchase an emissions analysis machine for his center, he plans to open up more centers in other counties in Georgia that require emissions testing.

loans.use: Emissions testing machine

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane sells cooked foods and has been in the business since 1999. She is 36 years old and married with three children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

Jane hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs

loans.name: Fatama Group

texts.en:
Fatama is the group leader of Fatama Group. There are three members in this group and they each want to take a loan to expand their business and make it larger. So they are requesting a group of loan 42,000 Afghani.

Fatama wants to take a loan for her business running a cart selling fruit.

Koko Jan wants to take a loan for her husband who has a general store.

Saraya wants to take a loan for her husband who is a carpenter.

So they are all very thankful to Kiva lenders who are able to support all entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix M. is from the village of Segatuc Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 38 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Felix owns and operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector operating a copras manufacturing business. The main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing and selling coconut products to the local community. Felix has been engaged in his business for over nine years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Felix joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felix has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. He is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be his third from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Joaquín Hernán

texts.es: Joaquín Hernán R. E. de 29 años de edad reside en Santa Tecla municipio del departamento de La Libertad. Joaquín  es un joven muy trabajador y luchador, el ha instalado un negocio el cual le permite generar ingresos para poder pagar sus estudios universitarios, con la ayuda de su único hermano Rafael se turnan para cuidar del negocio, que se encuentra ubicado en mercado municipal de Santa Tecla, donde vende granos básicos y productos desechables como platos, vasos y cubiertos, el crédito que solita  Joaquín es para invertir en su negocio surtiéndolo de mayor cantidad de mercadería.
texts.en:
Joaquín Hernán R. E. is 29 years old and lives in the town of Santa Tecla in the department of La Libertad. He is a hardworking and strong-willed young man who started a business in order to generate income to pay for his university studies. With the help of his only brother Rafael, they take turns managing the business which is located in the city market of Santa Tecla.

Joaquín sells basic grains and disposable products such as plates, glasses, and cutlery. The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase merchandise in larger quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to restock his business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The client has applied to this microfinance institution for his fourth loan. He runs a small photo shop and has been in business for seven years. Over the years, he has expanded his shop and bought new equipment. This has helped him attract more customers to his business and increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase cameras and upgrade fixtures and small equipment in his photo shop

loans.name: Alba Nidia

texts.en: For 13 years, Alba has had her pulpería, a small general store. Her pulpería stocks and sells essential daily items. Before opening her store, Alba was a teacher but her classes were far from her house and she was not able to care for her family. Since opening her store, Alba has been able to better support her family and provide for the education of her children. She has three children between the ages of 25 and 20. The oldest child is married and the younger two are studying at the university. Alba dreams that her two children at the university are able to continue their studies and become professionals. One wants to be an engineer. This loan will go towards the purchase of staple items for her store’s inventory, like rice, sugar, cooking oil, soft drinks and coffee. There is a great deal of competition for a pulpería. There is one found on nearly every street. Alba maintains close relationships with her customers in order to continue with her business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 21 años y vive en casa D. sus padres.
Toda su vida ha estado relacionado a las actividades agrícolas, él cultiva principalmente L. alcachofa, que es uno D. los productos más comunes D. su localidad. Diariamente cuida D. sus tierras donD. hace poco sembró también papa, Juan verifica que sus platas estén desarrollándose correctamente y prevenir D. las plagas y enfermedades.
Adicionalmente, cría cuyes, para los cuales acondicionó un espacio D. su vivienda. Juan menciona que sus padres son el principal apoyo que tiene, pero a su vez él también es un importante apoyo para L. economía D. su casa.
Sus planes a futuro son D. seguir dedicándose a L. agricultura, pero utilizando mejores tecnológicas para incrementar su producción.

Esta es L. primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, él es el único varón D. su banco comunal y se ha integrado favorablemente a su grupo, por lo que se compromete a ser responsable en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en L. compra D. remedios y fertilizantes para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Juan, 21, lives with his parents. All his life he has been involved in farming. His main crop is artichokes, one of the most common products in his location. Every day he cares for his fields where he also planted potatoes a short while ago. Juan insures that his plants are developing correctly and prevents illnesses and pests from attacking. Currently, he also raises guinea pigs, for which he equipped space in his home. Juan states that his parents are his main source of support but that he, too, is an important contributor to the household economy. His future plans are to continue to farm but with better technologies to increase crop yields. This is his first loan with MFP. He is the only male member of his communal bank and he has become well integrated into his group so he pledges to be very responsible with his repayments. The funds requested will be used to buy remedies and fertilizers for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and medicines for his crops.

loans.name: Cecilia's Group

texts.en:
Cecilia L. is from the village of San Juan, Alicia, Isabela. She is 47 years old. Cecilia is the leader of a 5-member group loan sponsored by ASKI. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Cecilia is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Cecilia grows and sells rices. Cecilia earns approximately PHP 30,000 for every crop (every four months).

In 2008, Cecilia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cecilia is requesting a new loan of PHP 12000 to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. This will be Cecilia's third loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Letty Aurora

texts.es:
Letty A., su casa esta ubicada en la zona de Paraíso de Guayaquil, su esposo repartes pollos con el tienen 3 hijos uno de 26 años, 22 años y 18 años ya todos terminaron sus estudios colegiales. 
 
Letty comenzó vendiendo pollo poco a poco en su sector, con algunos ahorros pudo comprar un vehiculo donde comenzó a repartir los pollos y después lo convirtió en expreso, ahora Letty trabaja con su vehiculo haciendo expreso a alumnos los recoge desde las 05h00 hasta las 08h00, de hay en adelante reparte pollos con su esposo, una de las dificultades que tiene es que tener cuidado de los accidentes de transito.

El préstamo lo quiere utilizar para la reparación de su vehiculo y así mejorarlo. En el futuro quiere comprar otro vehiculo para hacerlo expreso y tener otro ingreso para su familia.
texts.en:
Letty A.’s house is in the Paraíso de Guayaquil zone. Her husband distributes chicken. They have three children; 26, 22, and 18. All of them have finished their education. Letty started selling chicken, little by little, in her area. With some savings she was able to buy a vehicle, and she started to deliver the chickens. Later, she converted it into an express vehicle. Letty now works with her vehicle as an express for students. She picks them up from 5:00 a.m. until 8:00 a.m. From then on she delivers chickens with her husband. One of the difficulties she has is being careful of the accidents while driving. She wants to use the loan to repair her vehicle and improve it. In the future she would like to buy another vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair her vehicle

loans.name: Mahmanain

texts.en:
For the past 11 years, N. Mahmanain has run her own clothing business at the clothing market in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. She and her husband have four children and her business is an important source of income for the family. Mahmanain's income helps her to support her children with food and education.
Lending services from Kiva partner, IMON International, have been a key support for Mahmanain as she has developed her business. She has proven to be a great client and has maintained a perfect payment record. Mahmanain is requesting a loan of 8000 TJS to boost her available capital and allow her to purchase new inventory. We are grateful for the opportunity to further assist in the success of this dedicated entrepreneur.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new inventory

loans.name: Mary Auma

texts.en: Mary Auma W. is 46 years of age, married and blessed with seven children. She is a grocery business woman in the Nambale market, Busia district. She started this business in the year 2007 before which she was a farmer. Mary buys her stock daily at Nambale from local farmers and resells them.  She would like a loan of Kshs. 10,000 which will go into expansion of her grocery business.

loans.use: To expand business.

loans.name: Cresencia Gahuman's Group

texts.en: Cresencia G. is from the village of Upper Langcangan. She is 47 years old and is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Cresencia G.’s Group. Cresencia is married and has four school-aged children. She owns and operates a sari-sari (general) store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month In 2007, Cresencia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Cresencia is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 8th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 39-year-old married lady who is blessed with two children who attend school. She has been distributing cakes and cookies to the area residents and to other retailers for two years.  She also gets rental income from her rental houses. She was previously an employee at Utalii hotel before she started this business. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has learned to keep proper business records. She has requested a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase raw materials like wheat flour, baking flour, salt and sugar. She describes herself as a hardworking and a royal lady.
The photo was taken while she was supplying her products to a retail shop.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients

loans.name: Khoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Khoeun S. (shown in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Doeun Em, live on an island located 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1973 and have eight children: four sons and four daughters. Three of the children are married and live outside the family home, one son is a construction worker, two weave silk at home and the other three attend school.

Khoeun is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase silk materials to continuing her daughters' business. She also will use a part of her loan to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving business and seed, fertilizer and pesticides for farming

loans.name: Juliet's Group

texts.en:
Juliet O. is from the city of Pagadian City. She is 43 years old. Juliet is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Juliet is married and has 5 adult children. Juliet owns & operates a food production/sales business, selling specialty food products in the local community. Juliet has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Juliet joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Juliet has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from PMPC. Juliet is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Juliet from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tinga Balozi

texts.en:
Tinga is 40 years old and a father of three children. He supplies fish to tourist hotels in Malindi town.  The business is very lucrative during the high season and this business earns him a profit of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KSH) a month. Its three years old now. 

This is Tinga’s second loan with Kadet and he plans to open a fish shop with the extra income from this loan as well as invest in a deep freezer. These funds will help him boost his fish stock (8000 KSH), buy two bicycles for transport (11,000 KSH), and put 1,000 KSH toward miscellaneous items.

Tinga hopes to educate his children well, build a decent house for the family and establish his business.

loans.use: Stock more fish and buy two more bicycles

loans.name: Catarina Rossana

texts.pt:
Catarina Rossana S. nasceu no Distrito da Manhiça, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique tem 47 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 3 filhos de 30, 27 e 21 anos de idade todos Ja não vão a escola. Fez somente 7ą classe não continuou a falta de recursos financeiros. Vive na casa própria com seus filhos e sustenta seus enteados que vivem com ela.
Saiu apenas de Maputo para o Distrito de Boane ainda na Província de Maputo. Trabalha como auxiliar de limpeza no Instituto Politécnico Universitário desde 1983, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 2.600.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda com ajuda de seu marido consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancária de vez enquanto sempre que puder.
 Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seus Vizinhos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é seu 6° empréstimo no valor de 27.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, pedra, ferro, areia e outros) para continuar com a obra de construção da sua casa. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 7.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt, 15.500.00mt, 20.000.00mt e 17.000.00mt todos para áreas de habitação e para bens de consumo. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar na construção do murro de vedação na sua casa.
texts.en:
Catarina Rossana S. was born in Manhica District in the Maputo Province, south of Mozambique. She is 47 years old, married and the mother of three children aged 30, 27 and 21, all of them out of school. She finished 7th grade but had to stop it due to lack of financial support. She left Maputo to go live in Boane and works as a cleaner at the University Instituto Politecnico since 1983. She has no employees and makes U$80 per month that she uses to support her housenold, and with the help of her husband she's able to save some in the bank. She never had other loans and heard of Hluvuku through her neighbors that are also clients of the institution. This is her 6th loan in the amount of U$775 that she'll use to continue building her house. The previous loans were all for housing and consumer goods. She is committed to pay this one back in time as well, and hopefully apply for more loans in the future in order to build a new wall in her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction Supplies

loans.name: 04.09.02 Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Lien H. T. (89) is a 32-year-old femaL. living in the town of H. Hoa, Thanh Hoa. She is the group leader of this seven-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 04.09.02 H. Hoa (04,09,02 H. Hoa).

Lien is married and has two infant children. She owns and operates a business manufacturing and selling to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in this business for over five-years and earns approximately 600,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2010, Lien joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 4,248,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings. The loan will be her first from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Lien plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1. L. T. Hoa (90) is a 19-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business.

2. L. T. Thanh (91) is a 33-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4.248,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.

3. L. T. Duyen (32) is a 36-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4.248,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.

4. T. T. Thuy (27) is a 33-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

5. N. T. T. (92) is a 31-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

6. T. T. Cuoi (93) is a 57-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


*****************************************************
Lien H. T. (89) là 32 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố H. Hoa , Thanh Hoa. Lien là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 04.09.02 H. Hoa (04.09.02 H. Hoa).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. Lien thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Lien kiếm được khoảng 600.000 VND. Vào 2010, Lien đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Lien đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.248.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. L. T. Hoa (90) là 19 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.

2. L. T. Thanh (91) là 33 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.

3. L. T. Duyen (32) là 36 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.

4. T. T. Thuy (27) là 33 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

5. N. T. T. (92) là 31 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

6. T. T. Cuoi (93) là 57 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Gamaly J.

texts.en:
Gamaly J. K. is an entrepreneur and a married man. He runs a foodstuffs shop at Yombo Lumo ward in Dar es Salaam. He purchases and sells a variety of food crops at his shop, purchasing his business goods from the wholesale shops and foodstuff suppliers. His business goods includes wheat flour, maize flour, beans, sugar and rice.

Gamaly managed to build a residential house from his business income and it also helps him to meet his family’s daily needs. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,200,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Felicita Hermenegilda

texts.es:
Felícita es una madre de familia de 51 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito de Olmos, el distrito con mayor extensión territorial de la región, está conformado por varios caseríos que distan mucho uno de otro, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a mas de una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace tres años a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado que consiste en una motocicleta a la cual se le anexa una cabina) ella, como propietaria del vehículo, lo alquila para que sea trabajado cubriendo las rutas que unen a Olmos con sus diversos caseríos. Esta actividad constituye una fuente importante de ingresos familiares.

El continuo uso brindado a la unidad movil y el estado accidentado de los caminos de la zona han hecho que la mototaxi empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar el correcto funcionamiento del vehículo, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Felicita es una mujer responsable y empeñosa. Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para adquirir una unidad vehicular mas, con la que pueda percibir mas ingresos que le ayuden a sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Felícita is a 51 year old wife and mother who lives with her husband and children in Olmos district. The is the largest district in the region. It is made up of various communities that are far apart from one another and belongs to the Lambayeque province. It is located an hour and forty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For three years, she has been offering a cargo and passenger transportation service in a motorcycle taxi (a motorized vehicle that consists of a motorcylce with a cabin attached). As the owner, she rents it out so that it can work the routes that link Olmos to different communities. This activity constitutes an important income source for her family. The continuous use of this vehicle and the poor condition of the roads in the area have caused the motorcyle taxi to undergo some serious problems that require some urgent repair to guarantee its correct use. That is why she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles that will help her acheive her goal. Felicita is a responsible and hardworking woman. Her greatest wish is to keep working to acquire one more vehicle with which she can make more income that will help her get her family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and maintenance expenses for a motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pay for educational & personal expenses

loans.name: Liberata

texts.en: Liberata D. is a married woman who lives in Purok 3, Barangay Pungtod, Oslob, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: making and selling bibingka and torta (native filipino delicacies - see below) and hog fattening. Her husband, Jaime D., who is 59 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living. They have thirteen children who are from 4 to 32 years old. Bibingka is baked rice cake made from rice flour and coconut, while torta is anything dipped in egg-batter and deep fried. Liberata joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she wished for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,600, uplifting her family's standard of living. This time, for her 5th loan, Liberata is borrowing PHP 13,000, which she intends to use as additional working capital for her businesses so that she can continue to save for her plan to buy new equipment for her bibingka and torta business. Liberata is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her businesses

loans.name: Diosa

texts.en:
Diosa A. is from the village of Duka, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 48 years old. Diosa is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Diosa owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Diosa has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Diosa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Diosa is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Diosa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sarum

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarum Y. (pictured here), 30 years old, and her husband, Mr. Samun Loun, 31, live in a small village along National Road Number Three about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1998 and have two daughters. She also has her elderly mother living with her.

Sarum and her husband rent space in their house to garment factory workers. She also sells groceries at her home. She is asking for a loan, her first, of $1,000 to build a fence around her house.

loans.use: To build a fence around her house

loans.name: Kabingo Tweyombekye Women's, Rukungiri Group

texts.en:
K. Oliver is a hard working business lady. The 38 year old married mother of 5 children, some of them still attending school, sweats her guts out selling agricultural produce of maize, millet, beans, and coffee in a small rural area of Rubumba, Rukungiri. She has been doing this business for the last 6 years.  She started with little capital but with inspiration from her mother-in-law.  She gets many customers who buy her products for food consumption like hotel owners.

She is able to make an average profit of 160,000 Ugandan shillings monthly. This is a fair earning by any standards, and she requires a loan that will help her buy more food supplies for the business. Then she will be able to meet the customers' demands and also get more revenue.

She belongs to Kabingo Tweyombekye Women’s group of members and they insure each other in paying back the loan.

loans.use: purchase more stock for busines

loans.name: Félix

texts.es: El Sr. Félix P. es originario del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, actualmente se desempeña como profesor y consejal en la Alcaldía Municipal donde tiene nueve años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel con el objetivo de invertirlo en la compra de ladrillos, cemento, arena, zinc y pago de mano de obra para ir mejorando poco a poco su vivienda.
texts.en: Félix P. is from the municipality of Santa Rosa del Peñón.  He currently works as a teacher and councilor at the town hall, where he has been employed for nine years.  This is the first loan that he has requested at CEPRODEL and he will use it to invest in the purchase of bricks, cement, sand, zinc, and labor to make housing improvements little by little.

loans.use: To purchase bricks, cement, sand, and zinc, and pay for labor.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James B. comes from a long line of entrepreneurs, and more specifically, “handymen”, as he calls it. His grandfather owned a welding shop and did repairs for people on the side. His father was also a well-known handyman in the Lubbock area. After the father’s recent death, James and his wife used their savings and turned the family trade into an actual business, complete with a name and a logo, Lonestar Repair and Remodeling. Before James made this decision, he had worked for a variety of construction companies and was promoted quickly despite his young age. James says, “I’ve been in construction since I could swing a hammer”. However, following in his father’s footsteps, James was not happy working for other people and knew that his dream was to be self-employed. It was not too difficult to secure the first clients as they have been loyal customers to his family for years. James says, “I live in Lubbock, known as the biggest small town. Whenever you do something, everybody knows about it and that can be a good thing and that can be a bad thing. But, for me, it’s a good thing. Word of mouth is really what grows my company.” 

	With this loan, James will buy a paint sprayer, a job-site table saw, two nail guns and a cordless multi-tool kit that will allow him to take on more complicated jobs. James employs his two younger brothers part-time but they both have other jobs. He is excited to expand his customer base so that  he can employ people full-time. With his wife at Wayland Baptist University studying to be a teacher, the couple are on a tight budget. Lucky for James, his wife is an “extreme budgeter” and can make a dollar stretch. James’ marketing plan is to be an honest businessman with a good work ethic. He believes that through word of mouth, people will choose him because of his affordable and fair prices.

loans.use: Paint sprayer, job-site table saw, two nail guns and a cordless multi-tool kit

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man with three children; two attend school while one is too young for school. He lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees, rent and medical bills. 

He operates a cobbler business. His potential customers are neighbors and passersby. David faces the challenge of low pay for the shoe-making business. He hopes to establish a wholesale outlet for his shoe business in the future. 

With the 15,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase more shoe soles for making shoes. He decided to join Yehu to get loans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase more shoe soles for making shoes

loans.name: Lina

texts.es: Lina, D. 59 años, es una mujer trabajadora y humilD., que junto a su esposo Teófilo, D. 65 años, cuidan D. su nieto Jhon, D. 18 años, al que cuidan y educan en su casa propia ubicada en el pueblo D. Casacoto. Toda una vida, la dedicaron a la agricultura; D. eso hace ya 39 años, desD. entonces Lina y Teófilo, sacaron adelante a sus 10 hijos, los que ahora ya encaminados tienen su propia familia. Pero a pesar D. su avanzada edad, ellos continúan sembrando, ya que es “parte D. sus vidas”, afirman. Sus plantaciones D. papa, arveja y maíz; son los más reconocidos por la zona; sus técnicas D. cultivo, son muy admiradas, ya que utilizan métodos naturales y rústicos, lo que a ellos los llena D. orgullo, ya que mencionan que: “los frutos D. la tierra, salen D. acuerdo a como los cuidan, si es con amor y dedicación, son grandes y nutritivos”. Ahora quieren comprar abono en cantidad para poder abastecer sus más D. 2 hectáreas D. terrenos agrícolas. Es el tercer crédito con MFP y, como buena integrante D. su banco comunal, es responsable y honesta con el trabajo que desempeña, ya que D. ello depenD. el éxito D. sus negocios. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá adquirir varios sacos D. semilla D. arvejas, que dentro D. algunos meses cosechará, y si el capital le alcanza, contratará peones para que la ayuden.
texts.en:
Lina, age 59, is a hardworking and humble woman, who with her husband, Theophilus, age 65, care for their 18-year-old grandson John. They take care of him and of his schooling in their own house in the village of Casacoto.

Their whole life was devoted to agriculture which they embarked on 39 years ago. Since then Lina and Theophilus raised ten children, who having been put on the right track now have their own family. 

Despite their advanced age they continue to sow, because it is "part of their lives," they say. Their plantations of potatoes, peas and corn are the most renowned in the area, their farming techniques are widely admired, as they use natural and rustic methods, which fills them with priD..

They mention that "the fruits of the earth grow according to how they are cared for: if it is with love and dedication, they will grow large and nutritious."

Now they want to buy fertilizer in bulk to be able to supply their over two hectares (5 acres) of arable land. This is their third loan with MFP. As a good member of the community bank, she is responsible and honest regarding the work performed, since on it depends the success of her business.

The loan requested will enable her to buy bags of seed peas that will be harvested within a few months. If she can afford to do so, she will also hire laborers to help her out.

loans.use: Buy pea seeds; also wants to hire laborers to help with the planting

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla J. is from the village of Balbagon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 34 years old and married, with 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Perla buys and sells seafood products in the local community.  She sells fish such as tulingan, kutob amd inggatan in the local community. Perla has been engaged in her business for more than 6 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Perla joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perla has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to buy and sell. Perla is requesting a new loan, her third from HSPFI, for 9000 PHP to be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina D. is from the city of Maquilao Tangub City. She is 48 years old. Regina is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Regina owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing manicure and pedicure services in the local community. Regina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Regina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Regina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Regina is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Regina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service.

loans.name: Nelma

texts.en:
Nelma farms and raises pigs for a living. She is 39 years old, married and has 4 children. Nelma started her piggery some years ago. She fattens the pigs and sells them at the market. She also helps her husband to plant and harvest rice crops. They also sell their harvest at the market. Nelma does everything to help provide for her family and to sustain her children's education.

Nelma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Nelma is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to buy piglets and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy piglets and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 20-year-old single man. He lives with his parents and three siblings in Lebanon. He worked for a network for more than four years. After noticing the absence of such a business in his town, he decided to open his own network in 2008. He helps his father with the family’s income.

Today, he is requesting a loan of $700 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to renew his computers and perform maintenance for the shop and his tools. He wants his customers to enjoy a comfortable pleasant area.

loans.use: To renew his computers and perform maintenance for the shop

loans.name: Naranhuu

texts.en:
Naranhuu, 52, is married and lives with her husband and two children who are both university age. She and her family live in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her husband works as a guardian for a company. They live in a house and own a store nearby. She opened her grocery store near her house in 2006. She also has a house that is rented and pays 50,000 MNT per month. 

Today Naranhuu's working capital exceeds 600,000 MNT.  She is hard-working and eager to expand her business. Naranhuu purchases her grocery products from the local markets to sell at her shop. She is requesting a loan of 800,000 MNT to buy more meat to sell at her grocery store.

loans.use: To buy more meat

loans.name: Kean

texts.en:
Kean N. is a 48-year-old resident of the Kompong Tom province. He makes a living selling firewood that he has chopped from the forest himself and stored in his home to sell. 

Kean N. is married to Im Phorn, age 53, a rice farmer. She is the mother of seven children, five of whom are single and two of whom are married. Two sons are employed as sellers of chopped wood and one daughter works in a garment factory. 

To assist the farming business and alleviate hard physical labor, Kean N. needs to request a loan for his wife to buy one buffalo to use for plowing the farmland.

loans.use: To buy one buffalo to use for plowing the farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more groceries for her store.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena A. sells gari (a type of flour made from cassava) at Abrafo, a village near Abura. She has been in this business for six years. In the photograph, Abena is shown preparing gari. 

Abena's husband is a farmer and they have eight children. Abena’s income from selling gari helps pay for utility bills and school fees. 

To expand her business, she will use the loan to purchase more cassava so that she can produce more gari to offer for sale. She plans to reinvest the profits back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava so that she can produce more gari to offer for sale

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị (20203060007) is a 43-year-old woman living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  T. is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members in the case that someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Thượng Thôn - Nhóm 01 (Nhóm 01).

T. is married and has 2 adult children.  To making a living, T. owns and operates a business venture making and selling food.  The main source of income for the business comes from selling dried goods in the local community.  T. has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2010, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She is now requesting a new loan of 7,392,000 VND, which will be used to buy more kind of products to meet the demand of customers.  This loan will be her second loan from SEDA.  T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Nguyễn Thị Thơ (0) is a 49-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2.  Nguyễn Thị T. (0) is a 49-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3.  Chu Thị T. (0) is a 45-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business providing recycling services.

4.  Ngô Thị L. (0) is a 35-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

5.  Đào Thị Q. (0) is a 29-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized store.

6.  Nguyễn Thị B. (0) is a 26-year-old female who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her business of making and selling food.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


T. Nguyễn Thị (20203060007) là 43 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Thượng Thôn - Nhóm 01 (Nhóm 01).
