Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm sấy khô trong cộng đồng địa phương.  T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 3.500.000 VND.  Vào 2010, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các thành phần thô cần thiết để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị Thơ (0) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Nguyễn Thị T. (0) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Chu Thị T. (0) là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ tái chế.


4.  Ngô Thị L. (0) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


5.  Đào Thị Q. (0) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


6.  Nguyễn Thị B. (0) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to buy more kind of products to meet the demand of customers

loans.name: Sandra Arelis

texts.es: Sandra Arelis es madre y esposa, lo cual para toda mujer es un reto sobre todo mezclarlo con el trabajo, ya que es muy difícil estar al tanto de la familia ella se dedica a la venta de pan y confitería. Por lo que Sandra trabaja en su propia casa en donde la mayoría de  sus clientes conocen  los diferentes productos que ofrece. Desde hace 8 años tiene su negocio, a pesar de luchar cada día con diferentes dificultades como es el problema con el tiempo y con el alto precio de los productos. Sandra en este momento desea comprar harina, huevo, confites, bolsas entre otras.
texts.en:
Sandra Arelis is a wife and mother, a challenge for many women who must work for a living and also take care of family.  She sells bread and sweets and works out of her own home.  Most of her customers are familiar with the different products she offers.

She has been in business for eight years, despite the daily struggle of finding enough time or dealing with the high cost of certain products.

Sandra wants to buy flour, eggs, sweets and bags, among other things.

loans.use: To buy flour, eggs, sweets and bags

loans.name: Karen

texts.en: Karen B. and his family have engaged in animal breeding and bee keeping since 2004. Karen raises sheep, cows and calves, and also has five bee families. With his farming income Karen meets his family’s needs and increases his farming livestock. To increase his family’s profit, Karen asks for a 1.000.000 AMD loan to buy a mowing machine, which will allow him to work for hire on neighboring fields. Karen is 27 years old and lives in Geghamavan village, Gegharkunik marz, with his parents, his wife and two children.

loans.use: To buy a mowing machine

loans.name: Exode Plus Group

texts.en:
Thérèse, aged 61, is married and is the Chairwoman of the Community Bank named “Exode Plus”. This group consists of 12 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Thérèse started her business in 2003. She has been running a restaurant located east of the city of Kinshasa. She is a loyal client of IMF HOPE RDC and has already received five different loans and repaid them properly. She intends to use the next loan to increase the stock of her restaurant by buying 1 sack of flour, 2 sugar bags and beans with the aim of increasing her profits. Each day, her business brings in a profit of $10. 
Her ambition is to open a big restaurant in her neighbourhood. Thérèse has seven children aged between 25 and 45. Two of them are students.

loans.use: to increase her restaurant stock by buying flour, beans and other goods

loans.name: Hussam

texts.en:
Hussam is a 39-year-old married man, the father of one child and is from Marka, Jordan.

Hussam owns a snack shop. He is requesting a loan of 1,500 JOD to add a new retail section to his shop. Hussam aspires to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to add a new retail section to his shop.

loans.name: Pastora

texts.en:
Pastora plants cassava in their vacant agricultural land nowadays. Production of cassava is in great demand now. Pastora is 60 years of age and lives in Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is happily married with three children. Pastora's income from cassava production is 50,000 for one year. She spends at least half a year planting.

She requested a loan to buy planting materials for cassava production. Pastora has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Pastora hopes that she can produce more cassava and build a house for the family from their income.

loans.use: to buy planting materials for cassava

loans.name: William Antonio

texts.es:
Es de la ciudad de Managua, el señor William Antonio es una persona que se ha caracterizado  por ser trabajador desempeñándose como ayudante fontanero, honesto, responsable, con buenos valores y principios  morales, que lucha para sacar adelante su familia. Es casado y labora desde hace cinco año.

Se presento ante esta oficina  de  Ceprodel para solicitar crédito para poder resolver gasto familiares de solventar deuda con casa comercial.
texts.en:
William Antonio is from the city of Managua.  He has characterized himself as being a hard working, honest, responsible man with good values and moral principles; he is a Plumber’s Assistant who strives to provide for his family.  He’s married and has been employed for the last five years.

He appeared at Ceprodel’s offices to request a loan to cover a family expense:  he will pay off a debt he has with a commercial firm.

loans.use: to pay off a debt.

loans.name: Darwen

texts.en:
Darwen, 23, is single and lives in the Philippines. He has a shop that sells printed t-shirts and blouses, a business he has had for three years. He has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional stock of t-shirts and blouses.

Darwen has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Darwen hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of t-shirts and blouses.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school while the other has graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.
For the past ten years, Beatrice has operated a poultry business, selling from home to her neighbors and passers-by. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her potential customers are restaurant operators and passers-by. Beatrice dreams of becoming self-reliant in the future.
With this 60,000 KES loan, Beatrice wants to renovate her chicken house and purchase more chicks. She decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to renovate her chicken house and purchase more chicks.

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
Murad is from the village of Didi Chkoni. He is 36 years old, married and lives with his family: wife, Tamar; his 4-year-old son, his mother (retired) and his aunt (retired). 

Murad is leading the agro-business of the family. His mother helps him. They own two milk cows, the milk of which is used for cheese production. Cheese is sold on the local market. Also, they have 300 vine trees. Harvested grapes are used for wine-making. Murad sells wine locally. Along with the aforementioned activities, the family grows 300 nut trees and sells approximately 200 kilograms per year. 

Murad plans to purchase nuts with his received credit. The price of nuts is low now because of harvest season. He will sell them after four or five months, when the price increases. Murad plans to use the gained profit in wine-making, for purchasing different materials for wine production.

loans.use: to purchase nuts for resale.

loans.name: Mouena

texts.en:
Mouena is 41 years old, married, and has five children. She owns & operates a business selling specialty food products in the local community.  She has 2 years of experience, and needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 290 talas or US $121 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Mouena joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Mouena's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nely

texts.es: Nely  de 45 años de edad vive al suroccidente de la ciudad con su cónyuge y sus  dos hijos en las edades de 14 y 16 años. Allí se dedica al comercio de mercancía variada, actividad que inició para generar ingresos con los que pudiera responder a los gastos del hogar, especialmente en lo relacionado con la educación de sus hijos. Su sueño es tener un almacén donde pueda exhibir sus artículos, pues en la actualidad trabaja parte del tiempo en un colegio y su mayor clientela está conformada por profesores, padres de familia y estudiantes, a quienes también les vende mercancía variada a crédito y  pudines o tortas de contado. Sus compras las realizan de contado y también a crédito, porque  maneja una revista especializada,  a través de la cual exhibe productos como cosméticos, perfumes, ropa y muchas veces calzado, pero también agrega otros productos que compra directamente a otros proveedores y con ellos responde a pedidos que hacen sus clientes y que que no los exhibe la revista.  Mientras Nely se esmera en su trabajo, maneja una rentabilidad sobre las ventas del 25% y una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 6 días , indicadores financieros desde los cuales proyectamos su potencial crecimiento y su exitosa inversión mediante credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará prendas de vestir, cosméticos, perfumes, aprovechando que se acerca el día del amor y de la amistad y que sus ventas se incrementan antes de que llegue este día, en el cual sus clientes ofrecen demostraciones de afecto a sus enamorados, familiares ya amigos mediante regalos que compran a Nely. .
texts.en:
Nely, 45, lives in the southwest of the city with her spouse and two children who are 14 and 16 years old.  She sells assorted merchandise, an activity she started in order to generate income to help meet household expenses, especially those related to the education of her children.  Her dream is to have a store where she can display her wares because she currently works part time at a school and most of her customers are the teachers, parents and students to whom she sells merchandise on credit and sells puddings and sandwiches for cash.  They pay cash for their purchases and sometimes on credit too because she manages a specialized catalogue through which she displays products like cosmetics, perfume, clothes and often footwear but she also sells other things that she buys directly from other suppliers and is able to fill customer orders for items not included in the catalogue.  

Meanwhile, Nely works diligently maintaining a 25% profit margin on sales and a 6 day accounts receivable turnover rate, financial indicators from which we can project potential growth and a successful investment of the Kiva loan, her first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, that she’ll use to buy clothes, cosmetics and perfume taking advantage of the approaching day of love and friendship when sales increase because her customers want to give signs of affection to their loved ones, family members and friends through gifts purchased from Nely.

loans.use: to buy clothes, cosmetics and perfume.

loans.name: Ada  Ermelinda

texts.es:
La señora Ada tiene 29 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive con su hija de 7 años de edad.

Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que lleva 7 años de dedicarse a la elaboración de hamacas. Sus padres fueron los que le enseñaron esta actividad para que ella obtuviera una fuente de ingresos.

La señora Ada tiene que viajar cada 15 días a comprar los insumos necesarios para elaborar sus hamacas. Ella lo hace acompañada de su pequeña hija. El viaje toma unos 30 minutos en autobús. Una vez ella ha elaborado las hamacas, sale a venderlas a las comunidades cercanas a pie de casa en casa. Con los ingresos obtenidos ella  le brinda lo necesario a su hija, y paga el alquiler de la casa donde viven.

Debido a que la señora Ada esta viendo que su negocio le esta siendo rentable, ella solicita a Fundación Campo un préstamo que le ayudará a comprar mayor cantidad de insumos. De esta manera ella podrá elaborar más hamacas, ya que las vende muy rápido.

De los ingresos que obtenga de la venta de sus hamacas la señora Ada planea ahorrar para darle a su hija la oportunidad de estudiar, ya que ella no la tuvo. En un futuro la señora Ada también desea adquirir una casa propia donde pueda vivir junto a su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
Ada, 29, is a single mother living with her 7-year-old daughter.  She is a very hardworking woman who has been making hammocks for the last 7 years.  Her parents taught her this skill so that she’d have a source of income.

Ada must travel every two weeks to buy the necessary supplies to make her hammocks.  She does this in the company of her little daughter.  The trip takes about half an hour by bus.  Once she makes the hammocks she goes out on foot to sell them door to door in neighboring communities.  Income earned allows her to provide what’s needed for her daughter and to pay the rent on her house.

Because Ada has been noticing that her business is becoming profitable, she asks Fundación Campo for a loan that will help her buy larger amounts of supplies so that she can make more hammocks since she sells them very quickly.

Ada plans to save part of the income obtained from the hammock sales to provide her daughter with an opportunity to go to school, since she herself never had that opportunity.  In future, Ada also wants to acquire a house of her own to live in with her little girl.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make hammocks.

loans.name: Fidaa'

texts.en:
Fidaa' is 32 years old and is married with four sons and two daughters. She is a conservative woman so her husband is photographed instead in her grocery store. Fidaa’s husband runs a billiard game store and earns a decent income. Fidaa' runs a grocery store but does not have enough money to increase the variety of items she sells.

Fidaa’ is requesting a loan from FATEN to purchase grocery items to increase her competitiveness and profit. This will improve her family’s living conditions. She will repay her loan on a monthly basis.


About this loan:

FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell

loans.name: Jefferson

texts.en: Jefferson is married and blessed with two children who are still in school. He describes himself as a humble person. He has been baking cakes for the last four years to make a living. He has employed four people to help him to manage the business. His customers are people of his area of residence. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy ingredients such as cooking fat, wheat flour and sugar.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as cooking fat, wheat flour and sugar.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en:
Agripina is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with nine children.
 
Agripina has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Agripina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Agripina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo, de 28 años es un hijo admirable. Vive en compañía de su mamá Sofía y su papá Eulogio; a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de Chilca.  Todas las mañanas desde las primera hora del día, se prepara para realizar un viaje largo, pues él se dedica al trasporte público, cubriendo las rutas de Huancayo hacia la ciudad de Ayacucho, el viaje dura un promedio de un día, por eso siempre va preparado para cualquier desgracia que tuviera. Gana un promedio de 60 soles diarios; pero los fines de semana tiene mayor pasajeros y puede hacer hasta dos viajes, todo depende la cantidad de personas que soliciten sus servicios. Ahora desea incursionar en el negocio de cabinas de Internet, donde los jóvenes y adultos que no cuenten con Internet en casa, puedan navegar. Para ello ya dio el primer paso, con la compra de algunas computadoras y la instalación de red. Aún le falta capital de trabajo, por ello incursionó en su asociación y está seguro que logrará su objetivo. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Conopa” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes; pues tiene muchos planes. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.  Wilfredo de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 2 computadoras nuevas para su negocio.
texts.en: Wilfredo, 28, is an admirable son.  He lives with his mother, Sofía, and his father, Eulogio, and takes care of them in their own home in the district of Chilca.  In the early morning he gets ready for work since he is a public transport driver and covers the long route between Huancayo and the city of Ayacucho.  The average trip takes a whole day and he must always be prepared for any type of accident.  He earns an average of 60 PEN a day.  On weekends he has more passengers and can do two trips, depending on the number of people requiring his services.  Now he wants to go into the Internet services business for young people and adults who do not have Internet at home.  He has already taken the first step buying computers and installing a network.  He needs more working capital and joined the association because he is sure he can meet his objectives.  He belongs to the communal bank "Conopa" and this is his first loan through MFP.  He is counting on your support since he has many plans.  He is committed to paying back the loan on time.  Wilfredo plans to use the loan to buy two new computers for his business.

loans.use: To buy two computers.

loans.name: Marinela

texts.es:
Marinela a sus 27 años de edad es madre de dos hijos de 9 y 4 años de edad respectivamente, por quienes lucha y trabaja incansablemente para brindarles un mejor bienestar y quienes son a su vez las personas que le dan la fuerza para seguir adelante y continuar con su negocio, una sala de belleza en la cual trabaja desde hace un año desde las 9:00 a.m. hasta las 8:00 p.m. Todo el conocimiento adquirido es gracias a su padre quien le paga los estudios para que aprenda todo lo relacionado a este arte de la belleza y así poder ella generar sus propios ingresos.

Marinela espera comprar insumos para su negocio y hacer algunas adecuaciones locativa, ya que debe pintarlo puesto que tiene una humedad la cual esta dando un mal aspecto para su local; de esta manera Marinela espera poder brindar a sus clientes un espacio mas agradable, posicionar su sala de belleza  y aumentar sus ingresos. En un futuro desea tener su propio local donde pueda atender a sus clientes de manera personalizada y así garantizarles a sus dos hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marinela is 27 years old and the mother of two children, ages 9 and 4.  She works tirelessly to give them a quality lifestyle and they are the ones who give her the strength to get ahead and continue with her business which is a beauty salon.  She works from 9:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m.  All of the expertise she has is thanks to her father who paid for her studies so she could learn all there is to know about the beauty profession and generate her own income.

Marinela wants to buy supplies for the business and renovate the salon.  She must paint it because of the humidity which has caused damage.  Marinela wants to offer her customers a nicer location as well as upgrade the business and increase her income.  In the future she would like to have her own shop and give customers more personalized attention.  This is to provide a better quality of life for her two children.

loans.use: Comprar insumos para su trabajo y hacer algunas adeciaciones locativas en su negocio.

loans.name: Erdenetsetseg

texts.en: Erdenetsetseg is 33 years old and lives with her son in ger (Mongolian yurt) in Baganuur province, Mongolia.  Her son is a school student. She started her garment and accessories retail business in 2006 by renting a counter in the market. She found out that her customers demand more high quality products therefore she needs to buy some higher quality garments and accesssories to keep up with the market. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says "I am the only one supporting my son therefore, I need to do everything I can to make my son happy." She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT to buy luxury, such as a pendants or earrings to sell in the new year.

loans.use: To buy higher quality items, such as a pendant or earrings, to sell in the new year.

loans.name: Alicia Stella

texts.es:
Alicia sigue participando en el banco comunal “Comuzone III” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco y ella sigue dedicándose a la venta de comida y venta de productos de belleza. En esta oportunidad Alicia solicita el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, fideos, aceite y otras cosas más. 

Alicia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
Alicia continues to participate in the Communal Bank “Comuzone III” which is part of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco. She still sells food and beauty products. Alicia is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy more supplies such as sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, noodles, oil, and other products.

She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, noodles, oil, and other supplies.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es: La señora Mariela esta dedicada desde hace dos años aproximadamente a la elaboración y venta de comidas típicas de la región del chocó puesto que es esta la cuidad de origen y donde creció la señora Mariela y en donde pudo aprender de un familiar la elaboración de varios platos típicos. Los productos terminados los vende a las afueras de su casa en el municipio de Bello localizado al norte de la ciudad de Medellín todos los días desde las 4:00 p.m hasta las 9:00 p.m. La señora Mariela requiere de la compra de insumos para elaborar sus productos tales como verduras, condimentos y pescado con el fin de poder aumentar su producción y sus ventas. El sueño de la señora Mariela es tener su propio restaurante y brindarle educación a sus dos hijos.
texts.en: For about two years, Mariela has worked preparing and selling typical food of the Chocó region, since this is her city of origin and where Mariela grew up and was able to learn from a relative how to prepare various typical dishes. She sells the finished dishes outside her home in the municipality of Bello located to the North of the city of Medellín everyday from 4:00pm to 9:00pm. Mariela needs to buy the inputs, such as vegetables, condiments and fish, in order to prepare her products and be able to increase her production and sales. Mariela’s dream is to have her own restaurant and provide an education for her two children.

loans.use: to buy inputs to prepare food.

loans.name: Iveth Mirella

texts.es:
Iveth Mirella  vive en Mala, Perú. Ubicado alrededor de una hora y media al sur de Lima, Mala, con sus playas de arena, ruinas pre-incas, y la producción del adorado licor nacional, el Pisco (una especie de aguardiente de uva), ha sido durante mucho tiempo un destino turístico para los peruanos adinerados. Mala es una ciudad cálida y tranquila con una gran población afro-peruana, los restos de un camino indígena, y las influencias del imperio español. La ciudad, junto con otros cerca de la costa del Pacífico, fue dañado durante los terremotos sucedidos los años 2001 y 2007 en Perú, pero ha soportado el embate de la naturaleza como lo ha hecho durante gran parte de su historia.  Como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que más le agrada a  Iveth es  la milanesa. 

Iveth estudió hasta quinto año de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar  Diseño Grafico. Iveth es madre soltera tiene un pequeño de tan solo 1  año de edad; ella  es muy luchadora y tenaz, se dedica a la  venta de futas  y le dedica a este trabajo alrededor de 10 horas diarias,  ella desde niña aprendió lo que es ganarse el pan con el sudor de la frente ya que desde  pequeña apoyaba a su madre en la venta de frutas lo cual la animo a tener su propio negocio ya que aprendió muy bien como es el manejo del mismo .En un día Iveth puede atender hasta  70 clientes aproximadamente y esto le permite  ganar aproximadamente hasta S/. 400 diarios y en un buen día puede ganar  hasta S/. 650,  lo que le ayuda en algunos gastos adicionales del hogar, en especial los gastos de su bebe de 1 añito; ella cree que el éxito de su negocio se da por la variedad y calidad de los productos que ofrece. 

Actualmente ella agradece mucho a los  prestatarios Kiva porque gracias al apoyo otorgado ha podido comprar loa andamios y los materiales para su negocio. Esta mejora podrá ayudarla a mejorar su negocio y con ello obtener mayores ingresos  para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y así poder en algunos meses tener un puesto de ventas en su casa en donde ofrecerá frutas para posteriormente vender gaseosas al por mayor, con ello seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y con ello la ayudará a cumplir más adelante su gran sueño” Tener una distribuidora de gaseosas."
texts.en:
Iveth Mirella lives in Mala, Perú, which is located about an hour and a half south of Lima.  Known for its sandy beaches, Pre-Incan ruins, and production of the beloved national liquor, Pisco (a type of grape brandy), Mila has long been a tourist destination for wealthy Peruvians.  Mila is a warm and quiet city that has a large Afro-Peruvian population.  The remains of an indigenous trail are located here and the influence of the Spanish empire is evident. The city, along with others near the Pacific coast, was damaged during the earthquakes in 2001 and 2007 but bore nature’s beatings as it has for much of its history.  As is well known, Perú is characterized by the most delicious meals in the world and one of Iveth’s favorite dishes is milanesa (a typical meat dish dipped in egg and bread crumbs).

Iveth studied until the fifth year in high school but would very much like to study Graphic Design.  Iveth is a single mother and has a little boy who is only one year old.  She is very tenacious and works about ten hours a day selling fruit.   When she was a little girl, Iveth helped her mother sell fruit and learned what it means to earn bread from the sweat of the brow.  This experience encouraged her to have her own business and she has well learned how to manage it in the same way.  On any given day, she may have as many as 70 customers and this allows her to earn approximately S/. 400 daily.   On a good day she may earn S/. 650, which helps her with some of the extra household expenses, especially the expenses for her one year old baby.  She believes that the success of her business is due to the variety and quality of the products she offers.

Today, she is very grateful for the Kiva loans because thanks to the support offered, she has been able to buy scaffolding and materials for her business.  This improvement will help her to increase her business and obtain better income in order to improve the quality of life for her family. In addition, she will be able to have a sales stand in her home in a few months where she will offer fruits and later sell wholesale soft drinks.   She will use the loan to continue investing in her business and it will help her in the future to fulfill her great dream: to have a wholesale soft drink business.

loans.use: to purchase scaffolding and materials.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: La señora   Bertha  se dedica a la venta de comida en un restaurante que se encuentra en una zona comercial de la zona el tejar,  es separada de su esposo y tiene  dos hijos que están en la edad universitaria, anteriormente trabajo en grupo solidario" Leo" demostrando puntualidad y mucha responsabilidad es madre sola que con el negocio de su pensión saca adelante a sus hijos,  el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de un refrigerador y  abarrotes, la  cliente se siente  muy feliz y agradecida de seguir trabajando con la institución ya que gracias a su apoyo salió adelante y creció en su negocio, el deseo de la Sra. Bertha el de ver a sus hijos profesionales y de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bertha sells food at a restaurant in a commercial zone of the Tejar area.  She is divorced and has two university-aged children.  In the past she belonged to the communal bank "Leo" and demonstrated punctuality and responsibility as a single mother who, through her food business, was able to provide for her children.

She plans to use the loan to buy a refrigerator and groceries.  She is very content and grateful to continue working with the institution which has given her support to get ahead and grow her business.  

Mrs. Bertha's goal is to see her children become professionals so the family's quality of life can improve.

loans.use: To buy a small refrigerator and groceries.

loans.name: Mujeres Al Poder 4 Group

texts.en:
Lesbia is the coordinator of the Mujeres Al Poder 4 (women in power) Group. The members live in the slums located to the north of Santo Domingo. This group is located in one of the poorest communities to the north of Santo Domingo. Lesbia sells silver jewelry. This is the first loan she has requested from Esperanza, and she is planning to purchase rings, necklaces, bracelets, earrings and other accessories. She is very excited about this loan which makes it possible to reinvest in her business and expand her sales into more products and clients. 

Lesbia tells us that her challenges have been to start her business and to study. For her business, she saved a small amount of money and bought some accessories almost a year ago. She is the mother of a child and they live together with her long-term partner. Her business profits will be used to reinvest in her business. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy silver jewelry to sell

loans.name: Naiemeh

texts.en: Naiemeh is a 33 year old married woman who has 3 family members from Jubaiha Amman Jordan.She is requesting a loan of 800 JD to pay for cosmetics products and accessories to sell.She hopes to open a shop and she would like to increase her family income in the future.

loans.use: to pay for cosmetics products and accessories to sell

loans.name: Debora

texts.es: Débora es una joven trabajadora que se dedica en la mayoría de su tiempo a la atención de su tienda de barrio la misma que abre desde las seis de la mañana y cierra a las diez de la noche salvo que algunos vecinos por urgencia puedan tocarle la puerta, es ayudada por su tía abuela cuando ella sale a cumplir contratos de limpieza esporádicos que la contratan una empresa de servicios siendo esta generalmente una vez por semana y medio tiempo. Su tienda de barrio esta surtida la misma que tiene y vende desde pan, dulces, galletas , gaseosas de la mayoría de las marcas conocidas, los cuales le surten dos veces por semana, también vende cerveza y todos los insumos de cocina  para que las amas de casa de su sector puedan comprarle.Tiene necesidad de surtir su mercadería para incrementar sus ventas de fin de año y festividades venideras.
texts.en: Débora is a hardworking young woman who spends most of her time working in her neighborhood store. She works there from six in in the morning and closes at ten at night, unless some neighbors knock on her door, needing something urgently. She is helped by her great aunt when she has to go out and works with occasional cleaning contracts with a services company, usually once a week, part time. Her neighborhood store is stocked and she sells everything from bread, candies, cookies, and sodas, most of them brand name. She stocks it twice a week. She also sells beer and all kinds of cooking ingredients for the housewives in her area to buy from her. She needs to stock her merchandise to increase her sales for the end of the year and winter festivals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Manasse's Group

texts.en:
Manasse’s Group has seven group farmers and is located in Webuye District. The group leaders in this group represent a total of 68 individual farmers (not pictured) who are each asking for an average loan of KES 5,349 (shillings) to purchase a One Acre Fund package for ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. As the Kiva group representative, Manasse is pictured on the right of the group, with his hand raised.							

Manasse is married and he has eight children. He is 68 years old and is known as friendly, hard-working, reliable, trustworthy, and an experienced farmer. He is active in his community, in groups such as the men's group, savings group, prayer group, and burial committee. Manasse has been a farmer for 30 years. He described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year, by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  							

Manasse joined One Acre Fund in 2012 and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader. He joined One Acre Fund, so that he could get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and earn enough money to feed his family and send his children to school. 

Because he likes being a leader and is an active community member who wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers, Manasse has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund, as a group leader and Kiva representative. Working with One Acre Fund has improved Manasse's life because he has more profits from harvest, has more farm training, has more farm group support, and was able to save money and feed the family.  

In the future, Manasse hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to send his children to school, repair the home, save for the future, buy a cow, buy a goat, and invest in a business.  

Manasse's Group needs a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. 

One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.	

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Pastora Del Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora Pastora del Rosario, se dedica a la elaboración y comercialización de tortillas desde hace 20 años, ella ha realizado esta labor para la mantención del hogar ya que es padre y madre para sus hijos.  

Doña Pastora, se acercó a Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito el que utilizo  en la Compra de maíz, cal y leña al por mayor, dichos productos son empleados en la elaboración de tortillas, lo cual le permitirá aumentar su capital de trabajo y mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Compra de maíz, cal y leña

loans.name: Koudjo

texts.en:
Mr. K. AGBAK. was born in 1970 at Gati, district of Zio. Married and father of two (02) children, his main activity is engine oil marketing. The beginning of this activity was not easy owing to lack of financial resources. But with courage and determination, Mr. AGBA managed to overcome difficulties and provide for his family’s needs. With the increasing use of motorbikes by the population of Togo, mainly in the capital city, the demand for engine oil is on the rise, and Mr AGBA fails to meet the needs of engine oil. He therefore wants to increase the volume of his stock of engine oil so that he can meet his customers’ needs, and have a source of income for the welfare of his family. The financing of $ 650 he requested will help him keep his stock of engine oil, constantly renewed.

Monsieur AGBA K. est né en 1970 à Gati dans la préfecture du Zio. Marié et père de deux (02) enfants, il a pour activité principale le commerce d’huile à moteur. Les débuts de cette activité n’ont pas été faciles à cause du manque des moyens surtout financiers. Mais grâce à son courage et à sa détermination, Monsieur AGBA est arrivé à surmonter certaines difficultés et parvient à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Aujourd’hui, avec l’utilisation sans cesse croissante des moto pour les togolais, surtout dans la capitale, Monsieur AGBA a une demande de plus en plus forte en huile à moteur qu’il n’arrive pas couvrir. Il veut donc augmenter sa capacité en matière de stock d’huile à moteur et pouvoir satisfaire ses clients. Ce qui lui permettra d’avoir une source de revenu pour le bien-être de sa famille. Le financement de qu’il sollicite servira à s’approvisionner régulièrement et en quantité en huile à moteur.

loans.use: To buy, stock and sell engine oil

loans.name: A. Adjewoda

texts.en:
Mr. Adjewoda A. N. was born in Togoville and lives in Tabligbo. He is a married father of 4 with two brothers under his care. He leads a happy life with his family despite their unenviable financial situation. A substitute caretaker at the WACEM company in Tabligbo, he is not employed full time, and his income does not allow him to make ends meet. He is in need of $1000 to purchase a corn mill. He is quite skilled in mill operation. Financing this project will allow him to better care for his family.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur N. A. Adjewoda est né à TOGOVILLE et demeure à Tabligbo. Il est marié et père de quatre (04) enfants avec deux (02) frères à charge. Il mène avec sa famille une vie heureuse malgré leur situation financière peu enviable. Gardien remplaçant à la société WACEM de Tabligbo, il n’a donc pas un emploi en plein temps et ses revenus ne lui permettent pas de s’en sortir sur le plan financier. Il a besoin d’une aide de $1000 pour le financement d’un moulin à maïs. C’est quelqu’un qui maîtrise bien la gestion d’un moulin. Le financement de ce projet lui permettra de moeux s'occuper de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase and install a corn mill

loans.name: Alisher

texts.en:
Alisher is a farmer. He has been engaged in this activity for over 12 years. He has 5 cows, 5 sheep, 20 hens, and some turkeys. He used his last loan to purchase a cow and one hog. Recently one of his sheep bore twins. Now Alisher is requesting a loan for purchasing ducks. There is a big demand for ducks eggs in confectioner's stores. Chicken eggs are expensive and it takes twenty eggs to make one liter, and as for ducks it takes only 15 eggs for one liter.

Alisher has 3 children. He lives in a house with his parents and his brother, who also has a family. Now they save money for purchasing land and to construct a house for his brother.

loans.use: livestock

loans.name: Leticia Isabel

texts.es:
Leticia is 29 years old, married and has 2 children. Her husband works as a delivery man at a store while she has a small grocery store in their house. She belongs to the group Angeles 4, of which another member is Anita López Santis, who also has a grocery store. Both women hope to use the loan to buy large amounts of merchandise and share it between the two of them; this way they can reduce costs and gain more profits.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

LETICIA TIENE 29 AÑOS , CASADA CON 2 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN UNA TIENDA COMO REPARTIDOR A DOMICILIO.ELLA TIENE UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN SU CASA . PERTENECE AL GRUPO ANGELES 4 JUNTO CON DOÑA ANITA LOPEZ SANTIS QUIEN TAMBIEN TIENE UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES .AMBAS ESPERAN INVERTIR SU PRESTAMO EN COMPRAR GRANDES CANTIDADES DE MERCADERIAS LAS QUE SE REPARTIRAN PARA DISMINUIR EL COSTO DE COMPRA Y ASI OBTENER MAYORES GANANCIAS AL VENDER.

loans.use: TIENDA DE ABARROTES

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a second-hand car.

loans.name: Axolussi

texts.fr:
Born in 1952 in Bè, Mrs. Axolussi G. is married and has four children. She comes from a poor family and was unable to attend school. Her main business is growing and selling vegetables. Greatly upset and affected by the floods that deplete her harvest, she is asking for a loan of $300 to buy machines that will draw water from her land and increase the area she can cultivate. This sum will enable her to increase her income and help her husband send their children to school.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1952 à Bè, Madame G. Axolussi est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Issue d’une famille pauvre, elle n’a pas pu fréquenter. Son activité principale est la culture et la vente des légumes. Très gênée et dérangée par l’inondation qui fait que ses récoltes sont très insuffisantes, elle sollicite un crédit de $300 pour acheter des machines pour aspirer l’eau et agrandir son espace cultivable. Cette somme lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus et aider son mari à pouvoir assurer la scolarisation des enfants.

loans.use: To buy a machine and increase cultivable land

loans.name: Gulbaniz

texts.en: Gulbaniz is 39 years old and lives in Yenikand village with her husband and two children. She has run her own farm for the past 19 years. Gulbaniz has requested a loan of $1200 to buy pesticides and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
I am Nasreen R.. I am married and a mother of five: three girls and two boys. I live with my family in a two-room brick house in a mid-size town--Multan, Pakistan. My husband is a daily wage laborer and constructs buildings; along with this work he operates a grocery store. He plans to expand his store so that he can quit his construction work. We need a loan for this purpose.

My group members who are in needs of loan are: Sughran R., who plans a loan for their fruits business; Riffat P., who needs a loan to buy cloth; Nasreen I., who needs a loan for her husband’s grocery store; Khalida H., who intends to buy cloth for her business with your loan.

loans.use: Expand grocery store

loans.name: Savriniso

texts.en:
O. Savriniso is 37 years old. She is married and has three children. The eldest one is 15 years old, while the youngest is 12. 

For the past five years, Savriniso has been earning income selling the fabrics used for making national dresses which in Tajikistan are very beautiful and colorful. They are also an important item of the dowry of any girl. Savriniso is very polite and has a very good taste; she is ready to advise her clients on their choice of fabric for garments for various family occasions.  Savriniso's husband works in the City Telephone Station. He is able to support the family by himself; however, he also supports Savriniso in her intention to contribute to the family's earnings. 

At the moment, Savriniso needs a loan of US$1,000 for a term of 4 months. She plans to spend the loan for purchasing new fabrics in order to generate more income. Savriniso is thankful for support and promises to repay the loan in time.

loans.use: Purchase of materials used for making national dresses

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
Flor sells fruit in the main market of Tarapoto, San Martin. She’s had her business for 3 years. It has grown yearly and now she has many loyal customers. At the stand she rents from the municipality, Flor sells bananas, oranges, guava, guanabanas, and mandarins.

Flor is 51 years old, has 3 children, and married. She is glad she started her business. Now she has a lot of friends, greater independence outside of the home, and can help pay for her children’s education. She doesn’t argue as much with her husband as she has more control over her family’s expenses.

A member of the community bank Las Orquideas, Flor is requesting a loan of S/. 1,500 to repay over 6 months. With the extra capital Flor would like to buy more fruit and start to sell Juane (chicken and rice wrapped in palm leaf).

loans.use: She would like to buy more fruit and start to sell juane

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel R. R. serves food and runs a general store from her home in a rural suburb of Pucallpa. Neighbors and friends come to her home to eat and drink on her beautiful porch. In the morning Isabel serves sandwiches and juices. At lunch time, she serves home cooked Peruvian meals. At night she has a grill and cooks steak, chicken, and cow heart.

Isabel is 55 years old, has 3 children and is married. Her children are grown, and she is more than happy to help care for her grandchildren. Isabel wants to continue to work hard, save money and invest in her businesses.

A member of the community bank Mujeres Empresarias, Isabel is requesting a loan of $375 to repay over 6 months. With the extra capital, Isabel will buy ingredients for her restaurant and restock her shelves. These ingredients include sugar, oil, rice, milk, meat and much more.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her restaurant and restock her shelves

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is married with 6 children, ages 26, 21, 11, 10, and 6. She sells juice, and started this business a year ago. From her sales, she makes about $170 a month, working from 7am to 9pm daily.

Maryam hopes for a loan to buy more juice ingredients in order to expand her business. She is a member of the Tusikose Yote loan group, whose members guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more juice ingredients

loans.name: Dodji

texts.fr:
Mrs. Dodji D. was born on May 29, 1965 in Lomé. She is married and is the mother of four children. In 2001, she opened a dressmaking shop she calls COUTURE LA VICTOIRE, in the district of Agoè. The fashions she creates and the rapidity of her service have won her the confidence of her clientele.

This first loan that she is requesting will allow her to acquire a second sewing and embroidery machine to better serve her customers and make her apprentices' work easier.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame D. Dodji est née le 29 mai 1965 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. En 2001, elle a ouvert son atelier de couture dénommé « COUTURE LA VICTOIRE » dans le quartier d’Agoè. Les modes qu’elle créées et la rapidité dans ses services sont des atouts pour elle à gagner la confiance de ses clients.

Le premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acquérir une deuxième machine à plinte pour mieux servir ses clients et de mettre à l’aise ses apprentis.

loans.use:
Purchase of a sewing and embroidery machine

Achat d'une machine à plinte

loans.name: Comite Mujeresparaguayas Group

texts.es:
This committee is located in the area of the 9th kilometer of Acaray de Ciudad del Este. It was formed when a neighbor from the area told the women that Fundación Paraguaya has a group credit program and also does trainings for small business owners interested in getting ahead in life.

The committee is made up of 15 women who, in addition to being home makers and heads of family, are working in order to bring home to their families the basic necessities of food, clothing, and education. Their various business are: clothing sales, food sales, small grocery stores, fruit and vegetable sales, cosmetic sales, silverware, plastic wares, and jewelry sales.

Additionally, they participate in community activities and work to have a small amount of savings. Now they are requesting a new loan that would allow them to buy new merchandise and materials. These ladies have good prior references.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Este comité pertenece a la zona del km. 9 Acaray de Ciudad del Este y se formo gracias a que un vecino de la zona comunico a las señoras que Fundación Paraguaya tenia un programa de créditos grupales y que al mismo tiempo realizaban capacitaciones para microempresarias, deseosas de salir adelante.

El comité esta constituido por 15 señoras ellas, además de ser amas de casa y cabeza de familia, trabajan para poder brindar a sus familias las necesidades básicas de comida, ropa y estudio. Las distintas actividades son: venta de ropas, comidas, despensas, venta de frutas y verduras, venta de cosméticos, cubiertos, venta de plásticos, y venta de joyas.

Además ellas realizan actividades comunitarias, y trabajan para tener un pequeño ahorro. Hoy ellas solicitan un nuevo crédito que les permita adquirir nuevas mercaderías e insumos para vender. Estas señoras poseen buenas referencias anteriores.

loans.use: To buy clothing, cosmetics, fabrics, threads, breads, soft drinks, sweets, cooking utensils, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Asrop

texts.id:
Asrop is accustomed to waking up early in the morning to prepare the merchandise for his business, which involves selling packaged rice in the morning market. By 3am Asrop and his wife are busy cooking the rice and various side dishes (meat , fish, vegetables) to take to the morning market. Asrop typically sells the packaged rice in the market at five 5am. After all the merchandise has been sold he returns home, usually by 9am, to help his wife with the small stall she runs out of their home. The customers are fellow salespeople at the market.

Through the DINARI foundation, Asrop has access to a loan that can be used to increase working capital so that he can greatly increase the amount of packaged rice that he can sell. From the proceeds Asrop can finance his child’s high school education.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Aarati, Kiva volunteer.

Sudah menjadi kebiasaan Asrop bangun pagi-pagi untuk mempersiapkan barang daganganya yaitu berjualan nasi bungkus di pasar pagi. Pukul 3.00 pagi Asrop dan istrinya sudah sibuk mulai memasak nasi dan bermacam lauk untuk dibawa kepasar pagi. Asrop biasa berjualan nasi bungkus di pasar pada pukul 5.00 sedang pulang dari jualan setelah barang dagangan sudah habis terjual, biasanya pada pukul 9.00 wita juga sudah ada dirumah untuk membantu kesibukkan istrinya yang mempunyai usaha warung kecil dirumahnya. Pelanggannya adalah sesama teman yang berjualan dipasar. Melalui Yayasan DINARI, Asrop mendapat pinjaman dana yang dipakai untuk menambah modal usahanya agar dapat menjual nasi bungkus lebih banyak lagi. Dari hasil keuntungan usahanya Asrop dapat membiayai anaknya yang sudah bersekolah di tingkat SMA.

loans.use: Add to working capital to purchase necessities for the business, including wrapping paper, uncooked rice, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: David Teofilo

texts.es:
David is 40 years old, living with his wife and 6 children, all of whom are in upper-level studies. Recently he has gotten involved in agriculture, since his parents were the main farmers in their area and now he wishes to follow in their footsteps. For this reason he is giving his very best to his lands, where he is busy all day long. The harvest is what gives him the most pleasure from his work, since he can pick the products that cost him so much work cultivating and caring. Nevertheless, the most difficult thing is acquiring the fertilizers necessary for his plots, since they are very expensive and they raise the level of investment required in production.

David draws strength from his 6 children, whom he supports so that they may become professionals. He wishes to invest in the various fertilizers he needs for his crops, so that next season he can increase his production and his profits.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

David tiene 40 años, vive con su esposa y sus 6 hijos jóvenes, los cuales cursan estudios superiores. Desde muy pequeño estuvo involucrado en la agricultura, ya que sus padres fueron los mejores agricultores de la zona y ahora desea seguir sus pisadas, por ello se esfuerza en ofrecer lo mejor de sí en sus tierras, en las que se ocupa todo un día.La cosecha es lo que más le agrada de su trabajo, ya que puede seleccionar sus productos que tanto trabajo le costó cultivar y cuidar, sin embargo lo más difícil es adquirir los abonos necesarios para sus chacras, ya que estos son muy costosos y eleva el nivel de inversión de su producción. David basa su esfuerzo en sus 6 hijos, a quienes apoya para que puedan ser profesionales. Desea invertir en la compra de abonos y fertilizantes, que requiere para sus productos y en la próxima campaña incrementar su producción y ganancias.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers for his agricultural lands

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
The communal bank "Vigrencita del Carmen de Huychu" was founded in September of 2002 and is currently in its sixth cycle. It is made up of 12 female clients.

This is a communal bank that was formed by members that live in the district of Guayllabamba in the community of Huychu, which is located in the Sacred Valley of the Incas, 50 minutes away from the city of Cuzco

The clients are female villagers dedicated mainly to agricultural work (cultivating corn, potato and other vegetables and raising small farm animals). The majority of the clients combine their agricultural work with commercial businesses (selling agricultural products and small farm animals) selling their products in local markets in small cities and as traveling salespersons in surrounding cities.

One aspect of the program that the clients appreciate is that Arariwa gives them the possibility to access credit, teaches them a culture of savings, and gives them monthly trainings.

Translated by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

El banco comunal “VIRGENCITA DEL CARMEN DE HUYCHU”, se fundo en septiembre del 2002, actualmente se encuentra en el VI ciclo, esta conformada por 12 socias mujeres. Es un banco comunal conformado por socias que viven en el distrito de Guayllabamba, comunidad de Huychu, ubicado en el Valle Sagrado de los Incas a 50 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Las socias son mujeres campesinas dedicadas a labores agrícolas principalmente (cultivos de maíz, papa y hortalizas, crianza de animales menores), la mayoria de las socias combinan las actividades agrícolas, con las comerciales (venta de productos agrícolas y animales menores) realizando las transacciones en las ferias locales de los centros poblados y comunidades aledañas como vendedoras ambulantes.

A decir de las socias, un aspecto importante que resaltan del servicio que la UMF. Arariwa les brinda es haberles dado por primera vez la oportunidad de acceder a un crédito, les enseñan a tener cultura de ahorro y reciben capacitaciones mensualmente.

loans.use: The clients use the loan to promote their agricultural and secondary commercial activities / Las socias utilizan el prestamo para la principal actividad la Agricola y actividades secundarias comercio.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Cachuy, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 7 años, sus dos hijos están el la escuela. Patricia tiene su negocio desde hace 5 años ella vende todo lo que es mercadería, mochilas, juguetes, regalos, Patricia vende frente al pesquero en el mercado módulo 1.

Patricia necesita un préstamo de 1.400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de juguetes ahora que empieza la campaña navideña. Desde que recibe los préstamos ha podido comprar más mercadería , y tener más variedades para vender y mostrar. Patricia sueña con irse de viaje, conocer muchos sitios.
texts.en:
Patricia is a member of the "Señor de Cachuy" Community Bank. She is married and has two children, ages 9 and 7, who are in grade school. Patricia has owned her business for five years. She sells all sorts of merchandise including backpacks, toys and gifts. Her sales stall is across from the fish vendor at the local market. Patricia needs a loan of 1,400 soles [about US$ 475], which she will invest in the purchase of toys, now that the Christmas shopping season is beginning. Since she started receiving loans, Patricia has been able to purchase more merchandise and has greater variety to display and sell. Patricia dreams of taking a trip and visiting many places.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of toys for sale at the start of Christmas shopping season

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
K. Firuza is an enterprising woman with a big desire of improving the quality of life of her family. She is a single mother of two children. Two years ago, she started offering her services as a seamstress to her neighbors and acquaintances. She began this business because she did not have a job and she needed to find an activity to support her children. She works in a tailoring shop where she produces national dresses for women. Now her children are going to kindergarten. She wishes her children to continue with their education. That is the reason that she needs to continue growing her business. 
She asks for a loan of 3000 Somoni ($900 USD) that will be invested in buying supplies to increase her production and cover her customers' demands. She commits herself to return the amount in 10 months. Help this family with improving the quality of their lives by contributing to the growth of Firuza’s business. They will sincerely thank you for it.

loans.use: Purchasing fabrics for sewing women national dresses.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
“The major reason I work hard is I want our business to prosper in order to save for the education of my three children, especially when they study in college,” Betty, who has a small store in their village, said. “I have been managing our store since 2008. I have to earn an additional income to help my husband who only has a limited income. He just relies on the harvest of our cornfield and other irregular jobs in our village,” she added.

Betty T. lives at Cabisera 18 Ilagan, Isabela, where she is married to Larry, a farmer who cultivates his own corn field. They have three children: Zyrene, five, a day care student; Jowell, 11, a grade six student, and her eldest son Joemer, 12, in his first year of high school. Theirs is a small agricultural-based community whose residents mainly plant rice, corn and vegetables for their living.

Betty is now requesting a loan in order to acquire different products to be sold to her co-villagers, including soft drinks, biscuits, noodles, salt, sugar, coffee, eggs, and other items which are in high demand.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products to sell in her store

loans.name: Estefana

texts.es:
La señora Estefana tiene una tiendita de abarrotes, ella vive en compañía de su mama ya que esta divorciada, pero aun y sin el apoyo de una pareja ella ha demostrado que con esfuerzo, constancia y dedicación se puede salir adelante.
Esta solicitando este crédito para el pago de unos proveedores y asi seguir surtiendo su negocio y obtener mas clientes.
texts.en:
Estefana has a small grocery store. She lives with her mother as she is divorced. She has shown that with effort, perseverance and dedication you can succeed, even without the support of a partner. She is asking for this loan to pay some of her suppliers and thus continue to run her business and attract more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay suppliers.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose W. is thirty-five years old. She is a married woman and has given birth to four children, two boys and two girls, who are currently in the basic school. Her husband is a farmer. He cultivates cassava, plantains, and other foodstuffs. Rose and her family live at their family house in Koforidua, a small town close to Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants of Koforidua are either in farming or buy and sell farm products. Very few people are in other types of business.

Rose buys and sells second-hand textiles. She buys textiles and all kinds of second-hand clothes including bedspreads, towels, ladies’ wear, etc., from Kumasi, a nearby city, and sells the goods in the market square in her community. She says she also treks to nearby markets to sell. Rose has been in this business for five years now and wants a loan to increase her working capital so that she can buy textiles in bales. She desires to help her husband take proper care of the family.

loans.use: To buy bales of second-hand textiles

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: Mrs. Phalla H., 44, is married and has 6 children, two of whom are construction workers, one is a day laborer, two are enrolled in a local school, while the youngest one still stays at home. The family lives in Trapaing Svay village in Takeo province. Mrs. Phalla H. is a farmer who cultivates rice on a plot of land. Her husband, Mr. Yoem Lort, earns income breeding cows. Since his business is doing well, he would now like to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Phalla H. has decided to ask for a loan to buy two additional cows for her husband's business.

loans.use: Purchase of  two cows for breeding

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es: Jacinta tiene 50 años, trabaja muy duro para darle lo mejor a sus hijos, vive en su propia casa, tiene 2 hijos; Roxana D. 13 y Bernardino D. 8, quiere mejorar su vida y sabe que trabajado duro lo logrará. Tiene una carnicería en el mercado Unión y Dignidad (Mercado importante D. la ciudad D. Puno), su puesto es muy concurrido, ya que trata a sus clientes con mucha amabilidad y respeto, tiene 20 años realizando esta actividad y espera que su negocio crezca y se convierta en uno D. los principales puestos del mercado. Jacinta disfruta D. conversar con sus clientes e informarles sobre el precio D. la carne, D. esta manera toma confianza y pueD. realizar una buena venta, lo más difícil para ella es conseguir la carne que venD., ya que solo adquiere D. buena calidad y en buen estado. Jacinta quiere mejorar su vida y sabe que tiene que trabajar muy duro para lograrlo. Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y responsable. Jacinta invertirá el dinero que solicita en comprar más carne para incrementar sus ventas y obtener mayores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Jacinta is 50 years old. She lives in her own home. She works very hard to give the best to her children, Roxanna who is 13, and Bernardino who is 8. She wants to improve her life and knows that she can achieve this by working hard. She has a butcher's stall at the Unión and Dignidad market, an important market in the city of Puno. Her stall is very popular because she treats her customers in a friendly way and with respect. She has been doing this for 20 years. She hopes that her business grows and becomes one of the major stalls in the market. Jacinta enjoys taking with her customers and informing them of the prices of the meat. This way they gain confidence and she can make a good sale. The hardest thing for her is getting the meat to sell because she only buys good quality meat. Jacinta wants to improve her life and knows that she has to work very hard to accomplish this. This is her first loan with MFP. She knows that she has to pay it back on time, and she is determined to do so. She is a happy and responsible member of her community bank. Jacinta will use the loan she is asking for to buy more meat to increase her sales and get a larger income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Kadia

texts.fr:
Madame  Kadia Koné est âgée de 55 ans,  veuve et mère de 6 enfants, elle vit chez son feu époux avec ses  enfants au quartier Bagadadji près de la mosquée de Guidjo Almamy de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elle a commencé le commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait des gâteaux à base de mil ou de riz (le Takoula). Après  plusieurs années passées auprès de cette dernière, elle commence à introduire petit à petit la vente de céréales à cette vente de Takoula  jusqu’à acquérir des expériences dans ce domaine. Elle jouit aujourd’hui d’une grande notoriété  et réputation dans son quartier. En plus  du secteur de l’alimentaire,  elle évolue également dans le secteur de la vente  du bois  de construction.
Afin de faire face à la demande clientèle dans la vente de céréales, elle fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est en relation depuis 3 ans. Après  3 prêts solidaires et 1 prêt individuel tous correctement bien remboursés, elle est à son 2ème prêt individuel.
Elle compte utiliser  ce prêt pour acheter, 2 tonnes de mil. Elle s’approvisionne  sur place  à Ségou auprès des producteurs et  vend en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au marché et à domicile. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel  de 150 000FCFA qui lui permettra de subvenir aux dépenses de la famille (surtout qu’elle est veuve).
texts.en:
Mrs. Kadia Koné, 55, is a widowed mother of 6 children. She lives in her late husband's house with her children in the Bagadadji neighborhood, near the Guidjo Almamy mosque in Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

She began working together with her mother who sold cakes made out of millet or rice ("Takoula"). After several years spent in her mother's business, she began to introduce, little by little, the sale of cereals in addition to the Takoula, until she became experienced in this activity. Today she is well-known and respected in her district. Besides selling foodstuffs, she is now also selling wood for construction purposes.

So as to satisfy the demand of her clientele for cereals, she came to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom she has been working for 3 years. After 3 solidarity loans and 1 individual loan, all correctly reimbursed, she is now on her second individual loan.

She intends to use this loan to buy 2 tons of millet. She buys right in Ségou from the farmers and sells retail, for cash or credit, to a clientele composed of men and women, at the market and out of her home. She expects to make a monthly profit of 150,000 F CFA which will allow her to support her family (given that she is a widow).

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing millet for re-sale

loans.name: Seepa

texts.en:
Seepa V., 33, is married with 6 children. She has 5 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and public 1 day a week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 120 Tala (~ 60USD).

She had 1 previous loan with SPBD. SPBD loans are Seepa’s only access to capital because she cannot qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase tools and materials for her plantation

loans.name: Félicienne

texts.fr:
H. Félicienne est née à Abomey dans le Département du Zou. Félicienne est mariée à AVOCEVOU Jacob. Félicienne est mère de deux enfants. Félicienne n'est jamais allée à l'école. Félicienne fut élevée par sa grande sœur. Félicienne aidait sa grande-sœur dans la vente de poteries et les plantes médicinales traditionnelles. Après son mariage, Félicienne s'est mise à son propre compte dans la même activité de vente de poteries. C'est grâce au crédit de ALIDé que Félicienne a pu amener son activité au stade où elle est aujourd'hui. Félicienne sollicite un troisième crédit de ALIDé pour augmenter le niveau de son activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
H. Félicienne was born in Abomey, in Zou County. She is married to AVOCEVOU Jacob and is the mother of two. She never went to school. Félicienne was raised by her older sister and used to help her to sell pottery and traditional medicinal plants. After getting married, Félicienne got started on her own in the same business selling pottery. Thanks to the loan from ALIDÉ, she was able to bring her business to the level at which it is today. She's requesting a third loan from ALIDÉ to increase her level of business in order to respond better to the demands of her customers. ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a truck-load of pottery

loans.name: Marilus

texts.es:
Marilus pertenece al Banco Comunal “LA FLOR DE LA CANELA 2 “    ella tiene 36 años de edad y vive en la Urbanización Municipal Mz. H6 Lt. 16, tiene 04 hijos y su esposo que es motocarrista (transportista).
Se inicio en la venta de plátanos y yuca, la primera vez que obtuvo un préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 con el cual pudo comprar algunas cosas para que se iniciara con su bodeguita.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1500.00 lo invertirá en la compra de un motor nuevo para su motokar en el cual trabaja su esposo y a la vez comprará mas productos para su bodeguita. 
El tiempo que ella viene trabajando con Manuela  Ramos se dio cuenta de que tanto ella como su esposo pueden trabajar para el bien de su hogar.
texts.en:
Marilus belongs to the La Flor de la Canela Community Bank. She is 36, and she lives at the Urbanización Municipal Mz. H6 Lt. 16. She has four children and her husband is a driver. She started out selling bananas and yucca. The first time she had a loan for 300 PEN she bought things to start a small grocery store. With this loan for 1,500 PEN she will buy a new motor for her “motokar” (three-wheeled motorized form of transport), that her husband uses for work. At the same time, she will buy more products for her little store. In the time that she has worked with Manuela Ramos,B she has realized how much she and her husband can work for the good of their home.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a motor.  Buy articles for her grocery store.

loans.name: Lucy Milagros

texts.es:
LUCY MILAGROS P. V., pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS VICTORIOSAS,” tiene 21 años, 1 hijo y su esposo es mototaxista.

Ella  vendía ropas y el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual lo invirtió en la compra de algunas prendas para luego venderlo a sus vecinos.Actualmente tiene una pequeña bodega.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes para surtir su tienda.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos, por ser una institución que sirve a la comunidad con el servicio que da, y con la ayuda que da a las mujeres de esta región.
texts.en:
Lucy Milagros P. V. belongs to the "Las Victoriosas" communal bank. She is 21 years old, has one son and her husband is a moto taxi driver. In the past she sold clothing and witht the first loan that she received from the Manuela Ramos organization was for 300 Nuevos Soles, which was invested in the purchase of clothing to sell to her neighbors. She currently has a small grocery store. With this loan of 1,000 Nuevos Soles, she will invest in the purchase of groceries to stock her store. She is thankful to Manuela Ramos for being an institution that serves the community and for the help that it gives to the women in the region.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various grocery items to stock her store

loans.name: Mhlullah Group

texts.en:
Mhlullah is the group leader of Mhlullah group. There are two members in this group and each of them wants to take a loan for her business. So they are requesting a group loan of 15,000 Afghani.

Mhlullah wants to take a loan for her husband who is a taxi driver.

Alluia wants to take a loan for her husband who has a shop that sells batteries.

So they are very thanking to Kiva lenders who are able to support all entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To use for her husband's taxi business

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina S. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 51 years old. Lina is widowed and has two adult children. To make a living, Lina owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motor cab services to local community members. Lina is just starting this business.

In 2006, Lina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,500 PHP from PMPC. Lina is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase side car to be attached to her motorcycle to improve the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Lina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a sidecar for her motorcycle

loans.name: Rosefely

texts.en:
Rosefely Q. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 63 years old. Rosefely is widowed and has 1 child. To make a living, Rosefely owns and operates a sari-sari (general) store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste etc., in the local community. Rosefely has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosefely joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosefely has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Rosefely is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Rosefely from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria S. is currently in the business of selling beer in the bar and is requesting a loan to stock more beers to sell. Victoria is 28 years old and is married with a husband who is a butcher. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan.
