The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more beers to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials for her business

loans.name: Ipon

texts.en:
Ipon M. is currently in the business of selling sweet patatoes and cassava and is requesting a loan to purchase irish patatoes to sell.  Ipon is 29 years old and is Married with a husband that is a teacher. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase irish patatoes to sell

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: La señora Beatriz, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Virtuosas”, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 41 años y es madre de 03 hijos, que aun dependen de ella y por los que cada día se empeña en seguir adelante.Se dedica a la venta de chorizos y cecinas, lleva 12 años trabajando con este negocio, ubicada en el Mercado Nº 01, le va muy bien ya que tiene bastante acogida y sus clientes ya la conocen. Nos cuenta que a diario, tiene muy buenas ventas. En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, comprará kilos de cecinas, chorizos y cecinas, para luego venderlos por kilos. Cree que si pone más entusiasmo y optimismo podrá cumplir con sus sueños.Dice: “Agradezco al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por haberme ayudado a salir adelante y a iniciar mi negocio con un capital, ahora me siento una mujer realizada y capaz”.

loans.use: Comprará cecinas y chorizos en kilos.

loans.name: Union Por El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El señor Humberto A. socio emprendedor y entusiasta, tiene 56 años D. edad, divorciado con  5 hijos mayores D. edad, su domicilio esta ubicado  en L. zona alta D. huaycan- distrito D.  Ate  departamento D.  Lima, trabajaba como obrero en una mina pero tuvo que dedicarse a otra actividad ya que L. mina en L. cual laboraba colapso y empezaron a realizar huelgas. 
Viene trabajando con Edaprospo- Prosperidad desD. hace 2 años, asume el cargo D. presidente D. L. alcancía comunal “Unión por el Progreso” L. cual esta  conformada por 11 socios quienes realizan diversas actividades como: reciclaje, venta D. ropa, venta D. comida, bodega y otros.
Humberto se dedica desD. hace 8 años a L. venta D. caldo D. gallina, el cual se encuentra ubicado a L. altura del ultimo paradero HGK - Huaycan. Con su reciente préstamo  planifica comprar una congeladora para conservar mejor sus insumos. Hasta el momento a logrado levantar las P. D.  su vivienda  con material noble (ladrillos) pero su anhelo es  terminar D. construirL. (techar, ponerle piso, etc.), para aperturar mas adelante una bodega.
texts.en:
Humberto A. is an enterprising and enthusiastic member. He is 56, divorced, and has five grown children. His house is located in the area of Alta Huaycan, Ate district, Lima department. He worked as a miner. He had to change to another activity because the mine in which he worked collapsed and they started strikes. He has been working with Edaprospo-Prosperidad for two years. He is the president of the Unión por el Progreso Communal Bank. The Communal Bank is comprised of 11 members who are engaged in different activities like recycling, selling clothes, selling food, and having a convenience store and other things. For eight years Humberto has been selling chicken soup. His business is located near the last HGK stop in Huaycan. With his recent loan he plans to buy a freezer to better preserve his supplies. Up until now he has been able to raise the walls on his house with decent material (bricks), but his goal is to finish building it (put on a roof, lay a floor, etc) in order to later open a convenience store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a freezer to better preserve his supplies

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: La señora Josefa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen D. la Inmaculada”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia D. San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 64 años y es madre D. 03 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes.El espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas D. salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio D. venta D. anticuchos en las fueras D. su casa donD. poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo D. actividad.  Sus ventas lo realiza  diariamente  a partir D. las 6:00pm. Tiene años trabajando en este negocio y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace. Con este préstamo D. S/ 3,000.00, comprará insumos como arroz en sacos, huevos, gallinas criollas para sus juanes y pollos desviscerados para sus anticuchos, asimismo utensilios D. cocina para brindar un servicio D. calidad.  Josefa, se siente muy tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento D. sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Josefa is a member of the "Virgen D. la Inmaculada" Community Bank, in the District of Tarapoto, San Martin Province, city of San Martin. She is 64 years old and is married with 3 children, all of whom are independent. She has a fighting spirit which has always defined her and has enabled her to move forward in life. Josefa began her own business by selling "skewers" outsiD. of her home, where she gradually became very well known among her customers and is how she works each day until 6pm. She tells us that her business is going very well and she is pleased with her accomplishments. With this loan, she intends to purchase bagged rice, eggs, creolle hens and pre-cut chicken pieces, as well as some cooking utensils/ serving utensils for her business. Josefa feels very much at peace and is content with what she does for a living, and thanks the Manuela Ramos Organization for their help towards the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprará insumos, para prepar sus comidas. (to purchase necessary ingredients for her catering service)

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa  es socia del  Banco Comunal “24 de Junio”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 38 años de edad y está casada. Se dedica a  la venta de artesanías.

La señora Rosa estudió primaria completa y  tiene 4 hijos.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela R. desde hace 1 año, su primer préstamo fue de  S/.300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de lana.

Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  de un toro.

Su deseo para el futuro es tener una tienda en Ilave y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

Lo que mas le gusta de su organización son las reuniones y los ahorros
texts.en:
Sra, Rosa is a member of the Banco Comunal "24 de Junio" (June 24 Community Bank). She lives in the Ilave district in El Collao province in the department of Puno. She is 38 years old, married and has four children. She earns a living selling crafts. Sra. Rosa is educated to primary school level. For the last year she has worked with the Manuela R. Movement; her first loan was for 300 soles and she used it to buy wool. She is now requesting a loan for 1,500 soles, which she will use to invest in the purchase of a bull. Her wish for the future is to have a store in Ilave where her children can work. The thing that she likes most about the Manuela R. Movement are the meetings and the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a bull

loans.name: Chen

texts.en: Chen C., 29, is married and resides with her husband in the Takeo province. She stays at home raising pigs to earn a living and is able to make about US$1.50 of profit a day while her husband is a construction foreman. On average, he makes US$3 per day. This couple has three children, two of who are students, and one is too young to attend. Chen C. would like to take out a loan of US$400 to raise chickens.

loans.use: To buy chickens to raise.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther es socia del Banco Comunal Fraternidad.
Esther es conviviente, tiene 36 años y 4 hijos, Esther vende abarrotes en general en la selva ayacuchana, a donde viaja una vez por semana, y de allá compra frutas y madera, para lo cual cuenta con carro propio.
Esther necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la reparación de su carro.
Los sueños de Esther son comprar un carro nuevo, terminar de construir su casa para la comodidad de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Esther is a member of the Fraternidad Communal Bank. Esther is 36, in a common law marriage, and has four children. Esther sells general groceries in the Ayacuchana jungle. She travels there once a week. She buys fruit and wood there, and she uses her own car for this. Esther needs a loan for 600 PEN to fix her car. Esther dreams are to buy a new car and to finish building her house for her children’s comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair her car

loans.name: Asaba Ahebwa Kyalisima Sophi Group

texts.en: Sophi K. is a 28-year-old, single business lady with three children. Two of her children are going to school. She deals in a grocery-store business, which she has been operating for almost two years. She is using the loan to purchase grocery items such as flour, tomatoes and vegetables for sale. Her hope is to try hard to change her standard of living and, more so, she dreams of building a house.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items such as flour, tomatoes and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Timothy Omong'ni

texts.en:
Timothy Omong’ini Barasa started his farm business in the year 1998 in Malanga, Busia district. He is a former accountant by profession, married and 70 years old. Timothy speaks with a passion for farming, and he says it’s the only way left to feed the family and the only way to make money for other daily needs at his home. 

He would like a loan of 20,000 KES which will go for hiring labor, expanding the farming area and acquiring seeds for the coming rain season.

loans.use: Expand farming business.

loans.name: Mirgosiddin

texts.ru: Бурхонов Миргосиддин проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 24 года. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Миргосиддин имеет среднее образование. Он более 6 лет занимается растениеводством. В этой деятельности ему помогает жена. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений. Миргосиддин хочет внести удобрения и получить хороший урожай.
texts.en:
Mirgosiddin B. lives in the J. Rumi region. He is 24 years old. He is married and has two children. His wife is a homemaker. Mirgosiddin has secondary education. He has been a farmer plant grower for more than six years. His wife helps him in this business. He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer. Mirgosiddin wants to use the fertilizer to have a good harvest.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Zib

texts.en: Zib is a 45 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Zib has owned a butcher shop since 1999. When he first started his business, he had some financial issues because of the cost his machines and also had difficulty finding the proper place to open his shop. He decided to open his shop because of his experience as another butcher's employee. Zib is known for his good quality meat. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase meat for his shop. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time; his previous loan was also to purchase meat. His clients are his friends, neighbors, and people from his region. In the future, he plans on improving his business and always providing his clients with the best meat.

loans.use: To purchase meat for his shop.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina B. is from the town of Poblacion, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old. Gina is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Gina owns and operates a business selling fruits like bananas in the local community. Gina has been engaged in her business for over twelve years and earns approximately $75 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Gina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Gina is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Tahera Sima Group

texts.en:
Pushton is the group leader of Tahera Sima group. She is a resident of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married with 4 children: two sons and two daughters who are school students. She owns a bakery where she bakes bread for all her neighbors. She is quite famous in her neighborhood for her business. 


She needs the loan to purchase flour and firewood to enable her business to grow. She hopes to have a shop, instead of working in her house, and to give her children a better education through her income.

loans.use: to buy flour and firewood for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Chavalas lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras, luchadoras y emprendedoras. La coordinadora es una señora de 33 años la cual se dedica al comercio de ropa usada e invertirá en la compra de pacas para tener más variedad de mercadería.
Sus compañeras de grupo son M.V una señora de 29 años quien comercializa naranja agrias y otras frutas y M. P la cual se dedica al destace de cerdo.
texts.en:
The Chavalas Group is composed of 3 hard-working, combative, and enterprising people. The coordinator is a 33 year old woman who sells used clothes, investing in packs of clothes in order to offer more variety of merchandise. Her companions in the group are M. V., a 29 year old woman who sells bitter oranges and other fruits, and M. P. who butchers pork.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING PACKS OF CLOTHING TO SELL

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La señora Andrea V. O., es madre soltera y habita en el barrio Las Conchitas, sus hijos son mayores de edad y le apoyan económicamente a sus gastos diarios, ella es agricultora de piña desde hace más de 15 años.

Uno de los principales problemas que ha tenido en sus labores diarias es la falta de agua potable que afecta la vida diaria de la familia, dentro de los planes para el cultivo esta la diversificación de las cosechas, es por la misma razón que solicitan de un préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas que brinden un mantenimiento óptimos a las cosechas, para su posterior siembra y la reproducción optima de una cosecha, esto les permitirá mejores condiciones económicas y/o el capital necesario para futuras inversiones.
texts.en:
Andrea Vilches O. is a single mother; she lives in Las Conchitas neighborhood. Her children are all adults and they help her out financially to meet daily household expenses. She's been a pineapple farmer for over 15 years. One of the main problems she has faced in her daily chores is the lack of potable water; this affects her family's daily life. Among her plans is crop diversification and this is why she's asking for funds: to buy farming supplies that will provide maximum care for her crops, for her subsequent planting and for the crop's optimal reproduction. This will provide better economic conditions and/or the necessary capital for future investments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
56-year-old Delia P. is from the town of Banga. She is married and has 12 adult children. To make a living, Delia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Delia has been engaged in her business for over 35 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In May 2009, Delia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Delia is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Delia from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Marvin Ronald

texts.es: El solicitante es soltero, no tiene carga familiar, vive con su madre la cual se dedica a la venta de comida. El solicitante se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en el mercado modelo. Solicita el credito para compra de mercaderias para su tienda
texts.en:
Marvin is single and has no family burden. He lives with his mother, who sells food. Marvin sells groceries in the Modelo market. He is requesting this loan to buy merchandise for his store.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital increase

loans.name: Aracely Judith

texts.es:
Aracely Judith Roció Vásquez, está dedicada a la venta de minutos  y quiere comprar un plan de minutos a celulares y una fotocopiadora para adicionar a su negocio este servicio y para ello està solicitando un credito a la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo por valor de $800.000 COP. Aracely  desde hace 3 años, buscando generar un ingreso,  prestó a una amiga $300.000 COP  a un interés del 15%, para emprender el negocio de vender minutos a celulares y a teléfonos fijos; con este  dinero compró sus primeros dos planes a sus operadores, una mesa y una silla e invirtió en la compra de dulces, para provechar el potencial de ventas de este sitio de trabajo que es muy visitado por transeúntes. 
Aracely tiene 9 meses de estar vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, desde ese momento,  su vida le ha cambiado para bien,  porque con estos financiamientos logró liberarse de créditos con  muy altas tasas de interés y este dinero conseguido con esta organización le ha permitido  mejorar su ingreso. Ella sueña con que su negocio prospere y adicionarle otros servicios como internet fotocopiado, buscando la forma de obtener otros ingresos  para sacar adelante a su hijo de un mes  de nacido y canalizarle un mejor futuro.
Aracely es una joven que se manifiesta sin problemas pero con muchas ganas de seguir trabajando y en las búsqueda de oportunidades que le permitan llegar a ser exitosa con el tiempo.
texts.en:
Aracely Judith Roció Vásquez sells phone minutes. She wants to buy a cellular phone plan and a photocopier for her business. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo in the amount of 800,000 COP. Aracely started her business three years ago in order to generate an income. She borrowed 300,000 COP from a friend at an interest rate of 15% so that she could start selling cell phone minutes and renting phone booths. With this money, she bought her first two cell phone plans, a table, and a chair to begin her operation. She also bought candy to take advantage of potential sales since many people pass by her location.

Aracely has been a member of Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo for nine months. From that moment, her life changed for the better because she was able to relieve herself of high interest loans and channel more of her money into improving her income. She dreams of having a prosperous business and adding other services such as Internet and photocopying. Aracely continues to look for other ways to generate revenue so that she can move her one-month-old son forward and provide him a better future.

Being a young woman, Aracely appears to not have any problems. She is eager to continue working and looking for opportunities to help her become successful over time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a photocopier & an additional cellular phone plan

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more seeds for his land

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Angel A. is from the city of Ozamiz City. He is 56 years old. Angel is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Angel provides transportation services. He has had his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Angel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000 PHP from PMPC which was used to to repair a vehicle used in the business and is requesting a new loan of 18000 PHP which will also be used to repair a vehicle used in the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Angel from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a vehicle used in his transportation business

loans.name: Phally

texts.en: Mrs. Phally S. is a widow with two daughters, both garment factory workers. She lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. In the photo, she is shown with her brother. Phally been a farmer, growing corn, since she was young. Besides farming, she also sells mangoes. Phally asked for a Kiva loan once before (click here to see her previous loan). She is now requesting $500 as her second loan to use for growing corn and to purchase additional corn on contract from the fellow villagers for resale.

loans.use: To use for growing corn and to purchase additional corn to sell

loans.name: Kiều

texts.en:
S. Kiều V. (20206030023) is a 43 year-old man living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  He is married and has 3 school-aged children. S. owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for sale. S. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month from it.

In 2009, S. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. S. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA, which was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. S. is now requesting a new loan of 7,840,000 VND which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by S. from SEDA. S. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand his business.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


S. Kiều V. (20206030023) là 43 tuổi Nam.  Anh ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Anh ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, S. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  S. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, S. kiếm được khoảng 4.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2009, S. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  S. hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của anh ấy/ anh ấy.  S. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác.  Anh ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.840.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua phương tiện vận chuyển để cải thiện công việc kinh doanh.  Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  S. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard C., 58 years old and married to Dinah Kiptarus, has been been blessed with eight children between the ages of 31 and 14. Richard supports a family of five, in that two of his elder children have their own families.

Richard has been in the farming business, his primary source of income, for the last 20 years, earning an average profit of Kshs 2,000 per month. Richard is borrowing Kshs 15,000 in his third loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase farm inputs: fertilizers for Kshs 7,000, maize seeds for Kshs 5,000, and labor for Kshs 3,000.

Richard plans to use the profits to expand the business and to educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to give the best education possible to those of his children still in school and be able to provide some support even to his married children.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Máxima Dolores

texts.es: Máxima Dolores D. C. de 61 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Salvador junto a sus dos hijas las cuales le ayudan a vender en el negocio. Máxima posee una venta de ropa para hombres y mujeres, así mismo comercializa ropa interior femenina, mantas para la cocina, y trapeadores. Su negocio está ubicado en el centro de San Salvador, uno de los lugares con más afluencia de la capital del país ya que es  una zona llena de muchos negocios, fabricas y paradas de buses, circunstancia la cual es muy beneficiosa para Máxima ya que ella se encuentra en una zona muy visible para la mayoría de personas. Desde hace más de 30 años que ella posee este negocio el cual le permitió darles todo lo necesario a sus hijos y que en la actualidad suple sus necesidades personales. Es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir su venta comprando mayor variedad de ropa en diferentes tallas y colores y de esta manera atender a más personas.
texts.en: Máxima Dolores D. C. is 61 years old and lives in the department of San Salvador with her two daughters who help her with the business sales.  Máxima sells men’s and women’s clothing, as well as women’s underwear, tablecloths, and mops.  Her business is located in the center of San Salvador, one of the places with the highest influx of capital in the country due to the fact that it is full of many businesses, factories and bus stops.  This is very beneficial to Máxima because she is located in an area that is very visible for most people.  She has had this business for more than 30 years and it has allowed her to provide everything necessary to her daughters and it provides her with her personal needs.  This is why she is requesting a loan so that she can build up her stock and purchase a greater variety of clothing (different sizes and colors) so that she will have more customers.

loans.use: To purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry E. is from the village of Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. He is 35 years old. Jerry is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, he owns and operates a motorcycle transport service. He has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately $75 a month for this activity.

In 2010, Jerry joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be his 1st loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson would like a loan to purchase cosmetics, cooking oil, sugar, rice and other domestic merchandise for reselling at his shop. He is married with four children. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He dreams of having a stable family socially, spiritually and financially. He hopes to grow his business into a big one in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics, cooking oil, sugar, rice and other domestic merhandise for reselling.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina R. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Mahayahay, Brgy. Daan Lungsod, Medellin, Cebu. She earns her living by operating one business venture: a general store  business.  Her husband Rhey R., who is 33 years old, also works to earn his living. They have one child who is 10 years old. 

Divina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Divina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 7th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her child. 

Divina R. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF: 

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.
"

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace Q. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 23 years old and married. She has a child who is 17 months old. To make a living, Grace raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for breeding. Grace wants to have her own savings so she works hard to improve her income.

Grace joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Grace is requesting a new loan of 6,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to purchase piglets and feeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feeds

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita T. is 56 years old, married and has four adult-aged children. She is from the barangay of Maquilao, Tangub City in Misamis Occidental province on the Mindanao islands. Jovita operates a general store from which she sells a variety of different products to the local community. She has been in business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Jovita joined GDMPC to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Jovita is requesting a new loan, her third from GDMPC, of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ey

texts.en:
Ey R., 38, produces cow ties (ropes that are used like leashes to keep the animal in place), earning an income of USD 3 per day. R. is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area that is known for Pre-Angkorian temples that were typically built before 800 AD. 

R.'s husband is a construction worker and buys cows to resell, earning an income of USD 6 per day. Each month, the family must spend USD 35 for food, USD 15 for electricity, and USD 100 for other necessities. R. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more nylon to produce more cow ties to sell. In the future, she hopesto use any additional profits to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more nylon to produce cow ties

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 42-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and two young children who are attending school. He worked as a furniture painter for 10 years and in 2008, he opened his own furniture painting shop.  He cooperates with his wife who works as a teacher in a local school to satisfy the family’s needs. He has obtained his first Kiva loan and he was a very good client with prompt payments.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase his inventory by getting additional products to attract more customers by offering them a larger variety of designs and paintings.

loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Ismanbek

texts.en:
Ismanbek S. is 37 years old and lives in Osh city, south of Kyrgyzstan. Ismanbek is known at his local area as an open-hearted and cheerful person, who likes to bring positive emotions to people. Seven years ago, in order to support his family, Ismanbek began his business in selling clothes. He started it with the selling jeans in Russia, but it wasn’t a very profitable activity. Ismanbek redirected his business in selling women’s clothes at the market of Osh. His success as an entrepreneur was achieved due to hard working and strong will in providing his family with all they need. 

Unfortunately, in June 2010, when violent clashes caused by the deposed political regime broke out in the Osh city, Ismanbek lost his business. His small shop was looted and robbed. But Ismanbek, being a very optimistic person, didn’t give up and decided to resume his lost business and continue activities. For this very reason, Ismanbek is applying for a loan of 135,000 KGS, which he needs to restart his activity. With the revenues, Ismanbek plans to improve his living conditions in order to enlarge his family with one more child. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Apolinario

texts.en:
Apolinario M. is a married man from the village of Bantay. He is 44 years old. 

To make a living, Apolinario plants and harvests rice for sale. Apolinario has been engaged in his business for over 22 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP every crop season.

In 2011, Apolinario joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Apolinario is requesting a loan of 22,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the first loan taken out by Apolinario from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital.

loans.name: Ibrahim M.

texts.en: This is 27 year-old Ibrahim.  He is married and has 2 children, aged 4 and 6 years. In 2004, Ibrahim M. K. established his assorted goods business. He began his business because he wanted a means to support his family.  Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 300,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000.  He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. In the future, Ibrahim plans to open another shop and hire workers   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: Purchase more food items for his shop

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa M. is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. Adjoa sells palm oil in Abrafo village. She has been in this business for over six years and is able to financially contribute to her household. 

Adjoa is requesting a loan to expand her business by purchasing more palm fruit so that she can extract larger quantities of palm oil to sell. She will set aside her increased profits for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase palm fruit and extract oil to sell

loans.name: Khoumayni

texts.ar: خميني عمره 27 سنة اعزب يعمل في محل لبيع الالعاب والهدايا والاكسسورات بالاضافة الى الجزادين والأحذية له في عمله سنتين يحب عمله ويريد ان يطوره يسعى الى زيادة مدخوله يطمح في تكوين عائلة وان يكون لها مستقبل جيد فهو طموح اعتمد على نفسه حتى يكون عمل خاص به وقد استطاع وهذا ما يميز عمله فهو له زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه يتميز بالدقة في العمل والجدية وله رغبة بأن يصبح صاحب متجر كبير في المستقبل يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة احذية وجزادين  وعطورات والعاب فهو مثابر على العمل وكان يواجه بعض الصعوبات بالمنافسة فلذلك يريد زيادة البضاعة وتطوير المصلحة
texts.en: Khoumayni is 27 years old and single. He works in shop which sells gifts, toys, perfumes and colognes, purses, and shoes. He has two years of experience in this business. He likes his work and he would like to develop his business. He is trying to increase his income, as he wants to start a family and to be able to provide a good future for his family. He aspires to be self-sufficient, and this is why he opened his own business. He has customers from his community and from among his neighbors. He stands out in his line of work due to his attention to detail and earnestness. He hopes to one day own a big store. With a loan from al-Majmoua, he would like to buy new goods for his store including new shoes, perfumes and colognes, and toys. Though he is diligent in his work, he's having difficulty competing with the other businesses in his sector of the market. He might be able to overcome these difficulties by buying more goods for his store.

loans.use: to buy more goods, including shoes, purses, perfumes, colognes and toys, for his store.

loans.name: Yenny

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yenny; ella tiene 25 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de venta de medicamentos, ella trabaja en una botica desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, la socia quiere ahorrar para construir su casa y de esta manera poder salir adelante y tener su casa propia. La socia solicita el préstamo para construir su casa y poder comprar materiales de construccion como cemento,yeso,arena y clavos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the San Rafael communal bank, located in the Cusco district in the province and department of Cusco.

The borrower is Sra. Yenny. She is 25 years old, single and alternates her daily activities working in a drug store.  She works from 7:00am to 10:00pm.  She is saving to build a house to be able to get ahead and have her own home.  She is applying for this loan to be able to build her house and to purchase construction materials such as cement, plaster, sand, and nails.

Sra. Yenny is grateful for the loan and promises to repay it in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement, plaster, sand, and nails

loans.name: Lucy N.

texts.en:
Lucy Njamb, a 31- year-old married mother of two children aged three and six years, operates a mobile money transfer service and sells CDs and DVDs in her retail shop. In business since 2007, she earns a monthly profit of Kenya shillings 12,000.

Lucy joined KADET just the other day and is now applying for her first loan to purchase more CDs and DVDs for her shop and to use as additional capital for the money transfer (M-pesa) business. The anticipated profits will be used to make her life more comfortable.

In the future she hopes to expand her M-pesa business and be a major supplier of DVDs and CDs.

loans.use: to buy more CDs and DVDs for resale and have additional capital for her  M-pesa business.

loans.name: Yang

texts.en: Yang, aged 48, is married and resides with her four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She raises pigs, earning an income of $1 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband who is a rice wine producer, earning an income of $2 per day. The family's standard of living has been improved since Yang and her husband have had these businesses. Yang is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase a motorbike for the children to commute to work. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Pour renforcer son activité des matériaux de construction, Mr Komi père de 02 enfants sollicite ce premier prêt pour acheter les matériaux. Sa femme est couturière. Il a commencé en 2009 en approvisionnant au Grand marché de Lomé et en revendant à son domicile.
texts.en: Komi, the father of two children, wants to strengthen his construction material business. He applies for this first loan to buy more materials. His wife is a seamstress. Komi opened his store in 2009. He gets his supplies at the great market in Lomé and resells in his home-based store.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy embroidery material for embroidery business.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: La señora Maritza se dedica a una pulpería. Vive en el municipio de quezalguaque, hace más de seis años, sus hijos le ayudan en la atención con los clientes, tuvo que hacerse cargo de toda su familia, ahora con mucho esfuerzo logró sacar su negocio adelante y puede cubrir los gastos de alimentación y educación con este negocio. Ahora piensa en el futuro de sus hijos a los cuales enseñó muy bien el negocio para que en un futuro ellos puedan valerse por sí mismos. Ahora solicita el crédito para poder comprar granos básicos, pan, refrescos, galletas, jugos y fósforos.
texts.en: Maritza owns a grocery store.  She has lived in the town of Quezalguaque for more than six years.  Her children help her to serve her customers.  She had to look after her whole family.  With a lot of effort, she managed to get ahead in her business and she can cover her family's food and education expenses with this business.  She is now thinking of her children's future.  She taught them the business so that, in the future, they can fend for themselves.  She is requesting this loan so that she can buy basic grains, bread, soft drinks, cookies, juice and matches.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, bread, soft drinks, cookies, juice and matches

loans.name: Edielito

texts.en:
Edielito is 47 years old and is married with 6 school-aged children. He earns about PHP 5,000 per month as a farmer working in the Philippines. 

Edielito grows rice farming and has been doing it for almost 30 years. Edielito is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase the needed agricultural inputs like fertilizers and pesticides.

In the future, Edielito hopes to have a plentiful harvest in order to earn income to support the needs of his family, especially the education of their children and for their daily basic needs. He believes that through patience and hard work, he can able to improve their status of living and give their children a better future.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Musu is 38 years old and she lives in the airport community. She is a university student and has three children between the ages of 3 and 10. They are all attending school.

For the past  two years, she been selling used clothes. She started her business with LRD 2,400. One thing that makes her proud about her business is that every day she makes some profit.

She is requesting a loan to purchase used clothes for her business. She hopes to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a hardworking 34-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with two children who are going to school. For the last 7 years, Grace has been selling scrap metal to make a living. Previously, she used to cultivate crops.  Grace wants in the next 5 years to have a metal manufacturing plant. Her dream is to own a piece of land. She is requesting for a loan of 20000 Kenya shillings to buy more scrap metal and to renovate her store. Thanks to Faulu Kenya she is now able to save.

loans.use: buy scrap metal and renovate her store

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La Sra. Elena pertenece al Banco Comunal “Noche de Luna II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Tiene 49 años, està y tiene cinco hijos de los cuales su hijo de 19 años vive con ella. El es estudiante de nivel superior en la carrera de Contabilidad. 
Elena es una mujer sacrificadora, siempre saliendo adelante por sus hijos. Desde hace 14 años se dedica a la venta de comidas preparadas y poco a poco incrementó su negocio de parrillas y asados de pollo, carne y juanes. Empezó con un capital inicial de PEN 300.00 y está muy satisfecha con sus logros obtenidos, cuenta con gran apoyo por parte de su esposo e hijo. Tiene una amplia clientela que es el público consumidor, le buscan por la amabilidad y el buen trato que les brinda. Con el nuevo préstamo de PEN 1,200.00 va a comprar productos para la compra de carbón y ingredientes como sacos de arroz, azúcar, aceites y además le gustarìa implementar sillas y mesas para así captar nuevos clientes, su negocio está bien ubicado. Su sueño es integrar a su negocio presente la venta de abarrotes y verduras para el consumo diario. Está muy feliz por ser parte del Movimiento Manuela Ramos y està agradecida por las oportunidades que le da.
texts.en:
Sra. Elena belongs to the communal bank “Noche de Luna II” (Night of the Moon II) in Tarapoto District, which is in the Province and Department of San Martín. She is 49 years old, married and has five children.  Her 19 year old son lives with her.  He is an upper level student majoring in Accounting.
Elena is a self-sacrificing woman, always trying to get ahead for the sake of her children.  For 14 years, she has made her living selling prepared food and growing her grilling and roast chicken, meat and juanes (a local dish of stuffed bijao leaves) business.  Sra. Elena started with an initial capital of PEN 300.00 (roughly $112 USD), and she is quite satisfied with how far she has come.  She has both her husband's and her son's support.  She has a large clientele amongst the purchasing public.  They seek her our for her friendlessness and the good service she offers.  With the new loan of PEN 1,200.00 ($450 USD), Sra. Elena will purchase products like charcoal and ingredients like sacks of rice, sugar and oils, and in addition, she would like to install tables and chairs to help attract new customers.  Her business is in a good location.  Her dream is to add grocery and fresh vegetable sales to her current business.  She is very happy to be with Movimiento Manuela Ramos (The Manuela Ramos Movement) and is grateful for the opportunities they offer her.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like rice, olives, charcoal and tables and chairs.

loans.name: Denkese Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe  DENKESE  sont tous des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, en moyenne  4 enfants et  vivant la plupart dans des  familles monogames à  SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles. Les prêts précédents ont été  tous correctement remboursés.
ADIARATOU, qui fait le commerce de parures et de tissus dans ce groupe de femmes   DENKESE, est debout en quatrième position de la gauche vers la droite, drap de lit sur la poitrine.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt 15 pièces de bazin riche et  30 paires de boucles d’oreilles, au grand marché de la ville  de Sikasso de Bamako.
 Elle les revend au  grand marché de Sikasso  à une place fixe et en famille à une clientèle composée pour la majeur partie de femmes, au comptant et en détail. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45.000 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en: The six members of the DENKESE group are all married women who are on average 30 years old with 4 children. Most of them live in monogamous families in SANOUBOUGOU, a working-class neighborhood of the city of Sikasso, the third largest administrative region of Mali. They are currently on their third loan with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their clients. All previous loans were correctly repaid in a timely manner. ADIARATOU, who re-sells cloth and jewels, is the fourth member from the left in the photo, pictured with a bedsheet in her hands. She plans to use her loan to purchase 15 pieces of bazin (a type of cloth) and 30 pairs of earrings from the big market in cities of Sikasso and Bamako. This merchandise is then re-sold in Sikasso through wholesale and individual packages, mostly to women customers. She hopes to make a monthly profit of 45,000 FCFA (approximately 93 USD), a part of which will be used to pay back the loan and the other will go towards her savings. She hopes to continue to grow her business in order to better satisfy her clients.

loans.use: purchase diverse articles for resale

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha es socia del  Banco Comunal “Central Vaquería”, ubicado en la parcialidad de Vaquería,  distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 36 años de edad, es  madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos.  Estudió la secundaria.
Desde hace un año trabaja con  el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en la compra de tres  ovinos para su negocio.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 nuevo soles comprará ocho animales, la señora cuenta que los animales los carnea y vende la carne en la ciudad de Arequipa y en el terminal pesquero, ella  viaja cada semana.  En el negocio le ayuda su hijo.
La señora desea tener su casa propia y un carro para trasladar la mercadería.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es  la alegría de las socias  y el ahorro.
texts.en:
Bertha is a member of the "Central Vaquería" communal bank, located in the neighborhood of Vaquería, district of Ilave, province of El Collao, department of Puno. She is 36 years old and a single mother of four children. She completed high school.
She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the past year. Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles, which she used to purchase three sheep for her business.
With her new loan of 2.000 nuevos soles she will purchase eight animals. She reports that she slaughters them and sells the meat in the town of Arequipa and at the fishing pier. She travels every week and she is helped in the business by her son.
She wishes to have her own house and a car to transport the goods.
What she likes about the communal bank is the joy of the members and also the savings.

loans.use: to purchase eight animals.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 26 years old, married, and the father of one child.

Hussein has been the owner of a barber shop since 2004. He has more than 7 years' experience, and he has a deep understanding of local consumers. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $3,000 loan to renovate and fix his shop’s ceiling, doors, and floor. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To renovate and fix his shop’s ceiling, doors, and floor.

loans.name: Bay

texts.en:
Bay is a 54-year-old married woman. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.

Bay and her husband have been earning a living by running a food stall from the door of their house for the past two years. They sell noodles and braised beef. 

She would like to borrow money to expand her business by buying a greater quantity of food to sell from her stall. She hopes that this will enable her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing a greater quantity of food to sell from her noodle stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her grocery shop and buy animal  feeds

loans.name: Zoila De Jesus

texts.es:
Zoila, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para fortalecer el negocio, y por la buena atención que recibe, ella invertirá este préstamo en la compra D. lociones, maquillajes, cremas, labiales y demás cosméticos, esta nueva compra le permite a Zoila ofrecer más y mejores productos.
Las condiciones D. Zoila como comerciante, han mejorado, dandole más oportunidad D. crecimiento.
texts.en: Zoila has decided on a new loan to strengthen the business and because of the good service she receives.  She will use this loan to buy lotions, make-up, creams, lipstick and other cosmetics.  This new purchase will allow Zoila to have more and better products on offer.  Zoila’s conditions as a merchant have improved giving her more opportunity for growth.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: Diana, de 31 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora. Esta separada de su esposo, pero vive en compañía de sus cuatro hijos de 13, 11, 9 y 7 años, habitando una casa que es de su propiedad. La actividad que realiza Diana  es la venta de ropas de diversas variedades y para todos los géneros, para lo cual viaja cosntantemente a la ciudad de Lima, lugar donde consegui la ropa a un menor precio. Sus cartera de clientes están sus amistades, profesores de los colegios, amigos recomendados , dejando a crédito o al contado. Desde hace 6 años que realiza esta activida, tiempo que le valió para ser conocida y ganarse la preferencia de una regular clientela. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el poder tener un ingreso económico con el cual solventar los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos, ya que estando sola, solo cuenta con la pensión que le pasa su ex pareja. Por otro lado, considera rentable su negocio ya que le deja regulares ganancias y cuenta con una regular clientela, dándole  una rotación constante a sus productos, por eso desea abrir una tienda de venta de ropa en su propia casa. Este será el crédito número 3 con la institución MFP, está muy agradecida con el préstamo recibido para avanzar con su negocio, por esto se compromete en ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de ropa de diversos modelos y para todos los géneros, buscando menores precios, así tendrá mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Diana, 31, is a hardworking, enterprising woman.  She’s separated from her husband but lives with her four children who are 13, 11, 9 and 7 years old in a house that’s her property.  Diana sells all sorts of clothes for both men and women.  To do so, she travels constantly to the city of Lima to buy clothes at lower prices.  Her client portfolio consists of acquaintances, school teachers, friends and referred customers; she sells on credit or for cash.  

She’s been in this line of work for six years and in this time she’s become well-known and has won over the preference of her regular customers.  What she likes about her work is having income to meet household expenses and be able to educate her children because since she’s alone she can only count on the allowance her ex-husband provides.  She considers her business to be profitable because it produces regular profits and she has a regular customer base which leads to constant turnover of stock inventory which is why she wants to open a clothing store at home.

This will be MFP loan #3.  She is very grateful for the loan she got to continue forward with her business so she commits to be punctual with her installment payments.  She will use the entire amount requested to buy clothes in various styles and for all genders and looking for the best prices so that her profits will be higher.

loans.use: to buy all sorts of clothes.

loans.name: Jeruk Manis 2 Group

texts.en:
Lince is a mother of two.  Her children are four and six years old.  The older one is of school age and is currently attending.  Lince has had a mobile phone counter since 2009 in front of her house.  Business has been steady and the income supplements her husband's income as a mechanic.  Together, they have been able to improve the well-being of their family. 

Long term, Lince hopes she can open a shop selling mobile phones, minutes, and accessories.  Additionally, she wants to be able to send her children to university.  

Other group members will use their loans to help their businesses which include selling yellow rice, making pastries, and selling side-dish food items.

loans.use: to pay for mobile phone minutes and accessories to sell to customers.

loans.name: Ana Sarai

texts.es:
Ana, esta solicitando nuevamente un prestamo ya que necesita comprarse insumos para la milpa, ya que tiene una nueva siembra y quiere mejorar la productividad fortaleciendo en su crecimiento con abono, tambien quiere prevenirla de cualquier plaga aplicandole herbicidad y plaguicidas, estos materiales son de mucha ayuda para la ejecucion de su trabajo.
Ella ha logrado por medio de estos prestamos salir con sus cosechas, ya que el anterior fue un exito, sacando una buena y abundante produccion.
texts.en: Ana is requesting a new loan as she needs to buy supplies for her corn crop.  She would like to improve her productivity and strengthen her crops' growth with fertilizer.  She would also like to avoid pests by applying herbicides and pesticides.  These materials are very helpful to her in carrying out her work.  Through these loans, Ana has managed to make progress with her harvests as her previous harvest was a success and she achieved good and abundant production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides

loans.name: Florentino

texts.es:
Florentino tiene 68 años edad y es viudo pero tiene ocho hijos, él nació en la provincia de Paruro del departamento pero actualmente él vive en la ciudad de Gamitana, él se dedica  a la agricultura donde siembre arroz, maíz y   plátanos, él también se dedica a la compra y venta de madera. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien.

Florentino en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para invertir en las chacras por lo tanto va comprar semillas y abonos y también para comprar herramientas. 

Florentino es integrante del grupo “Nuevo Amanecer de Gamitana” lo conforman 16 socios que viven en el Comunidad de Gamitana en la selva del Perú.
texts.en:
Florentino is 68 years old and widowed with eight children.  He was born in the Paruro Province in the Cusco Region and now lives in the town of Gamitana.  He works in agriculture, growing rice, corn and bananas.  He is also engaged in the buying and selling of timber. He has been working in this capacity for several years and is doing very well.

Florentino needs a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers and to buy tools.


Florentino is a member of the group "Gamitana New Dawn," which is comprised of 16 members living in the Gamitana community in the jungles of Peru.

loans.use: to invest in his farms by buying seeds and fertilizers as well as tools.

location.town: Gamitana - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Las Positivas Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Las Positivas” es un grupo conformado por 08 socios entre hombres y mujeres la cual llevan trabajando 02 años con el Programa- Prosperidad. Mercedes tiene 37 años de edad, es separada y tiene 03 hijos, actualmente sigue apoyando al menor de ellos. Mercedes cuenta con una tienda en su domicilio donde brinda productos de primera necesidad, aparte por las noches  vende frituras como alita broster, salchipapas y amburguesas, pues es así como se ha ganado la vida Mercedes y de esa manera ha sacado  adelante a su hijo. El deseo de Mercedes es de seguir creciendo en sus negocios, ya que eso le permitirá seguir apoyando a su hijo.  En esta oportunidad solicito el crédito para la compra de mercadería como gaseosas, agua, chocolates, galletas,  arroz, azúcar y leche. La Alcancía Comunal “Las Positivas” agradecen a los prestamistas Kiva ya que hacen posible su progreso.
texts.en: The Las Positivas community bank has 8 members--men and women--and has been associated with Programa-Prosperidad for 2 years.  Mercedes, 37, is separated and has 3 children, the youngest of whom is still in her care.  Mercedes operates a corner grocery where she sells the kinds of products that her customers need every day.  She also makes prepared foods--wings, salchipapas and hamburgers--that she sells in the evenings.  The businesses are her means of making a living and providing for her child.  Mercedes wants to continue growing the business so that she can go on supporting her son.  She will use this loan to buy merchandise--soft drinks, water, snacks, rice, sugar, milk, etc.--that she will resell.  The Las Positivas community bank is grateful to Kiva lenders for supporting their efforts to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Marcia Esmeregilda

texts.es:
Doña Marcia tiene 34 años de edad, esta casada y es madre de 2 hijos, Marcia se dedica al comercio,  su principal actividad es la venta de abarrotería (Pulpería) cuenta con más de 5 años de experiencia en la  administración del mismo, la Sra. Marcia ha sabido ganarse su clientela por la atención que les brinda y por los precios que les ofrece.
Ella utilizara el credito para comprar productos de la canasta básica como ser: Arroz, Frijoles, Maíz, manteca, azúcar, jabones, carnes, productos lácteos,  etc.  esto para tener mas variedad y ofrecerles a sus clientes productos de calidad.
las ganancias las necesita para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Marcia is 34 years old, married, and has two children.  She is a retailer and her main business is selling groceries.  She has a grocery store and has five years experience running her business.  Marcia has known how to attract customers through the service that she provides and the prices that she offers.

Marcia will use her loan to buy basic household products such as rice, beans, corn, butter, sugar, soap, meat, dairy products, etc. so that she has more variety and can offer her customers good-quality products.  She needs the profits from her business to support her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries, dairy products, basic grains, soft drinks, juices and bread

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora Eugenia tiene 52 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Itá, tiene una despensa bien surtida desde hace mas de 7 años. Nos comenta que su negocio está en su propia casa, desde donde surte a sus vecinos y a ocasionales clientes todo tipo de insumos de primera necesidad.
La señora Eugenia solicita el préstamo para aumentar su stock de productos, como ser azúcar, carnes, lácteos, panificados y otros productos debido a la gran demanda que tiene, esto la ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos familiares y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Ella agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de Kiva y fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
Sra. Eugenia is 52 years old and lives in the city of Itá. She has a well-stocked food pantry that she has managed for more than seven years. Eugenia says that her business is located in her home, which is where her neighbors and occasional customers can find all types of basic necessities.

She is requesting a loan in order to increase her stock of products such as sugar, meats, dairy products, baked goods, and other items that are in great demand. This will help improve her family's income and their quality of life. Eugenia is grateful for the opportunity she has received from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy sugar, meats, dairy products, baked goods, and other items.

loans.name: Lourdes Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socios emprendedores originarios de Masaya, una de ellas es Claudia Fabiola que se dedica a comercializar venta de gallinas desde hace 8 años. Es acompañada sus productos los vende en el mercado de Masaya, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de gallinas, por fiestas de temporadas en épocas navideñas. María Lourdes tiene 60 años de edad y vende gallinas y Juan Francisco vende verduras de manera ambulante.
texts.en: This group consists of three entrepreneurs from Masaya, one of whom is Claudia Fabiola. She has been selling chickens for the last 8 years. She has a life partner. She sells her products in the Masaya market. She will buy chickens with the loan, as they will sell because of Christmas parties. María Lourdes is 60 years old and sells chickens, and Juan Francisco is a street vendor who sells vegetables.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary Wants to build 3 permanent rental rooms

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is 28 years old and married, with 2 children. She works selling fresh fruits, namely oranges, watermelons, mangoes, and imported apples.

Apart from the apples, which Sabina buys on the open market, the fruits are brougt from the hinterland by herself. She distributes these bulk purchases to various retailers at a regional market outside the city. Sabina plans to use the KIVA loan to increase these bulk purchases.

loans.use: Capital

loans.name: Alma Delia

texts.en:
Alma sells cosmetics, perfume and athletic shoes, both brand-name and local brand. She is married and has two children ages 10 and 12. Her husband makes molds at a foundry, but his salary is low. To help with the family's finances, Alma works very hard. In addition to her retail sales, she also does catering. She is asking for a loan of $1200 to buy merchandise and ingredients, proposing to repay the loan in 3 to 6 months. She has a lot of turnover in her business and many orders to fill. She thanks you for supporting her dream of helping her young children thrive.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer

Alma es una mujer casada que se dedica ala venta de cosméticos, perfumería, zapatos sport de marca y marca local, esta casada y su esposo trabaja como modelista en una fundidora, ambos tienen dos hijos de 10 y 12 años respectivamente; ella quería ayudar al sustento familiar y trabaja desde su propia casa, todo empezó por que su esposo tiene un sueldo muy bajo como para poder mantener a la familia y ella es muy trabajadora y decidió ayudar en la economía de su hogar, además de su negocio se da el tiempo para otro trabajo de cocina para banquetes.

Alma solicita un préstamo de US $ 1,200 para poder comprar mercadería para su negocio y suministros para sus comidas, ofrece pagar el préstamo en un período de 3 a 6 meses, ya que tiene una alta rotación de sus productos y muchos pedidos que tiene que cubrir, les agradece mucho su apoyo y soporte en sus sueños de sacar adelante a sus pequeños hijos, gracias.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Business Description

Mr. Javier has a pharmacy in a place he has set up in his house which he started with a loan he got of $250. With time and because of a school built diagonal to his pharmacy he also began selling school supplies. Currently he is not just selling medicine but also school and party supplies.

Loan Use

Mr. Javier needs the credit to enlarge his space and wants to set up a phone boot as there is no phone boot near by.

Personal Information

Javier is 26 years old and he has a daughter who is studying, her wife also works, they have family stability and a house made of cement. Javier is sure with the improvements to his business he will improve his family’s future.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Don Javier tiene una farmacia en un local que ha acondicionado en su casa pudo emprenderla con la ayuda de un préstamo de $250. Con el tiempo y ya que una escuela se construyo diagonal a su farmacia también comenzó a vende articulo de papelería. Actualmente no solo vende medicamentos sino también productos de papelería y regalos para toda ocasión.

Uso del Préstamo

El Sr. Javier necesita el crédito para hacer una ampliación en su local pues va a implementar un locutorio de una cabina pues en su sector no hay este servicio sino hasta varias cuadras a la redonda.

Información Personal

El tiene 26 años y una niña que estudia su esposa también trabaja su casa es de cemento y tiene estabilidad familiar. Javier esta seguro que con las mejoras que de a su negocio podrá dar un mejor futuro as u hijo.

loans.use: Build a phone boot space in his current pharmacy / store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Tété

texts.fr:
Mr. Tété A. was born on October 12, 1978 in Lomé, Togo and lives in the district of N’kafu.He is a very gifted and hard-working young bachelor. After secondary school, he took up an apprenticeship and became a qualified electrician. Mr. A. has some difficulty, however, with his business. He needs to do some remodeling in his shop which is located in the district of Adéwui in order to attract more customers. He would also like to add the sale of video and CD players and for these reasons he is asking for a loan of US$ 1000. He is counting on your help in growing his business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur Tété A. est né le 12 Octobre 1978 à Lomé et réside au quartier N’kafu. Il est jeune célibataire très doué et dynamique. Après ces études secondaires, il a fait l’apprentissage et est devenu électronicien de profession. Monsieur Tété A. rencontre certaines difficultés pour le perfectionnement de son travail. Il a besoin d’aménager son lieu de travail qui se trouve au quartier Adéwui pour attirer la clientèle. Il veut aussi ajouter le commerce de CD vidéo et pour résoudre ces manquements il sollicite le montant de $1000. Il compte sur vous pour rehausser ses activités.

loans.use:
sale of DVD and CD players

Achat et vente d'appareil DVD et CD

loans.name: Safiratu

texts.en: Mrs. Safuratu M. is 40 years old, married with 4 children, and she lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells charcoal to people. She has been in business for years, and she need a loan to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Goma

texts.en:
Mrs. Goma T. lives in a village named Sainbu-Bhaishapati, one of the developing villages of Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this village are engaged in farming. Mrs. T. lives in a nuclear family with her husband and one son. Her husband is Ram Chandra T.. He works in a private office.

Mrs. T. is a shopkeeper. She opened her grocery shop 4 years ago. Her son helps her in her shop. Mrs. T. sells different types of grocery items. She opened her little grocery shop to help her husband in meeting the financial needs of their family and also in the hope of improving their standard of living.

Now Mrs. T. is requesting her first loan in the amount of US$ 175 to buy goods which are lacking in her shop.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for her shop

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.en:
From the neighborhood of Villa Bonita, a group of fifteen women have come together to form a business group called “San Cayetano.” After seeing the success of another group of women in the town of Villa Elisa, San Cayetano decided to unite and begin their group. Together they have been successful because all the women involved are mothers who need to continue increasing their profits in order to support their families.

The welfare of their children along with their dedication to raising their standard of living is their reason for joining together and asking for a loan. Most of the women have their own independent businesses, but not all of them have their own store. It is one of the future goals of the committee of San Cayetano that every woman has her own store. With the loan, the women will invest in goods like food products, clothing sales, linen, and machinery and store repairs.

loans.use: To invest in machinery repair, improving the store infrastructure, and buying various articles for the businesses like buying convenience stores, food, charcoal, and merchandise for traveling saleswomen.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina is a lover of the culinary arts, and as an admirer of this art and of the regional food of her country, she began her work raising guinea pigs (a regional delicacy). This very popular activity from her native town of Huancayo, provided her with extra income, which in turn, benefitted her family. In addition, with the help of her husband, she owns two cars to cover the roads between Huancayo and Oroya daily.
