Her husband is the chauffeur and driver of one of their cars, and as such, administrates that business. The desire of this devoted mother of one is to start a little transportation business.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

Paulina, es amante de la culinaria y como gran apasionada de este arte y la comida regional de su país, ha iniciado su labor como criadora de cuyes, esta actividad de mucha popularidad en su natal Huancayo, le está otorgando la posibilidad de obtener ingresos extras en beneficio de su querido hogar.De manera adicional con ayuda de su esposo posee dos autos para cubrir las rutas Huancayo - Oroya diariamente, debido a que su esposo es Chofer y conductor de una de las unidades que compraron en sociedad se encuentra a cargo de la administración de los mismos.El deseo de esta abnegada madre de un pequeño niño es constituir una pequeña empresa de transportes para elevar la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of guinea pigs to sell.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Mrs. Flor D. Maria H. D. D., a member of the Communal Bank "Nuestra Señora D. la Paz", lives at department and province of San Martín, Tarapoto district. She sells domestic animals from her home, located on Jr. Leoncio Prado # 629 in the same district. She started in the business through her daughter, who has encouraged her to get ahead to this day. With the loan of $1,100 USD which will be paid in 6 installments, she will purchase domestic animals (a male and new females) such as ducks, hens, and turkeys, balanced food for growing and putting on weight, and medicines to prevent animal sickness. Flor D. Maria is 69 years old, and has 5 dependent children. She considers herself a strong woman, able to confront whichever difficulty, and with a great attituD. to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Flor D. Maria H. D. D., es socia del Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora D. la Paz, vive en el Departamento, Provincia D. San Martín, Distrito D. Tarapoto, se dedica a la venta D. animales domésticos en su misma vivienda ubicada en el Jr: Leoncio Prado Nº 629 del mismo distrito. Se inicio en el negocio por su hija, quien la impulso e incentivo a que siga adelante hasta el día D. hoy Con el préstamo D. 3000.00 que será cancelado en 6 cuotas lo invertirá en la compra D. animales domésticos (un macho y nueve hembras) D. patos, gallinas, pavos, comida balanceada para crecimiento y engorD. y medicinas para prevenir las enfermedades D. los animales. Flor D. Maria tiene 69 años D. edad, con 5 hijos independientes, se considera una mujer fuerte, capaz D. enfrentar cualquier dificultad, y con buen animo D. seguir adelante.

loans.use: With the loan, she will buy animals to sell

loans.name: Martha's Group

texts.en:
Martha B., age 40, is single with one child, who is 7 years old. She sells bricks and milk as well as animal feed, which she began two years ago. She works from 10am to 6pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $160.

In the past , Martha has taken out two previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to start her animal feed business and increase her brick stock. She hopes for a new loan to start a vegetable and fruit stall and also to start a retail shop. Martha will share this loan with her subgroup members who have shops, salons, and vegetable and fruit businesses.

In the picture, Martha is the first person standing on the left.

loans.use: To start selling fruits/vegetables and open a retail shop

loans.name: Adedoyin

texts.fr:
Mrs. Adedoyin OGUNLEKE was born May 10th, 1981 in Kpalimé in the Kloto prefecture. She is married and the mother of a child. Her main business is selling cosmetics and hair extensions in Adidogomé neighborhood. Her main clients are hairdressers, stylists, and specialists. This first loan she is seeking will allow her to buy cosmetic products such as two boxes of lotions, one box of perfume, and 26 packages of various hair extensions.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame OGUNLEKE Adedoyin est née le 10 mai 1981 à Kpalimé dans la préfecture de Kloto. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle a pour activité principale la vente des produits cosmétiques et des mèches dans le quartier d’Adidogomé. Ses principaux clients sont les coiffeuses, les tresseuses et les particuliers. Le premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter des produits cosmétiques tels que deux (2) cartons de crèmes, 1 carton de parfum et vingt six (26) cartons de mèches de variétés différentes.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics products

loans.name: Alex

texts.es:
Alex is a young father at 20, and since his daughter was born he has had to undertake many jobs to take care of his wife and daughter. He currently sells second hand artifacts, merchandise that he brings from the city of Tacna and that he sells on foot around the city of Juliaca. As well as this job in his spare time this young father and his wife want to make clothes with the hope that this will get them more income and cement their dream of one day owning their own house. They need to buy raw material (wool) in order to start on this big project.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Alex es un joven padre de 20 años, que desde que nació su pequeña niña ha realizado diferentes actividades con el fin de que su esposa e hija no pasen privaciones. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de artefactos de segundo uso, mercadería que trae de la ciudad de Tacna y la vende en forma ambulatoria en la ciudad de Juliaca. Adicionalmente a esta labor en sus horas libres este joven padre y esposa desean dedicarse a la confección de prendas de vestir, ellos tienen la esperanza que con ello podrán obtener mejores ingresos y así cristalizar algún día su sueño de poseer su casa propia. Ellos requieren comprar materia prima (lana) para iniciar uno de sus grandes proyectos.

loans.use: To buy raw material to start a new business/Compra de materia prima para iniciar un nuevo negocio.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is 37 years old. She is married, and has 7 children between the ages of 5 and 20. Selma began her own business in 2003, and sells a variety of products, including charcoal, fuel, and cassava. She works everyday from 6am to 6pm, and earns a monthly profit of around $43.

In the past, Salma has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Salma now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal, firewood and cassava and expand her customer base.

loans.use: To buy more items to increase her business.

loans.name: Socios Unidos Group

texts.en:
The Socios Unidos ("United Partners") group is maD. up of eleven women and two men who live in the El Abasto area of Santa Cruz D. la Sierra. The group members are involved in different business activities. Many of the women sell food: Guadalupe, Rosa, Mariza, Mery and Teresa sell prepared meals, chicken, bread and honey; Katia sells cosmetics; Roxana is an Avon representative; Nancy works at an Internet café; Tatiana sells handicrafts; Melina sells jewelry; Carmen works as a judicial solicitor; Ramon is an electrician; and Walter works at a karaoke lounge. Most of the group members have one to three years of experience with their businesses, though some have more. Rosa and Melina have six and seven years of experience, respectively, and Ramon has 20 years of experience.

Most of the group's female members plan to use the loan to expand their businesses by purchasing more merchandise to sell. The two men plan to buy more tools and equipment with their loans.

Most of the group members have participated in group loans before at other financial institutions or foundations, but this will be Socios Unidos's first loan cycle as a group with AgroCapital.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina inicio el negocio ya que tenía tiempo libre y deseaba aprovecharlo en alguna actividad, y como siempre le han gustado las ventas, una e a una amiga le recomendando ayudarle a vender cosméticos, ella acepto y tiempo después se independizo ya que tenia sus clientes y le era mas rentable hacer sus propias ventas.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $325 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía y tener otros productos que ofrecer a sus clientes. Con tu apoyo ella saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Marcelina started her business in her spare time after wanting to take advantage of the opportunity to start something. And as she has always liked sales and her friends encouraged her to do so, she started to sell cosmetics. Some time after she started she made herself independed given that she had a client base and it was better business to conduct her own sales.

She requires a loan in the amount of $325 US, which will be returned in a term of 3 months. The funds will be used to purchase merchandise and have other products to offer her clients. With your support she will continue to enjoy her success.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Los Andes Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Andes es un Banco Nuevo que recién inicia con 14 socias, quienes fueron invitadas por la promotora y recibieron capacitaciones sobre la metodología D. los Bancos Comunales, la mayoría D. las socias son del barrio D. Capillapata y sus negocios están ubicados en el mercadillo del barrio.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. comida, verduras, frutas, carne, abarrotes. Los negocios D. las socias están ubicados en los mercados, en sus viviendas, venden D. manera ambulatoria D. casa en casa.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles haciendo un total D. 4,950 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal. Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra azúcar, arroz, cebolla, zanahoria, carne, pollo, tubérculos. Los sueños D. las socias son tener casa propias, sus negocios prosperen, implementar otros negocios más rentables y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The "Los Andes" [Andes] Community Bank is a new bank that recently began with 14 women members, who were invited to join by the bank's promoter and who receive training on community bank methodology. Most of the members are from the Capillapata neighborhood and their businesses are located in the small neighborhood market. The bank members have different business activities, such as sale of food, vegetables, fruit, meat and grocery items. The members' businesses are located in the markets and in their homes. Some of them also are street vendors and door-to-door salespeople. The members need loans of different amounts -- some are 300, 450, and 600 soles [about US$ 100, 150, and 200], for a total of 4,950 soles [about US$ 1625] in loans for the community bank. The loans will be invested in the purchase of sugar, rice, lettuce, carrots, meat, chicken and tubers. The members' dreams incluD. owning their own homes, for their businesses to prosper, starting other more profitable businesses, and for their children to become skilled workers.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, rice, lettuce, carrots, meat, chicken and tubers

loans.name: Monica Nsugwa’S Group

texts.en:
Monica is a leader of a 4-member loan group. She is 30 years old and is married with 3 children between the ages of 2 and 10 years. Two of her children go to school. Monica takes care of two of her sister’s children and her elderly mother.  

She rents and resides and rents a two-room house where she is staying with six people. They have neither  electricity nor piped water at home The family gets three meals a day and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. 

Monica sells new clothes in mobile markets. She sells to an average of 15 customers each day and uses public transport to get to and from work. Monica started with this same business seven years ago and has managed to improve her standard of living. Monica sells to all categories of customers, mainly on a retail basis.  

Monica is faced with a transportation challenge because of bus delays. Her monthly expenses include school fees,  medication, and feeding the family.  She wants to use this loan to buy more clothes and aspires to seeing her business grow bigger so that she can own a permanent workplace.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Sifa

texts.en: Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 24-year-old Sifa S. from Mwanza. She is single with two children of the ages of six months and six years. Sifa S. has been running a clothes business since 2002. Her business is to sell different new cloths to her customers. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, seven days per week. Sifa currently earns about 350 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 500 USD in order to buy new clothes for resale. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Sifa thanks you for your support! About the field partner:. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and payback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Angy Milagros

texts.en:
Angy is a member of the Trébol (“Clover”) Village Bank. Angy is 19 years old, single, and lives with her parents. Angy sells a variety of catalog cosmetics (like Avon and Esika) and jewelry. Most of her clients are friends and relatives; her sales are on credit. Angy also studies cosmetology. Angy needs a loan of 600 soles to buy perfume and shampoo. Angy dreams of finishing her studies, opening her own beauty salon and of studying another profession.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow Angy es socia del Banco Comunal El Trébol. Angy es soltera y tiene 19 años, vive aun con sus padres, Angy vende cosméticos y joyas por catálogos, de líneas diferentes como Avon, Esika, sus productos los ofrece a amigos, familiares y al crédito. Angy estudia cosmetología. Angy necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de perfumes, champús. Los sueños de Angy son terminar sus estudios, implementar un salón de belleza y estudiar otra carrera.

loans.use: Angy would like to buy perfume and shampoo to sell.

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.en:
Greetings from Marie Chantal U. in Gatsata sector, Gasabo District, Kigali (the capital city of Rwanda)! Marie Chantal is 32 years old, married with 2 children and raising 1 orphan.

Marie Chantal started her business one year ago. Marie Chantal operates a cell phone accessories shop in town where she sells various cell phone accessories such as cell phone batteries, cell phones cases, cell phone covers, cell phone chargers, face plates, screen protectors, and many more.

This entrepreneur is requesting a loan worth 500,000 Rwf, which will help her to expand her business. Marie Chantal believes that once she gets this loan, her shop will become bigger and her profit will increase.

loans.use: Expansion of her business

loans.name: Abdunaby

texts.en:
Abdunaby A. lives in the B. Gafurov region of Tajikistan. He is a happy father and grandfather; he has 8 children and 28 grandchildren. Abdunaby worked on a collective farm and today he is 63 years old, but he young at heart and full of powers.

Abdunaby has been working with livestock for 10 years. It supplements the family income, and he is experienced in livestock because he was taking care of animals when he was working on the collective farm. Abdunaby has one cow and 4 rams. He wants to purchase a pedigreed bull and one milk cow. Today Abdunaby is asking KIVA for financial support, a business development loan of 2500 STJ for 8 months to purchase the pedigreed bull. Abdunaby thanks KIVA for its precious contribution to small business development and support.

loans.use: purchasing a pedigreed bull

loans.name: Ngov

texts.en: Ngov C. is 24 years old, married, and has one child. She lives with her family in the Kampong Cham province. Ngov’s husband works as a construction foreman, while Ngov works at a vending stall where she sells produce, CDs, and VCDs. On average, Ngov and her husband earn a combined total of $9 a day. Ngov is requesting a loan to diversify her range of marketed goods and expand her customer base. She will use her additional profits to support her family and child.

loans.use: To expand the range of her goods

loans.name: Soutoura. Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Soutoura est constitué de cinq femmes  (toutes mariées) qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et  en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à Kapaga un des villages de la commune de Zégoua (frontière Mali – R.C.I,) de la préfecture de Kadiolo,  3ème région administrative du Mali (Sikasso).
 Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de condiments alimentaires  et du riz  paddy.  
Afin de pouvoir satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et d’accroître leur chiffre d’affaire elles ont décidé de collaborer avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur troisième  prêt solidaire, tous les précédents prêts  se sont  bien dénoués.
 Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 2 paquets de condiments alimentaires et 2 sacs de 100 kg de riz paddy pour les décortiquer et les vendre en détail.  Elles s’approvisionnent à Kapaga et les localités avoisinantes. 
Les marchandises sont vendues au marché de Zégoua le jour de foire, dans le village à kapaga et souvent en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 5.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités..
texts.en:
The group Soutoura is composed of five women, all married, who average 36 years of age and 5 children each. They live for the most part in polygamous families in Kapaga, a village in the community of Zégoua (border between Mali and Cote d’Ivoire) of Kadiolo prefecture, third administrative region of Mali (Sikasso). These women do a diversity of work, including selling condiments and paddy rice.

In order to be able to satisfy the needs of their customers and to increase their sales figures, they decided to collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third solidarity loan. All the preceding ones were indeed settled

With this new loan, the group members plan to buy two packets of condiments and two 100-kg sacks of paddy rice, which will be hulled and sold retail. Supplies are gotten in Kapaga and neighboring towns. The goods are sold mostly in cash transactions at the Zégoua marketplace on market day and often in families. Their customers are composed of men and women.

Each group member envisions realizing an average monthly profit of 5,500 francs CFA. A portion of these profits will be used for family needs and the other portion will be invested in business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and condiments

loans.name: Tailua

texts.en: Tailua F., 38, is married with five children.  She has many years of experience in the taro and bananas business. She sells to the villagers and public, three days per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 tala (~$165 US).  SPBD loans are Tailua’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy an electric chainsaw, weedkiller, axe, Gramoxone and pesticides

loans.name: Abduqahor

texts.ru: Умаров Абдукахор житель района Рудаки. Возраст 49 лет, женат и имеет троих детей. Работает сварщиком  на дому. Производит печки , ворота и другие изделия. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить металлолом и дополнительные инструменты. Таким образом он сможет работать и обеспечивать семью.
texts.en:
U. Abduqahor lives in the Rudaki region. He is 49 years old, is married and has three children. He works as a welder at home. He makes ovens, gates and other wares. He plans to get a loan in order to purchase scrap metal and additional tools. This way he will be able to work and to provide for his family.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase scrap metal and necessary tools

loans.name: Hamidahon

texts.ru: Хамидахон 51 год, замужем и имеет 4 детей. Муж имеет постоянную работу и содержит семью. Сама Хамидахон нигде не работает и занимается домашними делами. Так как имеются условия для содержания домашнего скота Хамидахон имеет несколько голов бычков и овец. Кроме откорма занимается куплей продажей скота на скотном рынке. По базарным дням ей помогает ее муж. Хамидахон, узнав о МикроИнвест, решила подать заявку на займ, и приобрести одного бычка и корм для него.
texts.en:
Hamidahon is 51 years old, is married and has 4 children. Her husband has a steady job and supports the family. Hamidahon does not have a job and takes care of the household chores. Because she has the right conditions for raising domestic livestock. Hamidahon has several heads of cattle and sheep. In addition to fattening livestock, she buys and sells livestock at the livestock market. On market days her husband helps her. Hamidahon, having found out about MicroInvest, decided to apply for a loan and to acquire one bull and feed for it.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow business

loans.name: Ni Ketut Ani Antari

texts.en: Ni Ketut Ani Antari (DNR.M-0700) is a 34-year-old female living in the town of Manistutu, Melaya. She is married and has three school-aged children. Ni Ketut Ani Antari owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting cocoa for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 1,500,000 IDR a month. In 2007, Ni Ketut Ani Antari joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. Ni Ketut Ani Antari is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 IDR which will also be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 3rd from DINARI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About DINARI: The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Ni Ketut Ani Antari - (DNR.M-0700) merupakan 34 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Manistutu - Melaya. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 3 anak usia sekolah. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Ketut Ani Antari memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah membudidayakan tanaman. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari menanam & memanen kakao (coklat) untuk dijual. Ni Ketut Ani Antari sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 3 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Ketut Ani Antari menghasilkan sekitar 1,500,000 IDR sebulan. Dalam 2007, Ni Ketut Ani Antari bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Ketut Ani Antari meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk berinvestasi dengan mengembangkan bisnis. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 5,000,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk berinvestasi dengan mengembangkan bisnis. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 3rd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Ketut Ani Antari berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk meningkatkan/memperluas bisnis peminjam. Tentang DINARI: Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil. *Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Dadeth

texts.en:
Dadeth T. is from the village of Mahayahay, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 22 years old. Dadeth is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Dadeth owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a sari-sari (general store). While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Dadeth has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Dadeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dadeth successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Dadeth is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Dadeth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and to provide tuition for her children.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisher folks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Walter Balmore

texts.es: Walter Balmore A. A. reside en el departamento de Ahuachapán. Walter tiene tan solo 19 años de edad pero su deseo de salir adelante y darle una familia  a su esposa Esmeralda lo ha hecho montar un negocio hace dos años, un taller de automotriz ubicado en la carretera Panamericana la cual es muy transitada y le permite que muchas personas conozcan su negocio, el crédito que solicita Walter es para comprar repuestos utilizados para los vehículos.
texts.en:
Walter Balmore A. A. lives in the Ahuachapán department. Walter is only 19, but his desire to get ahead and make a family with his wife, Esmeralda, caused him to start a business two years ago. He has an automotive shop, which is located on the Panamerican highway. It is a very busy highway, and a lot of people know his business. The loan that Walter is asking for is to buy replacement parts for the vehicles.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vehicle replacement parts

loans.name: Ngong

texts.en: For more than eight years, Ngong L. has made a living running a small store out of her home. She sells items such as cooking ingredients, sweets, plastic goods and soft drinks. Almost all of her clients are neighbors who live near her home, and she typically earns about $3 per day. Her husband works in construction, and has also been hired by neighbors to build a house in the village. Ngong L. is 45 years old and has four children: three are married and one is single and still lives at home. Ngong L. has applied for a loan to buy more items to sell, and to buy a motorbike which her husband will use to ride to work.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
A sus 66 años de edad, la señora  Canderaria M. se dedica a su negocio de venta de comida la cual es elaborada por ella misma haciendo deliciosos platillos variados que agradan mucho a sus clientes. 

Actualmente, ella ha acudido a Ceprodel porque requiere de un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los alimentos y así comercializarlos en su establecimiento logrando la satisfacción de sus clientes que le visitan a diario para la compra.

loans.use: Compra de materia prima para elaborar alimentos

loans.name: Abdul Hadi

texts.en:
The man who is pictured is A. Hadi. He lives in district 8th of Kabul Afghanistan. He is 50 married with 6. He has requested a second cycle individual loan of 50000 Afghani. By the loan he would like to construct his house and buy the essential constructive materials. 
He would like to state that Kiva is a really effective process.

loans.use: purchasing constructive materials

loans.name: Namdag

texts.en: Namdag A. is 35 years old and lives with his wife and four year old son in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. A. currently operates a taxi service in his town. He started driving a taxi in 2008 with capital of 400,000 tugrugs (~280 USD) and has found success. He has used his earnings to stabilize his family's financial situation and improve their quality of life. He also was able to purchase a car which he uses as his taxi. Today A.'s working capital exceeds 800,000 tugrugs (~560 USD). For the future, he hopes to continue his business' stable operation so that he can provide for his son's education. He is requesting a 700,000 tugrug (~490 USD) loan to purchase auto-parts so he can make repairs to his car and continue to operate his taxi service.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es: Miguel Ángel H. L. de 59 años de edad, reside en San Pedro Perulapan en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Miguel se encuentra casado vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijastros. Miguel es un hombre de buen corazón ha estado al cuidado de los hijos de su esposa quien lo reconocen como un padre, Miguel a sacado adelante a su familia por medio de los servicios de su negocio, el maneja un molino en el cual ofrece servicios para procesar todo tipo de alimentos, en esta oportunidad el solicita de un crédito para comprar otros molino ya que su demanda por su negocio ha ido a aumentando.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel H. L. is 59 years old and lives in San Pedro Perulapan, in the Department of Cuscatlán. Miguel is married and lives with his wife and four stepchildren. Miguel is a good-hearted man and has taken care of his wife's children, who regard him as a father. Miguel has helped his family get ahead by operating his own business: he runs a mill which offers processing services for all types of foodstuffs. On this occasion, he is requesting a loan to purchase an additional mill, since the demand for his services has been increasing.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing a new mill

loans.name: Normita

texts.en:
Normita N. is the mother of two children: Diana Faye, 11 years old and Radge Norman, 7 years old. She is 34 years old and married to 38-year-old Edgar N.. Both their children are in primary school, so their current educational expenses are not too high. Nevertheless, Normita wants to work hard because she knows that in the next five years they will be spending more money on education, and she wants to save for their future needs. Her husband works abroad as an electrician. He suffers from being away from his family just to give them a better life. Normita found a way to help her husband provide for their family – this is her farming business. She is the one who personally manages it, sometimes hiring a laborer.

Since Normita became a member of Kiva's field partner, Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), she has used every loan as additional capital for her farming business. She will again be using this loan to buy necessary things for her business. She will buy rice seed, fertilizer and many other items, and she will use the loan to pay for all the activities in planting the rice. She is sure her business will be more productive with the help of this loan.

Normita's dream is to make her farm grow. Aside from the extra income it provides for their daily expenses and the education of their children, it is important to them because they inherited it from her parents. That is why she takes care of it.

loans.use: Additional capital for a farming business

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda would like to borrow a loan amounting to 5,000 Philippine pesos to pursue her livestock business. She plans to purchase hogs to raise for an additional source of income. Aside from hog raising, she is involved in a retail business. She sells ice candies, fruits, cooked snacks, juice and small toys in front of the school campus near their house. Most of her customers are elementary and a high school students, that’s why she sells a lot of her products. She hopes to further expand her business by having additional items to sell. She also hopes to have a hog-raising business with the help of the loan she requested.

Imelda is 53 years old. She is from the village of San Lorenzo, Ilagan, Isbaela. She is already widowed and still supporting two out of her four children. Her two other children are already married while the two she supports are still staying with her in her house. She also dreams to have a more comfortable life with the help of her business. She hopes that Kiva lenders could help her in reaching her dreams.

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase hogs to raise

loans.name: Gisella Lisbeth

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo en la ciudadela el Progreso se reúne el Banco comunal Los Claveles cada 15 días, la señora Gissela forma parte de este banco desde hace dos ciclos  y gracias a esta gran ayuda que le brinda la Fundación Espoir ha podido continuar con su negocio de venta de ropa.

Gissela está casada,  con apenas 17 años esta a espera de su segundo hijo, nos cuenta que se hizo de compromiso a los 16 años aun sin terminar sus estudios, se  dedica a la venta informal de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños realizando visitas puerta a puerta a sus vecinos  dando facilidades de pago,  con su trabajo aporta con los gastos de su hogar siendo de  gran ayuda para su esposo,  la abuela del niños se encarga de cuidarlo mientras ella sale a realizar sus ventas, antes de embarazarse  de su segundo niño ella  viajaba a Otavalo y Guayaquil para comprar su mercadería a los mayoristas,  debido a su estado de gestación es su tía quien viaja a realizar las compras en provincia para abastecer su negocio.

 Con el préstamo que Gissela esta solicitando surtirá su negocio  para la época de navidad y fin de año donde  tiene más pedidos por parte de sus clientes, comprará pantalones, blusas, camisas y más prendas  para damas, caballeros y niños.

El sueño de Gissela  es tener su propia casa y  su  almacén de ropa para lo cual empezará ahorrar  poco a poco, está segura de  algún día lograrlo pues  ella es una mujer muy joven y que lo que  mas le sobran son  ganas de trabajar y mas aun con la llegada de su segundo hijo en los próximos días.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, in the residential community of Progreso, the Community Bank Los Claveles (The Carnations) meets every 15 days. Sra. Gissela has been part of this bank for two cycles, and thanks to this big help that the Fundación Espoir has offered her, she has been able to continue her business of selling clothing.

Gissela is married, and with hardly 17 years of age, she is expecting her second son. She tells us that she made a commitment at 16 years of age that even without terminating her studies, she sells informal clothing for women, men, and children. She visits her neighbors door to door, and makes it easy for them to pay. With her job, she contributes to the household expenses and is a big help for her husband. The grandmother of the children is in charge of taking care of the children while she goes out to make her sales. Before getting pregnant with her second child, she traveled to Otavalo and Guayaquil to buy her merchandise wholesale. Due to her pregnant state, her aunt is who travels to make the purchases in the province in order to supply her business.

With the loan that Gissela is requesting, she will stock her business for the Christmas and end of year season, where she has more requests from her customers. She will buy pants, blouses, shirts, and more clothing for women, men, and children. Gissela's dream is to have her own house and clothing store, and for this will begin saving little by little. She is sure that someday she will achieve it. She is a young women and what she has more than anything are desires to work, and even more with the arrival of her second son in the next few days.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Timothy Ngigi

texts.en:
Timothy is 40 years old and married with five children. He operates a small canteen on a company's property, selling food to the company's employees. He has been in business for a period of about one year with a profit of approximately 150,000 Kenya shillings a month. Some of the things he sells in his canteen include a cup of tea, snacks to take with tea, and some easy-to-make meals.

He has never borrowed from another MFI and was introduced to KADET by a friend. He wants to use the loan to expand the canteen and also open a shop at the same place to meet all the needs of his customers.

He hopes to operate a larger canteen and buy enough stock for the shop to supply all the items required by his customers.

loans.use: To expand his canteen and open a shop.

loans.name: Livia Soledad

texts.es:
Livia tiene 35 años de edad, es separada y tiene una hija de dos años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 10 años tiene instalada una pequeña bodega en su casa donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, aceite) y abarrotes a sus vecinos y clientes que frecuentan su negocio. Adicionalmete brinda servicio de venta de comida a diversos pensionistas y turistas de la zona.

Su negocio cuenta con buena acogida gracias a su buen trato y a la buena sazón con la que prepara sus platos. Livia se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más abarrotes para ampliar su negocio.

Su más grande anhelo es brindarle a su hija una educación de calidad. Ella es una madre responsable y que siempre lucha por salir adelante a pesar de las dificultades.
texts.en:
Livia is 35 years old, is separated from her husband and has a 2 year old daughter. She lives close to her family in Cayaltí District, located one hour from the city of Chiclayo. For 10 years she has had a small grocery store set up in her house. She sells basics necessities (rice, sugar, oil) and groceries to her neighbors and to the customers who frequent her store. Additionally, she offers a food service to the various lodgers and tourists in the area. Her business is welcomed thanks to her good nature and her talent for cooking. Livia finds herself, for the first time, requesting a loan of 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa, which she plans to invest in the purchase of more groceries so she can expand her business. Her greatest wish is to provide her daughter with a quality education. She is a responsible mother and always works to get ahead in spite of her difficulties.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of groceries for business expantion.

loans.name: Sista

texts.es: Sista  de 46 años de edad habitante de colonia karinwas, esta solicitando refinanciamiento de credito a la institucion de AFODENIC, para ser invertido en su pulperia en esa misma colonia, con el objetivo de aumentar su inventario de pequeño negocio, y asi sastifacer la demanda de su clientela. Doña sista trabaja en conjunto con sus hijas y su esposo atendiendo la parte de la venta de forma colectiva, ella se ha caracterizado por ser una buena clienta de esta financiera, su sueño es incrementar y diversificar los productos en su negocio de modo que sirva para aumentar las ganancias economicas y mejorar los niveles de vida en la familia, en su comunidad la consideran como una persona honrada, responsable, progresista, trabajadora y con buenos pricipios cristianos.
texts.en:
Sista is 46 years old and lives in the Karinwas district. She is seeking to refinance her loan from the institution AFODENIC. The loan will be invested in her local store in the same district where she lives, with the objective of expanding the inventory of her small business, and in this way satisfying her customers' demands. Doña Sista works together with her daughters and husband, attending to the sales collectively. She is known as a good customer of the financial institution. Her dream is to increase and diversify the products in her business and in this way increase her economic earnings and improve the living standards of her family. In her community she is considered an honorable person, responsible, progressive, hard working and with good Christian principles.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for grocery store

loans.name: Erlinda Isabel

texts.es: La señora Erlinda Isabel C. U.  tiene un negocio en el Mercado central de venta de verduras y frutas con 10 años de experiencia es Madre soltera de tres hijos solo el pequeño en edad escolar, la señora C. U. solicito financiamiento por que deseaba surtir su negocio mas ahorita que para ella es temporada buena por verano,  empieza a vender a las seis y media de la mañana se esfuerza en su negocio para sacar adelante a su ultimo hijo
texts.en:
Erlinda Isabel C. U. sells fruits and vegetables in the central market, and has done so for the last 10 years. She is a single mother of three children. The youngest is school-aged.

She seeks this loan because she would like to stock her business as the summer is a good season. She begins selling at 6:30 a.m. She works this hard in her business so that she can help her youngest child advance.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Rosita's Group

texts.en:
Rosita M. is from the village of Villaflor in Oroquieta City. She is 42 years old. Rosita is the leader of a 3-member loan group sponsored by GDMPC. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Rosita is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Rosita provides hairdressing and beauty services to the local community. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3200 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Rosita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Rosita's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Suwebat

texts.en:
50-year-old Suwebat sells pap (a traditional porridge made from ground maize) from her home. She buys maize in bulk and processes it into pap which she supplies to big buyers who sell it together with bean cake. Most people prefer taking pap as breakfast due to its light nature.

Suwebat travels far from the city to purchases maize from the farmers, especially when it is out of season, to make sure her customers are supplied. She has been in this business for the past eleven years and has improved on her living standard. She is married and has four children.

Suwebat is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more maize in bulk for making pap. She expresses her huge thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more maize in bulk for making pap

loans.name: Iutana

texts.en:
Iutana F. is 38 and married with 38 children.  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Iutana has many years of experience in this business.  Iutana needs a loan of WST $1500 to invest in expanding the business.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Iutana joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Iutana's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Iutana F. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.87 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Moeuk

texts.en:
Mr. Moeuk M. is 49 years old and is a motorcycle taxi driver. He always provides his service in and around his community, earning $3 each day. Also he goes to buy and pick up smoked-fish for his wife to sell at the market for a profit.

This couple are determined parents who help each other in order to feed two of their kids who are now enrolled in school and dependent on their income.

The family owns a small farmland on which they always cultivate a rice crop when the farming season comes. Moeuk M. is taking out his loan to buy a cow to help plow the field. In the future he will raise the cow to sell its offspring.

loans.use: To buy cow for plowing and for its offspring

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN MARIA DE INQUILPATA” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

Silvia, tiene 32 años, es conviviente, es natural de la Convención del distrito de Quellouno y tiene dos hijos, ella vive en la comunidad de Inquilpata del distrito de Anta del departamento del Cusco. Su principal actividad económica es la ganadería. Primero alimenta a los animales y después los vende en el Campo Ferial de la Comunidad Campesina de Inquilpata-Anta los días viernes. Ella también se dedica a la producción de queso. Su actividades económicas complementA. es la venta de maíz y papa, ella es mayorista y solo vende en su domicilio. 

Silvia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia, ella requiere el crédito para un vaca de buena raza.
 
Silvia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Silvia belongs to the community bank "VIRGEN MARIA DE INQUILPATA" of the Asociación Arariwa.

Silvia is 32 years old and lives with her partner. She is from Convención of the district of Quellouna and has two children. She lives in the community of Inquilpata of the district of Anta of the department of Cusco. Her main economic activity is stockbreeding. First she feeds the animals and then she sells them at the Campo Ferial of the Comunidad Campesina of Inquilpata-Anta on Fridays. She also produces cheese. To complement her income she also sells corn and potato, wholesale, and she only sells from home.

Silvia is a hard-working and entrepreneurial lady who searches for opportunities to get ahead at any moment, and with her daily effort she supports her family. She requests the loan to buy a cow of good breed.

Silvia is grateful for the opportunity offered through this means and therefore she is committed to repay according to the timescale.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Silvia needs the loan to buy a cow of good breed.

loans.name: Hanchel

texts.en:
Hanchel G. is from the village of Fatima, Liloy, Zamboanga Del Norte. He is 36 years old, He is married, and has one infant child.

Hanchel owns and operates a business providing rice retailing to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Hanchel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his rice retailing business. This loan will be his first from PMPC.

Hanchel plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve their living situition. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for his rice retailing business

loans.name: Romel

texts.en:
Romel B. is from the village of Crossing Lumbia Airport, Cagayan de Oro. He is 24 years old. Romel is single. To make a living, Romel owns & operates a business venture in the retail business sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from both food and daily use products in the local community. Romel has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Romel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Romel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Romel is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Romel from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna P. is a married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: rice retailing and pig fattening. She lives in Hacienda Baksay, La Castellana, Negros Occidental, with her husband and their five children who are 24, 25, 26, 28 and 31 years old. Edna has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1993 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her rice retailing and pig-fattening businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 7,500. Edna is now borrowing PHP 25,000 which she will use as additional capital. This will be her thirteenth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Edna aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additonal working capital

loans.name: Damienne

texts.fr: S. Damienne est née en 1975 et est mariée à ATCHADE K. Télesphore, un électricien. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un est scolarisé. Il y a juste deux ans que Damienne et son mari se sont installés au quartier Djeffa, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, où ils vivent avec leurs enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges familiales. Damienne n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Damienne vend des condiments et de l’huile de palme à Ekpè. Damienne gère également un moulin à condiments. Damienne achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son capital et de rehausser le niveau de son activité , afin de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Damienne sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un deuxième prêt. Le premier prêt dont Damienne avait bénéficié a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Ms. S. Damienne was born in 1975 and is married to Mr. ATCHADE K. Télesphore, an electrician. The couple have two children, one of whom is in school. Just two years ago, Damienne and her husband settled in the Djeffa district, in the community of Sèmè-Podji, where they live with their children. The couple sharing in covering their different family expenses. Damienne did not attend school. To support herself, she sells condiments and palm oil in Ekpè. She also runs a condiments mill. She purchases her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. With the goal of bolstering her capital and raising her level of business, in order to respond better to customer demand, Damienne is requesting a second loan from ALIDé. The first one she had received was repaid.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying containers of palm oil and some condiments

loans.name: Candelario

texts.en:
Mr. Candelario L. is from the barangay of Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 45 years of age and married to Ann L., an X-Ray Technician at MHARS General Hospital in Ozamiz City. They’re blessed with five children. All of the children finished their studies and have their own work. To make a living, he is presently engaged in quarrying and delivering sand and gravel and making hollow blocks. He is also helped by his wife in terms of their other needs in the family. He has been engaged in this kind of business for five months already and earns approximately PHP 15,000 a month from this business activity. 

In the year 2010, Candelario joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Candelario, as a newly recognized member of PMPC under the Regular Loan Program, is now requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 for his first loan to be used for additional capital for his existing businesses. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family, especially in meeting their basic needs, savings for future use, loan repayments, insurances and possible business expansion. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Lan's Group

texts.en:
Lan T. N. is 41 years old and is married with two children. She has a medicine shop and has a monthly income of about 5,000,000 VND.

Lan T. N. has participated in SEDA since 2006. For her last loan, she borrowed 4,142,000 VND and has completely repaid the amount punctually. For this loan, she would like to borrow 7,630,000 VND in order to expand her shop.

About the other borrowers in her group:

Doan T. T. N. is 27 years old. She has a store and would like to borrow 6,758,000 VND in order to expand it.

Huong T. H. C. is 39 years old. She sells building materials and would like to borrow 7,630,000 VND to support her small business.

Minh T. H. is 32 years old. She sells fruit in the market and would like to borrow 7,630,000 VND to support her small business.

loans.use: To expand her shop

loans.name: Rogers

texts.en:
As they say that determination leads to destiny, Muhumuza Rogers is gaining momentum in his charcoal selling business in the R. Central market. Many people tend to undermine casual work here in Uganda but the 27 year old married father of 2 children has been able to earn a living through that business for over 6 years. 

Charcoal is commonly used here in Uganda as a form of energy in many homes to cook food and for house warming in cold places, as prices for paraffin, gas and electricity are always high. Through selling charcoal he is able to earn 323,000 Ugandan shillings monthly, although there are drawbacks like transporting his products to bigger markets such as Kampala city. 

With this loan, he hopes to expand into bigger markets and supply larger charcoal markets. This will help in improving his sales revenue to meet his family’s needs.

loans.use: purchasing charcoal for business expansion

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion B. is from the village of Batangan, New Dapitan. She is 53 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Visitacion owns and operates a business venture in the food sector running a grocery store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling of household items (such as sugar, salt etc.). Visitacion has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activies.

In 2010, Visitacion joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Visitacion has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Visitacion is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for the store. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Visitacion from PMPC.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional capital for her store.

location.town: Calamba-New Dapitan, Rizal, Zambo. Del Norte

loans.name: Tomas Alberto

texts.es: Don Tomás habitante de colonia Los Pintos, conforma una familia de 4 miembros: su esposa y 2 hijos, el mayor estudia tercer año de universidad de la carrera Ing en Zootecnia y la menor que estudia 4to grado de primaria, los que en conjunto colaboran en los quehaceres de la unidad de producción, este señor labora en su finca realizando actividades pecuarias con su pequeño inventario ganadero, como  tambien actividades agricolas, siendo sus principales fuentes de ingreso, necesita este financiamiento para utilizarlo  en retencion de ternero, logrando de esta manera mantener el numero de su inventario y que en el transcurso de un año estos animales puedan ser comercializados a un mejor precio para ayudar a la estabilidad de la econonmia familiar, es una persona muy pregresiva y con mucho entusiasmo de superacion, en su comunidad lo consideran como un hombre de buenas costumbres,  espera ser beneficiado con el fondo KIVA para poder hacer realidad su sueño..
texts.en:
Don Tomás lives in the neighborhood of Los Pintos. His wife and two children make up their family of four. The older child is in their third year of college studying animal husbandry and the younger one is in the 4th grade. The workers in his production unit collaborate on activities. Don Tomás carries out ranching and agricultural activities as his main source of income. He needs this loan to keep his calves to maintain the number of his inventory. In the course of a year, these animals can be marketed at a better price to help the economic stability of his family. He is a very progressive person who enthusiastically desires to succeed. In his community he is viewed as a man of good character. He hopes the requested loan will help him make his dream a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Angela Yeh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To retain and raise calves

loans.name: Arlin Del Carmen

texts.es:
El clienta Arlin Del Carmen M. M.. Vive en el municipio santa Rosa Del Peñón departamento de león de la Iglesia Católica 6 1/2 norte, Es Acompañada  trabaja actual mente en MINED santa Rosa del peñón desempeña  el cargo como técnica tiene 3 años de estar laborando en esta institución.
El cliente cuanta con una casa de habitación propia el cual la quiere mejorar.
El destino del crédito es para la Compra de Sin para techo de su Habitación.  Para el mejoramiento de su vivienda. 
Esto le permitirá mantener en mejores condiciones el bien estar de su familia.
texts.en:
Our client Arlin lives in the municipality of Santa Rosa del Peñón, Department of León, 6 1-2 blocks north of the Catholic Church.  She lives with a partner and presently works in the Ministry of Education in Santa Rosa del Peñón in a technical post.  She has worked in that institution for the last 3 years.

Arlin has her own house which she would like to improve.  With this loan she plans to buy zinc sheeting to provide her house with a new roof.  This will allow her to maintain her family in better condition.

loans.use: BUYING ZINC SHEETING TO REPLACE THE ROOF ON HER HOUSE

loans.name: Florencio

texts.en:
Florencio M. is from the village of Tinaclaan Misamis Occidental. He is 59 years old. Florencio is married and has three grown children. To make a living, Florencio owns and operates a motor transport service. Florencio has been engaged in his business for more than a year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Florencio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Florencio is requesting a loan of 10000 PHP, which he will use to repair his vehicle for better service. This will be the first loan taken by Florencio from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Cesar Percy

texts.es:
El cliente Cesar Persy C. M. se dedica ala extracción de oro en una mina ubicada en la provincia de Barranca.
El solicitante tiene su casa propia construida de material noble gracias a su trabajo, vive con su esposa y su hijo de seis años de edad ,está solicitando el crédito para la compra de una herramienta para su uso en la mina , se propone otorgarle el crédito por tener capacidad de pago y además cuenta con ahorros en el cuál están depositados en otra entidad bancaría.
texts.en:
Cesar Persy C. M. works extracting gold from a mine located in the Barranca province.

He has his own house, that was built with good materials thanks to his work.  He lives with his wife and his six year old son.  

He is asking for this loan to purchase a tool for use in the mine.  He feels he deserves this loan because he is able to pay it back and he has savings which are deposited in another bank.

loans.use: Purchase a tool to use at work in a mine

loans.name: Flordeliz

texts.en:
Flordeliz G. earns her living by operating a fish vending business. Her husband, Wilfredo G., age 52, helps his wife with her business. They have six children who between the ages of 6 and 13 years old. The family lives in Brgy. Poblacion, Oslob, Cebu.  

Flordeliz joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired toward something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Flordeliz has been working hard and incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,500, thus raising the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fifth cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to fund her business operations so that she can continue to save up for the future of her children's education. Flordeliz G. is truly a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. "Dungganon" is a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable." Through this alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities they could not have imagined. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund her fish vending business

loans.name: Barack

texts.en:
Barack O. O. is thirty-one years old and married. His wife helps him run his business and they have five children between the ages of ten years and one year old.  They hope to give their children a good education to the University level. 

His business is located at the busy Juakali Market in Nairobi. He makes and sells items, such as steel doors and cookers. He serves the local people.  He has been in this business for fifteen years and has four employees. He says that his business is profitable, but a major challenge is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He will use the loan of KES 40,000 to buy scrap metal to grow his business. He hopes to expand his business until it becomes a company that can provide employment to many people. He describes himself as determined, God-fearing, and ambitious.

loans.use: Scrap metal

loans.name: Esmerna

texts.en:
Esmerna P. is from the town of Puntod Lopez Jaena. She is 40 years old and married. To make a living, Esmerna owns & operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fresh fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Esmerna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC, and is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be Esmerna’s third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small-business entrepreneurs.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Lourt

texts.en: Lourt T., 29, is employed at the factory, earning an income of USD 3 per day. T. is married and resides with her husband and a child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Her husband raises pigs to resell, earning an income of USD 2 per day. The family has to spend USD 30 on food, USD 5 on electricity supply, and USD 35 on other necessary expenses every month. T. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more pigs to raise for resale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. T. is not available, so her husband appears in the photograph instead.

loans.use: To buy pigs to raise for resale

loans.name: Akeza Group

texts.fr:
Aline Marie N. est une commerçante âgée de 32 ans qui habite la Commune  urbaine de Kanyosha en Mairie de Bujumbura. Elle fait le business de salon de coiffure pour dames depuis 6ans. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’au niveau de l’école primaire. Elle est mariée et mère de 5enfants. Elle arrivait au 4e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame mais elle a été éligible au crédit solidaire. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  accroitre son capital  en achetant des equipements pour son salon de beauté et ainsi pouvoir accroitre ses économies. Elle espère qu’avec les économies réalisées avec ce credit, elle pourra avoir un grand capital et ainsi son business atteindre un haut niveau de performance

Elle est  une des membres  du groupe  solidaire« Akeza».
texts.en:
Aline Marie N. is a 32-year old merchant who lives in the urban community of Kanyosha, located in the municipality of Bujumbura. She has had a ladies' beauty salon for the past 6 years. She has a primary school education. She is married and she is the mother of 5 children. She is on her fourth loan cycle with Turame (Kiva Field Partner) but she was eligible to have an independent loan.

She requests a Kiva loan to supplement her capital funds. Her goal is to purchase equipment for her beauty salon and to improve her income. She hopes that with the profits generated with this loan, she will be able to accumulate larger capital funds and expand her business.

She is a member of the communal bank named "Akeza".

loans.use: To purchase beauty salon equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cloth.

loans.name: Ailaine

texts.en:
Ailaine B. is from the town of Banga. She is 36 years old. Ailaine is married and has 3 children aged 13, 10 and 4. To make a living, Ailaine owns and operates a business venture in the agricultural sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Ailaine works hard to ensure healthy crops and increased harvests.

Ailaine joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ailaine has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Ailaine is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy three piglets

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en: Kumba, 40 years old, is married and has two children, one 18 years old and the other 8 months old.  Because it is a widely-used product, Kumba established her charcoal business in 2003 and has developed it into profitable enterprise, open seven days a week and nine hours a day. She is requesting  a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 to purchase more bags of charcoal.  In the future, Kumba plans to acquire a piece of land and educate her children well.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal for her business

loans.name: Martha Irene

texts.es: Martha Irene de 38 años, es una madre abnegada. Tiene más de 1 año en su negocio que es una pulpería. Que inicio con muy pocos productos como comestibles, dulces, bebidas, frutas. Ahora, es la más abastecida de su localidad y todas las mañanas se encuentra llena de personas deseosas de querer comprar productos comestibles para el alimento diario. Su principal deseo es mejorar su tienda de comestibles para poder salir adelante en compañía de su familia. Este es el primer crédito donde agradece la confianza depositada en ella, pues comenzará a mejorar su negocio, Martha invertirá en la compra de productos de primera necesidad arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles, golosinas, refrescos y detergentes.
texts.en: Martha Irene is 38 years old and is a devoted mother. She has had her grocery business for more than a year. She started her business with few products such as groceries, candies, drinks and fruits. Her business is now the best stocked in the neighborhood and every morning it is full of people wanting to buy groceries for their daily food. Her main desire is to improve her grocery store to be able to succeed with her family. This is her first loan. She is thankful for the confidence placed in her and she will start to improve her business. Martha will invest in the purchase of staple products such as rice, sugar, oil, beans, candy, soft drinks and detergents.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil, beans, candy, soft drinks and detergents.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris M. is 54 years old, from Kakamega, and is married to John. They have two children who go to school.

Doris has been running a retail shop for the past two years. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy more detergent, eggs, cooking oil, flour etc. to add to her stock at her retail shop. 


The profits will be used to help with the family's needs and pay school fees for her children. She hopes own a wholesale shop in future.

loans.use: To buy detergent, eggs, cooking oil, flour etc to add to her stock

loans.name: Manju

texts.en: Mrs. Manju R. lives in Tangal. Tangal is located in the Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this area are engaged in business activities. Mrs. Manju R. lives with her husband and one daughter. Her husband, Mr. Binod R., works in a printing press. Her daughter is in primary school. Mrs. R. opened her shoe shop in Lagankhel in the footpath market. She sells different types of shoes and sandals. The rent for shops in that area is very high, so she can't afford to pay rent. She needs to purchase different varieties of shoes and sandals for her shop.
