So she requests a 30,000 NPR loan to purchase different types of shoes and sandals, particularly children's and ladies' shoes. She wants to provide good education to her daughter.

loans.use: to buys different kinds of shoes for her shop.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel Y. is a 38 year single man who sells secondhand shoes in the Gikomba open air market. He has been in business for the last six years, and he gets a monthly income of 8,000 KES.

Emmanuel applied for his first loan with KADET after he joined recently. He plans to use the amount to buy two more bales of shoes so as to increase his stock. He plans to use the anticipated profits in his business to expand.

In the future Emmanuel hopes to partner with a shoe company in Kenya known as BATA so that he can be the supplier of their new shoes to other retailers.

loans.use: To buy two more bales of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Bwanya Plus Group

texts.en:
Victor is a chairman of the community bank named “Bwanya Plus,” which is composed of eight microentrepreneurs united in solidarity to obtain loans from Kiva through the MFI HOPE DRC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Victor sells timbers at the market located in the eastern area of Kinshasa. He has been in business since 1984. He has acquired solid experience in this area. Currently, through his sales, Victor makes about $50 per week. 

His plans are to use the next loan to purchase some more timbers to resell in order to increase his income and achieve his dream of one day  opening a larger timber facility in his area. 

He is a trustworthy client of the MFI Hope DRC, having six times received and properly repaid loans. 

Victor is 50 years old, married and the father of 12 children whose ages vary between 4 and 22. Nine of them go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more timbers to resell at profit.

loans.name: Jose Elias

texts.es:
José, vive con sus padres y hermanos, él trabaja como auxiliar de servicio en Fosalud (unidad médica), desde hace cinco años, luego decidió instalar su propio negocio en el que vende tacos, tortas, burritos, tiene un año de estar en este negocio, su objetivo era contar con dos fuentes de ingreso, que le permitiera tener una mejor estabilidad.
Actualmente necesita invertir en materiales para incrementar la variedad de productos y tener mejor disponibilidad, comprando, pan especial para las tortas, pollo, carnes rojas, condimentos, tomates, cebollas, con estos ingredientes, él espera mejorar su servicio con esta inversión.
Su objetivo es seguir mejorando con el negocio e incrementar la variedad en sus productos, también crecer en clientela, de esta manera tener mayores ingresos para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
José lives with his parents and siblings. He has worked as an assistant for Fosalud (a medical service company) for the past five years. José also decided to start his own business selling tacos, sandwiches, and burritos. He has operated his business for one year. His goal was to have two sources of income in order to provide better stability.

José currently needs to invest in supplies so that he can make available a wider variety of products. He will buy special bread for sandwiches, chicken, red meat, condiments, tomatoes, and onions. With these ingredients, he hopes that his investment will result in better service.

His goals are to continue improving his business and to provide a wider variety of products. He also wants to grow his customer base so that he can generate more income to provide for his family’s welfare.

loans.use: to purchase special bread for sandwiches, chicken, red meat, condiments, tomatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Rose Marie Cortes Group

texts.en: Rose Marie is 41 years old and lives in Cogon, Ozamis City. She is married with four children. To earn a living, Rose Marie has a business selling snacks. She earns about 2,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Rose Marie has a requested a loan to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business. Rose Marie has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Karla Jasmina

texts.es: Karla Jasmina , de 37 años de edad, originaria del municipio de Jalapa. Actualmente vive en la ciudad  de Condega municipio de Esteli donde se casó y procreo un hijo el cual tiene ocho años de edad. Ella tiene un negocio de mueblería el cual lo heredó de su familia en 1993, por tal razón no pudo iniciar sus estudios universitario llegando hasta el Quinto año de Secundaria, porque no podia descuidar los intereses familiares. Ella solicitó su crédito KIVA para impulsar un poco más lo que es la comercializacion de sus productos, los cuales se distribuyen solamente en el municipio de Condega, asi como también compra de madera seca y maquinarias las cuales las tenia un poco deterioradas. En la actualidad el negocio lo atiende con su esposo, pero aparte de eso ella aporta a los ingresos del hogar con un pequeño salón de belleza. Tiene como meta dar a conocer sus productos en los demás municipios y asi mejorar su calidad de vida y darle un futuro mejor a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Karla Jasmina, 37, is from the town of Jalapa.  She currently lives in the city of Condega, Estelí, where she married and had a son who is now 8 years old.  She has a furniture making business that she inherited from her family in 1993.  Because of this she was unable to start her university studies having only completed 11th grade because she had to see to her family’s interests.

She requested a Kiva loan to further her sales a bit more, which take place only in the town of Condega, and to buy more dry lumber and machinery since what she has is a bit worn out.  

She currently runs the business together with her husband but she also contributes to household expenses with a small beauty salon.  Her goal is to have her products be known in other towns to improve her quality of life and provide a better future for her young son.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and machinery.

loans.name: Shogher

texts.en:
Shogher is a 28-year-old Lebanese woman living with her husband and one young child. She has been selling different types of clothes since 2005. She works from her home. 

Her prices are fair compared to other clothes dealers and traders prices. This is the reason why she has a good number of clients buying her products.

Today, she is asking to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her stock of new clothes. In the future, she is hoping to open her own store.

loans.use: to increase her stock of new clothes

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a thirty six year old married man who has one child. He rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

Edward has been in the produce business for one year. He started with four million UGX and now has six million UGX as his working capital. His hardship is price fluctuation. He has a vision to own a food store plus he would like to have his own transport means. Edward needs the credit facility to buy groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy ground nuts to sell.

loans.name: Sarafina Group

texts.en:
Zulfa has operated a fruit and vegetable business since 2010.  She works from 6 a.m to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. She is in her early 30s and is single with one child who is enrolled in school.

This will be Zulfa's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her business and to pay household expenses, and she has paid back her loan successfully. She intends to use this loan buy more fruits and vegetables to offer for sale. Her dream is someday to be able to buy a plot of land.

She will share this loan with her loan group. The group is called Sarafina and is comprised of a total of 18 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to offer for sale

loans.name: Los Triunfadores -Chilca Group

texts.es: LA SR DAVID DE 38 AÑOS DE EDAD,CONVIVIENTE CON 01 HIJO MENOR DE EDAD EN ETAPA ESCOLAR , ES SOCIO DE LA ALCANCIA COMUNAL  LOS TRIUNFADORES -CHILCA , SE LE DIO ESTE PRESTAMO  YA  QUE EN EL ANTERIOR CICLO FUE RESPONSABLE  EN SUS CUOTAS   JUNTAMENTE CON TODOS LOS INTEGRANTES QUE CONFORMAN ESTA ALCANCIA COMUNAL . EL SR DAVID ACTUALMENTE  TIENE SU INTERNET, QUE GRACIAS  A ESTE NEGOCIO  PUEDE  BRINDAR ASU FAMILIA  UNA MEJOR CALIDAD DE VIDA . EL SR DAVID SOLICITA ESTE PRESTAMO PARA PODER  COMPRAR MAS  COMPUTADORAS Y ASI PODER OBTENER MAS INGRESOS .EL SR  DAVID QUISIERA PARA EL FUTURO TENER UN LOCAL Y CON EQUIPOS DE ULTIMA TECNOLOGIA .EL SR DAVID SE ENCUENTRA UBICADO EN LA FOTO A LADO IZQUIERDO ,VISTE UNA CASACA COLOR AZUL ,POLO COLOR VERDE Y PANTALON COLOR CREMA
texts.en:
David is 38 years old and has a live-in partner and a young school-age son. He is a member of "Los Triunfadores -Chilca" (The Winners -Chilca) communal bank. He was given this loan because he and all the other members of this communal bank were responsible about making their payments in the previous loan cycle.

David currently has his Internet café, and thanks to this business he can offer his family a better quality of life. David is asking for the loan so he can buy more computers, which will make him able to earn more income. In the future, David would like to have a separate building for the business and the latest generation equipment.

David is on the left side of the photo, wearing a blue jacket, green shirt and cream-colored pants.

loans.use: to buy more equipment for his Internet café.

loans.name: Prosper

texts.fr:
Prosper est né au Rwanda et a 49 ans. Il est marié et il a 7 enfants de 2 à 18 ans, dont 6 scolarisés. 

C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter les ciments, des portes et des fenêtres métallique et vitres pour la réhabilitation des  sa maison d'habitation. 

Dans les prochaines années, Prosper voudrait poursuivre ses études universitaires pour son avenir , il prévoit de payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants et améliore le bien être de sa famille et avoir une bonne habitation.
texts.en:
Prosper was born in Rwanda and is 49 years old. He is married with 7 children between 2 and 18 years old, six of whom attend school.  

He is on his second loan cycle with ACB, and will use his loan to purchase cement, metal doors and windows and glass panes in order to refurbish his home. 

In the coming years, Prosper would like to pursue his university studies in order to prepare for the future; he also envisages paying his children's school fees, and would like to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cement, doors and metal windows to refurbish his home

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is a 39-year-old married woman who lives in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato with her family. She is a farmer and has been growing and selling rice for quite some time now. Theresa is able to help provide for her family's needs through her income from farming.

Theresa has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Bonface

texts.en:
Bonface is 35 years old and married with three children.  To earn a living, he runs a cafeteria.  He has employed five people in his business.  He also owns a video cinema which earns him extra income.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his business because he has been trained on business management.  His desire is to have a big hotel in the future.

Bonface has requested 100,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a deep freezer, fryer, and utensils.

loans.use: to buy a deep freezer, fryer, and utensils.

loans.name: Saidath

texts.en:
Saidath is 57 years old and is married. Saidath is commonly known for selling African clothes and underwear. This is her tenth successful year in this business. Her business hours are from 8 am until 8 pm every day.

Saidath needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, she will expand her business by purchasing different styles of African clothes and underwear to sell. With these additional styles of African clothes and underwear, Saidath hopes to earn more profits. This will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability and providing all the basic needs for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and underwear to sell.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is single but he helps his parents to pay school fees for his siblings.  He is in the motorcycle transportation business.  He has been in the business for the past year and he earns a monthly income of KES 6,000 from the business.

This is his first loan term in KADET.  He will use the loan to open a retail shop, which will be managed by his mother.  He will use the anticipated profits to buy another motorbike.  His dream is to be financially stable and educate his siblings.

loans.use: Diversify the business

loans.name: Santos Eusebio

texts.es:
El Sr. Santos Eusebio, tiene 34 años de edad y 13 años de casado, tiene 3 hijos de 7, 10 y 12 años de edad, todos están estudiando, vive en la aldea El Tigre, Santa Cruz de Yojoa.

Santos tiene dos años de tener un negocio de venta de ropa para damas y niños, gorras, fajas, sandalias, bolsos y zapatos. Esta actividad la realiza a diario, pero el sábado y domingo vende en un puesto de venta En Taulabe, es una aldea cercana de su casa. Ya tiene su clientela establecida.
Este negocio lo inicio con dinero propio, y las ganancias las ha reinvertido para ir incrementando su inventario.
Este préstamo es el primero que solicita y es para comprar más ropa y zapatos, ya que viene la temporada buena de ventas.
El plan que tiene es mantener su negocio surtido para sacar mas ganancias y de allí sacar los gastos de educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Santos Eusebio is 34 years old, and he has been married for 13 years.  He has three children; ages 7, 10, and 12.  The children go to school.  He lives in the village of El Tigre in Santa Cruz, Yojoa.

For two years Santos has had his business of selling women’s and children’s clothes, hats, belts, sandals, purses, and shoes.  He does this every day, but on Saturday and Sunday he sells at a place in Taulabe, which is a village close to his house.  He already has an established customer base.

He started this business with his own money, and he has reinvested his earnings in order to increase his inventory.

This is the first loan that he has requested.  The loan is to buy more clothes and shoes because the good season for sales is coming.  

The plan that he has is to keep his business stocked in order to get more earnings.  He will pay for his children’s educational expenses from that income.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, and other products to sell.

location.town: El Tigre, Santa Cruz de Yojoa

loans.name: Mario Isidro

texts.es:
Mario trabaja en su vehículo propio en el servicio en la vía pública desde hace tiempo. Sus planes es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda poco a poco. Con el ciclo del préstamo anterior obtuvo beneficio al estar en mejores condiciones para sus clientes. Con el alza de precio en el combustible  es un factor que constantemente se da siendo una déficit en el ingreso.
Con el préstamo invertirá en la compra de pistones, anillos, conchas de bielas, axiales, válvulas, banda tiempo, balinera tensora, disco de clutch, platos de embrague, también hacerle el overhaull. 
Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo continuo al mantenimiento de su vehículo así como al mejoramiento de su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mario has worked in his own vehicle for some time now, offering transportation services on the public roads. His plan has been to improve his home's infrastructure little by little. He benefited from the previous loan cycle by improving conditions for his customers. Rising gasoline prices are a factor that constantly leaves a deficit in his income.

Mario will invest this loan in pistons, rings, connecting rod bearings, axles, valves, timing belt, ball bearings, clutch plates, and a general overhaul. He is grateful to this finance organization for the continuous help in maintaining his vehicle, as well as the improvement in his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts to overhaaul his taxi.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is from Baringin Sur. He is 48 years old and is married with three children. He works hard to give his family a better quality of life by doing something that brings additional income and will allow him to support his children and extended family. Rolando has been engaged in farming. He usually plants and harvests rice and sells it to the buyers. He is also engaged in a hog-raising business for their extra income. 

According to him, the income from his businesses will help him to cope with the needs of his family. Thus, Rolando wants to obtain a loan in the amount of 30,000 PHP to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and rice seedlings. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested for the further growth of his business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and rice seedlings

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Cristina; ella tiene 37 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de mochilas, ella tiene un atienda donde vende todo tipo de mochilas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de mochilas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mochilas al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Cristina belongs to the "Patron Santiago de Santiago" communal bank. It is located in Cusco district, which is part of the province and department of Cusco. Cristina is 37, single, and has two children. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling backpacks.

She has a store where she sells all kinds of backpacks. She works from 8:00am to 6:00pm. Her dream is to expand her business. 

She is applying for the loan in order to buy backpacks at wholesale.  She is happy to receive the loan, and is committed to making her instalment payments.

loans.use: To buy backpacks at wholesale.

loans.name: Zoila Luz Marina

texts.es:
Zoila es una mujer de 53 años y vive en Isla Trinitaria, una zona periurbana de Guayaquil. Allá tiene su propio pequeño restaurante. Empezó hace 8 años con este negocio como siempre le ha gustado cocinar. 

Con la ayuda de su nuera, empieza a cocinar desde las 8AM hasta la noche, vendiendo almuerzos y meriendas.

Siempre ha tenido problemas con su vista. Se la operaron los ojos, pero su vista sigue siendo mal.

Está casado con un albañil. Juntos tienen 4 hijos, de 32, 28, 26 y 22 años de edad. Ninguno de ellos se ha puesto a cargo de Zoila.

Ella va a usar su prestamo para mejorar su local y así ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Zoila is a 53 year old women who lives in Isla Trinitaria, an area adjoining Guayaquil. She has her own little restaurant there. She began this business eight years ago because she has always loved to cook.

With the help of her daughter-in-law, she begins cooking at 8:00AM onwards until nighttime, selling lunches and snacks.

She has always had problems with her vision. Although they have operated on her eyes, she continues to have poor sight.

She is married to a construction worker. Together they have four children who are 32, 28, 26, and 22 years old. None of them have worked in Zoila’s stand.

She will use the money from the loan to make improvements to her facility and thus offer better service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy rice, and tables and chairs for her restaurant

loans.name: Divino Jesús Group

texts.es:
El comité Divino Jesús, está constituido por 23 señoras dedicadas a todo tipo de actividades. En su mayoría  son madres de familia, quienes aportan con sus ingresos a la casa. Ellas son personas muy trabajadoras y luchadoras que se esfuerzan al máximo para poder sacar adelante a su familia.
Una de las miembros es la señora Fermina, quien se dedica a las ventas, ella es una persona que vende todo tipo de artículos, como ser frazadas, sabanas, fundas y demás tipos de artículos. Ella se define como una persona muy emprendedora y por sobre todo trabajadora, quien lucha por su familia, para poder darles lo mejor y que no pasen por necesidades.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de sabanas, frazadas, fundas y demás, con lo que podrá seguir su negocio y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The committee Divino Jesús is made up of 23 women engaged in all types of activities. The majority are mothers who bring their earnings home. They are very hard workers and fighters and do their best to raise their family.
One of the members is a woman named Fermina, who is in sales. She is a person who sells all types of articles like blankets, sheets, pillowcases and more types of articles. She defines herself as a very entrepreneurial person and overall hard worker who fights for her family, in order to be able to give them the best and not live without necessities.
She is requesting a loan in order to buy sheets, blankets, pillowcases and more, with which she will be able to continue with her business and helping her family.

loans.use: to buy sheets, blankets, pillowcases and more.

loans.name: Las Orquideas Group

texts.es: La nueva Alcancía Comunal “Las Orquideas” está conformada por 09 socias entusiastas de comenzar a trabajar con el Programa – Prosperidad, escogieron ese  nombre ya que la  mayoría de los integrantes son personas que nacieron en pueblo  donde se cultiva dichas flor. Nilda es la presidenta del grupo, es una mujer joven de  21 años de edad es conviviente y aun no tiene hijos, actualmente cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio, este negocio surgió con la idea de contar con un negocio propio, gracias a su arduo trabajo Nilda ha logrado realizar unas de sus metas, comprar su propio terreno. Con el fin de seguir mejorando solicito el crédito para invertir en su negocio comprando gaseosas, galletas, leche, fideos etc. El sueño de Nilda es terminar de construir su vivienda y así poder ampliar su bodega. La nueva Alcancía Comunal “Las Orquideas” están agradecidos por el crédito brindado.   Nilda es la que viste un polo negro.
texts.en:
The new “Las Orquídas” (Orchids) communal bank has nine members who are enthusiastic about starting to work with Programa-Prosperidad.  They chose that name because most of the members were born in a town where said flowers are grown.  

Nilda is the group President.  She is 21 years old and has a spouse though no children yet.  She has a home-based grocery store that arose from her wish to have a business of her own.  Thanks to her hard work, Nilda has managed to reach one of her goals: to buy her own piece of land.

In order to continue improving, she asked for the loan to invest in the business buying soft-drinks, cookies, milk, noodles, etc.  Nilda’s dream is to finish building her house so that she can expand her store.  

The new “Las Orquídeas” communal bank is grateful for the loan provided.  Nilda is the one wearing a black polo shirt.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, cookies,milk and noodles.

loans.name: Santo Tomas Group

texts.es: Este grupo está conformado por cuatro socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Zela mujer de 61 años de edad, soltera, con un hijo de 34 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de mercadería variada como zapatos, ropa, cosméticos desde hace 5 años. Es cliente de la institución desde hace 5 años, el crédito lo solicita para comprar inventario como zapatos de todo estilo, ropa de varón y mujer como pantalones, blusas, camisas, camisetas, faldas, chores, camisolas, etc. María mujer de 51 años de edad, su negocio es  venta de ambientadores de fábrica, Lucia mujer 65 años , su negocio es la venta de zapatos, ropa y refrescos y Lesbia mujer de 32 años de edad y su negocio es una pulpería
texts.en: This group is made up of four enterprising members, one of whom is 61-year-old Zela.  She is single and has a 34-year-old son.  Zela has had a business selling various merchandise, such as shoes, clothes, and cosmetics for five years, during which time she has also been a member of the communal bank.  Zela is applying for this loan to buy shoes of all styles, and to buy new clothes, such as trousers, blouses, shirts, t-shirts, skirts, shorts, sports shirts, and more.  María is 51 years old and has a business selling air fresheners.  Lucia is 65 years old and has a business selling clothes, shoes and drinks.  Thirty-two year old Lesbia has a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy shoes of all styles, and to buy new clothes, such as trousers, blouses, shirts, t-shirts, skirts, shorts, sports shirts, and more.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en: Felisa is from Baggao, Cagayan. Her daughter is currently taking up BS Biology. As a mother she values education thus she wants her child to finish her college education for her to acquire stable job. With that, Felisa is asking for  an educational loan of PHP 10,000 from Kiva lenders. She will use it to pay for the tuition fee of her daughter.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Kibet

texts.en:
Kibet is 26 years old. He is married with two children. He has had a retail shop business for five years.

He will be using the loan to purchase mattresses and cushions and hopes this will help him to pay school fees.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy mattresses and cushions

loans.name: Evdokia

texts.en:
Evdokia T. is 41 years old. She lives with her family in Blagoevgrad. Her two children are students and her husband is unemployed.

She graduated mathematics and worked in The City Computing Center but 6 years ago she lost her job. Then she started a second hand books trade.

Evdokia T. wants to rent and equip one more book shop and to expand her business and that is why she needs an $ 800 loan.

loans.use: To rent and equip one more book shop

loans.name: Aligbo

texts.en:
Aligbo A. is an energetic woman, about 40 years old. Educated through primary school, she got married at age 25 to a farmer with whom she now has three children. She helps with family expenses with revenues from selling garden produce. This is a flourishing business, but she lacks the means to modernize. And so her yield of vegetables is not up to the demands of the marketplace. Today, she is requesting a loan of $850 to buy a motorized pump and watering cans in order to benefit from the weather and to reduce manual labor. This will help her extend her cultivated fields and produce more vegetables for the market. The revenues will serve to meet the needs of the family more easily.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Agée de 40 ans environ, Madame A. Aligbo est une femme dynamique. Instruite de niveau primaire, elle épousa à 25 ans un agriculteur avec qui elle a aujourd’hui trois enfants. Elle contribue aux charges de la famille à partir des revenus tirés de la vente de ses produits maraîchers. C’est une activité très florissante mais Madame A. manque de moyens financiers pour la moderniser ; ce qui fait que le rendement n’est pas à la hauteur de la demande sur le marché. Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite ce crédit de $850 pour pouvoir acheter une motopompe et des arrosoirs des légumes afin de bénéficier du temps et économiser de son énergie. Ceci l’aidera à étendre son espace cultural et produire plus de légumes sur le marché. Les revenus lui serviront à mieux subvenir aux besoins familiaux.

loans.use: To buy a motorized pump and watering cans to grow vegetables for the markets

loans.name: Estrella Maribel

texts.en:
Estrella Maribel is a 42-year-old native of Mérida, Yucatán. She is unmarried but has a 6-year-old dependent son. When she lost her job, she needed a way to earn the money to support her child while still being able to care for him and give him the attention he needs. So she decided to start her own business selling clothing. She began selling at open-air markets in working-class neighborhoods two and a half years ago.

It hasn’t been easy for Estrella to work to support her child on her own, but her love as a mother and her energy have helped her go out day after day to work hard for her child’s well-being. She is now in need of a loan of $475 to acquire merchandise for the continued growth of her business. Estrella and her daughter sincerely appreciate your help and kindness.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Estrella Maribel tiene 42 años de edad, es originaria de Mérida, Yucatán, ella no está casada, pero tiene un hijo de 6 años que depende de ella. Al perder su empleo, tuvo la necesidad de obtener un ingreso que le permitiera sostener a su hijos sin que este le impidiera cuidarlo y darle el tiempo que necesita, decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de ropa, empezó vendiendo en los tianguis de las colonias populares hace dos años y medio.

No ha sido fácil para Estrella trabajar para sostener s su hijo ella sola, pero el amor de madre y su energía la han ayudado a salir día con día a trabajar arduamente en busca de bienestar para su hijo. Ahora ella necesita un préstamo por $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para continuar creciendo con su negocio. Estrella y su hija agradecen sinceramente tu ayuda y cariño.

loans.use: Acquire merchandise

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino works as a taxi driver in the city of La Paz. This is his principal source of income, allowing him to maintain his family and pay for the education of his three children. Marcelino lives in the Tacagua zone of the city of La Paz.

He asks for a loan to purchase a motor for his vehicle. This is his third loan with Impro. His timely repayments on previous loans permits him to solicit another loan. This allows him to continue working and making necessary money to pay his debt and support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Marcelino tiene su taxi que trabaja de servicio en la ciudad de La Paz; esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso la cual le permite mantener a su familia y pagar la educación universitaria de sus tres hijos. Marcelino vive la Zona de Tacagua de Ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito requiere para la compra de un Motor para su movilidad. Es el tercer crédito con Impro; el buen comportamiento de pago de los anteriores dos créditos le faculta para solicitar otro préstamo, para así de esa forma poder seguir trabajando y hacer el dinero necesario para el pago de la deuda y manutención de su familia.

loans.use: To purchase a motor for his taxi

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
“I am happy to be a LAPO member," says Mrs. Patience O.. She is 45 years old, married, and mother of 6 children. She has been a LAPO client since 1997 and lives in Benin City.

Patience sells provisions and fairly used clothes and has been in this business for 10 years. She hopes to be granted a loan of US$ 400 so that she can expand her business by buying more provisions and fairly used clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions & fairly used clothes for sale

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 34-year-old mother of three who lives in the Vituka area in Dar es Salaam. For the past 3 years, she has been selling groceries, mainly cereals, maize and wheat flours, rice, beans, and many other items. She gets the items from the suppliers upcountry, and sells wholesale and retail.

She requests a loan of $400 to purchase more supplies to sell during the upcoming Christmas season.

loans.use: Purchase more supplies to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther E. is 55 years old, married, and has 5 children. She lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells provisions and drinks. She has been an LAPO member for 2 years and needs a loan amount of $875 to buy more provisions and drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale.

loans.name: Heide Jaime

texts.pt:
Heide Jaime M. lives in Liberdade. She is married and the mother of 7 children. She sells necessary products like pastries, sodas, popcorn, crackers, cookies...etc. She entered the program June 30, 2006 with a loan for $150.00US. This is her 4th loan cycle, and she is asking for another $150.00US to increase her inventory. Her business is in front of her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Heide Jaime M., Portadora do BI nº100041170W residente do bairro da Liberdade, Vive maritalmente mae de 7 filhos é negociante vende produtos de 1º necessidade tais como ,Bolos refregerantes pipocas biscoitos etc. entrou no programa a 30/06/06, tomando o valor de 3000 mt esta no 4º coclo vai tomar o valor de 3000 mt para aumentar os produtos ,tem o seu negocio em frente da sua casa.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Maryana

texts.en:
Maryana B. is married and lives in Korolyovo, western Ukraine. She sells women’s clothing in the local market and has the biggest variety of women’s clothing items in the market. She is very cheerful and friendly. Her first goal, to please her customers, has added a lot to the success of her business. Maryana’s reasonable pricing policy also helps her keep loyal clients and attract new customers.

Maryana has been an entrepreneur for three years. Loans she has received and repaid through Nadiya Ukraine have also had a big part in the growth of her business. Presently, she has about $5000 in inventory. Her turnover capital is about $3000. Her monthly net profit is about $600.

Today Maryana is requesting a loan of $1000 to increase her assorted inventory. This financial assistance will help her increase her sales and grow her business as a result. Not only will it help Maryana obtain the necessary inventory and attract more customers, it will help her meet the needs of her family and provide a better livelihood for them.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing inventory

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Mr. Alfredo R. is a shoemaker, a trade which he learned from his father, and he started his shoe business ten years ago. He started out by repairing shoes, but his years of experience allowed him to grow and develop his skills, which is why he now makes and sells leather shoes for men and women. His business is located in Villa Flor Norte, in his own neighborhood. He has a good number of customers, such as retailers who purchase great quantities of shoes. This man’s biggest wish is to expand his business, and make it one in which he can hire workers who design, manufacture, and sell a variety of shoe styles in the inland region of the country. Alfredo lives alone, so he uses the majority of his profits to purchase leather, shoe soles, glue, nails, and other materials. For greater security, he needs to rebuild the wall behind his house, which is currently made of aluminum sheeting, so he is requesting a loan in order to construct a concrete wall.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Alfredo es de oficio Zapatero, actividad que le enseñó su padre y a la cual se dedica, hace 10 años inició su negocio, comenzó reparando zapatos, los años de experiencia le permitieron desarrollarse y crecer, por lo cual hoy en día elabora y comercializa zapatos de cuero para varón y mujer. Su negocio se encuentra en Villa Flor Norte, barrio donde habita. Cuenta con un buen numero de clientes como lo son los comerciantes de los mercados que le compran grandes cantidades de zapatos. El mayor deseo del señor es el de expandir su negocio, en el cual cuente con trabajadores que le diseñen y le confeccionen una variedad de estilos de zapatos así como el de comercializarlos en todo el interior del país. El señor vive solo, la mayor parte de los ingresos del negocio lo utiliza para comprar cuero, zuela de zapatos, pega, clavos, entre otros insumos. Para su mayor seguridad necesita la construcción de la pared de atrás de su vivienda, la cual esta construida con laminas de zinc, por lo cual solicita un préstamo para poderla levantar de concreto.

loans.use: Purchase of cement, sand, cinder blocks and iron

loans.name: Secretos De Damas Group

texts.en:
Monica is a 37 year-old woman living with her husband and six children in a small and impoverished community on the far outskirts of the Santo Domingo capital area. From her home and the streets, she sells used clothing to her community members; in fact, she is requesting this loan so that she can finally buy sufficient inventory to meet the demand she faces every week.

With the money from the loan, she plans to go to one of the major marketplaces in the capital to buy her used clothing at bulk. Doing this will increase her profit margin and decrease expenses incurred in trips and higher inventory costs.

Monica hopes that with the increased profit made possible by this loan, she can continue expanding and developing her business and eventually return to school to become better educated. She wants to make certain that her children always have enough to eat and will be able to stay in school instead of quitting to help make money for the family. It is also the family's dream to have enough money to buy their own home and land. Monica's personal goals are to advance herself as a businesswoman, friend, and leader in her community.

On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, and from Monica herself, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

loans.use: To invest in bundles of used clothing

loans.name: Zaina's Food Vending Group

texts.en:
Zaina is 39 years old and is married with 2 children, ages 14 and 10. Zaina owns a small food vendor store, which she started in 2003. Everyday, she works from 8am to 4pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $165 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mwajabu, who has business dealing in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Mrs Virginia is 45 years old, she finished middle school. She lives Jr. Tapoje Nº 388 in the city of Yunguyo. She is a mother of 5 children who depend on her. Her husband works at the Municipality of Yunguyo and she does multiple activities: she sells cell phones, she buys and sells Peruvian Paso horses and breeds dairy cattle to cover the different family expenses. The biggest investment goes to the cell phone business where she obtains the biggest profit and movement of the capital. On her own initiative and some partners they founded the Communal Bank Kapia Marca del Barrio Primero D. Mayo D. Yunguyo 8 years ago. With the first loan of $100, she was able to buy 2 horses obtaining a small profit. With the loan of $700 which will be repaid over a period of 6 months; she will increase the capital of her cell phone business. She is satisfied with the business she started and with the profits she is able to cover the expenses of food and education of her children; her vision for the future is to be a successful businesswoman where her children are her main business partners.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Virginia tiene 45 años D. edad, educación secundaria completa, domiciliada en Jr. Tapoje Nº 388 en la ciudad D. Yunguyo, es madre D. 5 hijos los cuales dependen D. ella, su esposo trabaja en la Municipalidad D. Yunguyo y ella se dedica a múltiples actividades como venta D. celulares, compra y venta D. caballo D. pasos y cría ganado lechero para cubrir los diferentes gastos D. la familia. Mayor inversión e administración lo realiza en el negocio D. celulares por que obtiene mayor ganancia y movimiento del capital. Hace 8 años por iniciativa propia y algunas socias fundaron el Banco Comunal Kapia Marca del Barrio Primero D. mayo D. Yunguyo, con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles se compro 2 caballos para la venta teniendo poca ganancia, Con el préstamo D. S/.2,000.00 el cual será cancelado en 6 meses incrementara su capital del negocio D. celulares Se encuentra muy satisfecha por los negocios emprendidos y por la ganancia que obtiene para cubrir los gastos D. alimentación, educación D. sus hijos; su visión futura es ser una empresaria exitosa en donD. conformen sus hijos como socios principales.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise for ther business.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan K. makes Cambodian Cakes and sells them in her village. She earns approximately US$2 per day. Her husband, Mr. San Ran, is a farmer in the Sangkemeanchey Village, Siem Reap Province. K. works hard every day; however, even with the income from her cake business, it is still very difficult to cover all of the family's expenses. 

Mrs. K.’s cakes are very popular, and the demand is increasing. She would therefore like to be able to expand her business and serve the new customers. A loan of US$100 will allow Mrs. K. to purchase ingredients to make more cakes for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for a bakery business

loans.name: Muyassar

texts.en:
Muyassar K.  lives in Khujand. She is 47 years old. Mrs. K. is a seamstress by profession. She is a very knowledgeable worker and has repeat customers since she has a good reputation as a competent seamstress. Mrs. K. has been working in this sphere for the last 27 years. She uses both traditional and European motifs in her work and is engaged in making traditional and European wear. 

Mrs. K. is applying to KIVA for help in the form of a business development loan of 1250 STJ for 6 months to purchase modern equipment.

loans.use: purchasing modern equipment

loans.name: Emprendedoras Group

texts.en:
The Emprendedoras ("Enterprising Women") group is maD. up of twelve women and two men who live in the El Abasto area of Santa Cruz D. la Sierra, a tropical region in eastern Bolivia. Most of the women sell clothing and cosmetics, while some work as cleaning personnel and secretaries. Carlos works as an electrician, and Ricardo works at a hardware store. Marisela works in an auto body shop. She and Mirtha, a saleswoman, have the most work experience of all the group members, working 10 and 12 years in their respective areas.

Most of the group members plan to use the loan to expand their businesses by purchasing more merchandise to sell. Others plan to buy more tools and equipment for their businesses with their loans.

Though many of the group members say they have had previous loans at other Bolivian microfinance institutions, this is Emprendedoras' first group loan with AgroCapital (Kiva's Field Partner).

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to sell, and buy tools and equipment

loans.name: Abdurozokova

texts.en: Mrs. Abdurozokova N. sells children's clothing in the local bazaar.  She has worked in this kind of business for 4 years. She works as the bookkeeper; the business provides income for her family.  Mrs. Abdurozokova N. is requesting a business support loan of 1800 STJ ($550 USD) for 6 months to import a new seasonal assortment of clothing. Abdurozokova N. took her first loan from MicroInvest in 2008. Thanks to the previous loan, she was able to improve her existing assortment.  She is a reliable client who trusts our loan procedure and intends to co-operate with us fully.

loans.use: importing a new seasonal assortment of clothing

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa inicio vendiendo ropa primero solo sobre pedidos a sus familiares los fines de semana como chamarras y cosas una temporada de invierno. Después fue comprando más cantidad de ropa en Moroleón y así se quedaba con ropa que no vendía y luego la sacaba al porche de su casa para la venta pero ahora quiere instalar un local en los mercados.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $225 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía prepararse en la temporada de diciembre .
texts.en:
Luisa began selling clothing on weekends such as jackets and other winter clothing, due to requests from family members. Later she purchased higher quantities of clothing in Moroleón and had left over clothing that she did not sell, so she began selling it from her porch, and now wants to open a stand in the local market. Luisa needs a $225 loan which she will repay in 3 months to purchase merchandise to sell in the month of December.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase jackets

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane sells juice and drinks in wholesale and retail to her customers. Jane is 40 years old and married with four children. Jane is a LAPO Microfinance client. Jane is requesting a loan of N100,000 ($425 USD) to increase her inventory. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more juice and drinks to sell

loans.name: Mercedez

texts.en:
“Sincerity and patience are the attitudes that a businesswoman like me must have. In every business dealing, I always wear my friendly smile to gain others' sympathy and trust,” Mercedes said. 

Mercedez Y. is married to Bernardo Y. Sr. and they are blessed with five children. The eldest is an elementary graduate, 37-year-old Bernardo Y. Jr.; followed by Freddie, 36 years old, a high school graduate; Bernadette, 30 years old, and a college graduate; Karen, 29 years old, a high school graduate; and Gerald, 18 years old, an elementary graduate. Her two eldest sons are working abroad as drivers in Dubai, and the other two work in their rural place at San Mateo Quirino, Isabela. 

Mercedez is a direct dealer of personal products for young and old people. Sometimes, she also sells ready-to-wear (RTW) clothes. She is able to earn at least $25 (1200 PHP) net income per week. She wants to improve her business to prepare for their future, especially now that she is 59 years old. 

To fulfill her plans, she is requesting a loan of $200 (9000 PHP) to further increase the quantity of products she sells and, therefore, earn more income.

loans.use: Buy more products to sell

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a member of the Suni ("Strength" in Quechua) Village Bank.  Teresa is 53 years old and is a single mother of nine children. 

Teresa has a stand in the Señor de Arequipa Market where she sells fruits and vegetables seven days a week. Teresa and her daughter also plan to start a new business selling lumber. Teresa needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy lumber and fruit. Teresa hopes to improve her house and dreams that her children to have stable jobs.  

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow
Teresa es socia del Banco Comunal Suni. 
Teresa es madre soltera, tiene 53 años y 9 hijos, Teresa tiene un puesto en el mercado Señor de Arequipa en donde vende frutas, verduras, actividad que realiza todos los días. Teresa tiene proyectado iniciar un nuevo negocio de venta de maderas junto a su hija. 
Teresa necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de madera y frutas. 
Los sueños de Teresa son mejorar su casa, que sus hijos tengan un trabajo estable.

loans.use: Buy lumber and fruit

loans.name: Fati

texts.en: Fati S. is a forty five years old widow and has given birth to eleven children. Unfortunately, 5 of the children have passed away. Four of her remaining children are males and two are daughters, all of whom are in school. She lives with the children in a rented apartment in Koforidua, a small town not very far from Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Fati works very hard to provide for her children. She is a farmer and trader of banana and cassava. She buys cassava and unripe banana from farmers in her locality and from the nearby villages and resells to retailers in her community local market. Fati has been in business for six years. It is Fati’s desire to save enough money to support her children in their academics. She is requesting a loan to procure banana and cassava in bulk so she can maximize her profit margin.

loans.use: To procure banana and cassava for resale.

loans.name: Upendo-2 Group

texts.en:
Anna owns a small grocery store in the Usariver neighborhood of Arusha. She currently makes an average monthly profit of $450. Every day she works at her business from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.  She is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more grocery items for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Anna is 39 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 4 and 9. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Veronica Who also has her own small business in Arusha.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for her business.

loans.name: Vinh

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Vịnh 45 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2004. Gia đình chị có 4 con trong đó có hai con đã trưởng thành,  2 con đang đi học. Hiện tại gia đình chị Vịnh  chăn nuôi, làm vườn trang tại . Bên cạnh đó chồng chị còn làm thêm nghề đóng gạch, hàng tháng  các con đều hỗ trợ bố mẹ để tăng thêm thu nhập cho  gia đình .Với mức thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng kinh tế gia đình chị Vịnh đang ngày càng ổn định và phát triển hơn.
Vòng vốn tới chị Vịnh mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua cây giống về trồng và mua vật liệu  về đóng gạch bán.
texts.en:
Ms. Nguyễn Thị Vịnh is 45 yrs old, and joined TYM fund in 2004. Her family has 4 children, 2 are grown and 2 are still in school. Currently, her family raises animals and ornamental trees. Besides this business, her husband is a brick layer. Every month her children help out to supplement the family's income. With average income of 287 USD per month, her family's economic situation is expanding and becoming more stable everyday. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 575 USD to buy additional trees and seeds to plant, and bricks to sell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: raises animals

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is married with six children, three of whom are under the age of fifteen. Mary makes her living by farming and selling household products. This loan will be Mary's first and will be used to purchase groundnut (peanut) seeds and fertilizer, and Maggi (a popular seasoning in Cameroon) and garlic to sell.

Mary believes her farming business will continue to do well because her land is fertile, she will weed the land early, and her husband and children will assist her on the farm. With the profits from this loan, Mary plans to pay for her children's education. She will also be able to pay for equipment that she needs for the house, and buy more food so that her family can have a balanced diet.

Mary appreciates GHAPE and its policies because of its training sessions and gradual repayment plan. She says that she will work harder than ever before because she feels empowered by her loan!

More about GHAPE
The Grounded and Holistic Approach for People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff, and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase groundnut seeds, fertilizer, Maggi and garlic

loans.name: Sieb

texts.en:
Mrs. C. is 28 years old and married, with two minor children who are enrolled in school. For the past eight years, she has been sewing clothes for her neighbors. In the business, she sews kinds of clothes like modern and traditional clothes and those made from silk.

As another source of family income, her husband makes a daily revenue by selling oxen. He usually goes to buy oxen from faraway places to fatten them at his home and later re-sell them to gain income.

Due to the family's hope to improve their businesses, C. and her husband have decided to seek a US$ 1000 loan to buy tailoring materials and more oxen for fattening.

loans.use: To buy tailoring materials and more oxen to fatten

loans.name: Ebenezer

texts.en: Ebenezer I. is married with 4 children and has received an education through Senior High School. Since 1999, he has worked selling electrical appliances at Zion Church in Cape Coast.  His wife also works as a petty trader in the same area.  Ebenezer uses his income to pay for his family’s utilities, rent and food. Ebenezer will use the loan to purchase more electrical appliances for re-sale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Ebenezer plans to finish building the house he has started.

loans.use: to purchase more electrical appliances for re-sale

loans.name: Mukarram

texts.en:
Education is the most important inheritance Mukarram and her husband can give to their four dear children. They are both very responsible parents, and they work very hard in agriculture and farming so that they can give their children the opportunity to finish school – an opportunity they never had due to poor finances. This happy mother has been working in agriculture since getting married and, with the unconditional support of her husband and elder son, she buys and sells cattle in order to cover the family’s most urgent needs. Even so, she now finds herself with more expenses, and she would like a loan in order to increase their capital by increasing their number of cattle. Mukarram and her family are awaiting your rapid response.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
 Замира Нематова имеет собственный продуктовый магазин. Поставляет туда товар, но продавцом в нем работает сестра ее мужа, так как у Замиры дома есть несколько голов крупнорогатого скота. Откормив купленный ею молодой скот, она хорошо его откармливает и продает.  И получает хорошую прибыль от этого бизнеса.
 В этой сфере деятельности ей помогает муж Шухрат.
 Замира подала заявку на получение кредита в размере 1000 сомони и хочет купить  дополнительно в свое домашнее стадо еще одного бычка.
texts.en:
Zamira N. owns her own grocery store. She keeps the store, and has her husband's sister working as a clerk there, while Zamira tends to cattle which she keeps at home. She feeds her young cattle and then sells them off, as it is a profitable business for her. She helps her husband, Shukhrat this way. Zamira applied for a loan of 1000 somoni and wishes to purchase more cattle.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: puchase of cattle

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Yorn K., 60, and her husband, Mr. Sorn Net, 61, live along national road number one about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They married in 1972 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. Two of them are garment factory workers.

Mr. Sorn Net is a construction constructor, while Mrs. Yorn is a housewife. Their son wants to drive a motor remoque taxi (a motorbike with a passenger trailer at the back) in which he can carry garment factory workers, but he doesn’t have enough money to buy one. Therefore, Yorn is asking for her second loan of $1,000 to help finance her son.

loans.use: For a motor remoque her son will drive as a taxi

loans.name: Hilario

texts.en:
Hilario P. is from the village of Kiburiao, Quezon Bukidnon. He is 43 years old. Hilario is married and has school-aged children. To make a living, Hilario owns and operates a business running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Hilario has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.(Hilario was out of town during the picture taking, so we let his wife represent him, being a partner in their business.)

In 1997, Hilario joined HSPFI to have access to financial services. As to their previous loan, Helario and his wife are both happy and thankful for all the Kiva lenders who provide financial support. With this support, their business is growing and making more progress than before. They are hopeful that lenders may continue to finance their business activities. They have just ended their previous loan amounting to PHP 20,000. Hilario is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 15th loan taken out by Hilario from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family, educational expenses of the children and savings for future emergencies. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell at his shop

loans.name: Kinegamgosi A Group

texts.en:
Farida is a member of the Kinegamgosi A borrower group,she is 34 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children.Her children are aged 14,10,6 years.

Farida started her own food business selling vegetable and fruits 6 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tsh.

This is Farida`s first loan from BRAC.She requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more vegetable and fruits.

With the profit she gain from the use of this loan Farida hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Edia is another member of the same borrower group,she also requested loan amount 200,000 Tsh inorder to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetable and fruits

loans.name: Dora Haydee

texts.es:
Dora H., mujer sencilla y de carácter muy humilde, sobresale por ser una clienta en grupo solidario muy destacada, era la coordinadora del grupo y promovedora de la responsabilidad y de la puntualidad.

Actualmente está manejando créditos individuales de montos superiores y sigue siendo una mujer de negocios muy exitosa. Hace 18 años Dora generaba ingresos en su hogar a través de la venta de hielo, helados y la elaboración de sopas los domingos. Hasta que conoció ADIM hace 10 años y le hablaron de la oportunidad de ampliar su negocio. 

Fue entonces cuando decidió iniciar la venta de comida en su hogar.  Actualmente Dora vende todo tipo de comida y bebidas por las noches (Comida típica, refrescos, jugos naturales, helados, hielo, entre otros).

Con la ayuda de su esposo lograron sacar adelante su hogar; y aun que ha tenido que enfrentar el golpe de la pérdida de su esposo, afirma desea terminar de criar a sus hijo menor y poder ver a sus nietos por muchos años. Son estos el  motivo de su fuerza, ya que la pérdida de su esposo le ha dejado un vacio muy grande. “Pero esto solo se pasa enfocándose en el trabajo y los seres amados” dice Dora

Su crédito pretende invertirlo en la mejora del negocio y una mínima parte en algunos medicamentos. Anhela con comprar herramientas que le facilites el trabajo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Dora H., a simple and humble woman, stands out in the group as a noteworthy client. She was the group coordinator and promoted responsibility and punctuality. She is currently handling individual loans of larger amounts and continues being a successful business woman. For the last 18 years Dora has been generating income from her home by selling ice, ice cream and soups on Sundays. Ten years ago she found out about ADIM and was made aware of opportunities to enlarge her business. She then decided to start the sale of food from her home. Currently Dora sell all types of food and beverages in the evenings ( Local dishes, refreshments, natural juices, ice creams, ice, and others). With the help of her husband they have been able to get ahead. Even after suffering the terrible loss of her husband, she is set on raising her small son and wants to be able to see her grandchildren for many years to come. This is the reason for her strength, especially after the large void left by the loss of her husband. "This happens only by focusing on my work and my loved ones" says Dora. She plans to invest the proceeds from her loan in her business, with a small portion going towards some medications. She wishes to buy equipment that will make the work of her business easier.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains and equipment for her food business.

loans.name: Harrison Kimani

texts.en:
Harrison is married to Lucy Nyambura and they have two children, Mark, four years old, and Amos, four months.

Harrison has been in the hardware business for nine years. The area in which his store is located is the site of much new development; therefore, he gets lots of customers.

Harrison has had no previous credit history with other MFI's. He was introduced to KADET by existing clients. He is requesting a loan in order to add more stock to his hardware shop, including glass, paint, and building materials. With the extra profit, he intends to build rental houses on his plot.

In the future, Harrison hopes and dreams to open another hardware store. He believes he has what it takes to do this because he is very hardworking.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information about KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To add to the retail stock (such as glass, paint, and buiding materials) of his hardware store.

loans.name: Maricill

texts.en:
Maricill S., 26, is married and a resident of Barangay III, Tangub City. She is blessed with one infant child. Her husband, Romeo earns income as a "trisikad" (pedicab) driver. For some years, they were just renting a trisikad and they were earning an average net income of Php 3,500.00 a month.

She was very interested in joining the PMPC program. Now, she requests a loan of Php 4,000.00 to add to their money to purchase a second hand trisikad. The couple is very thankful to PMPC because many poor entrepreneurs uplift from poverty.

loans.use: Purchase of second hand trisikad.

loans.name: Milagrosa

texts.en:
Milagrosa P. is from the city of Tinago Ozamiz. She is 46 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Milagrosa owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized "mangga" retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling mango fruits in the local community. Milagrosa has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Milagrosa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and strengthen her business. Milagrosa is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Milagrosa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Harriet's Group

texts.en: Harriet B.  is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is 38 years old and divorced with 4 children to take care of aged 2 to `5 years. She also takes care of other orphans. Harriet is such a hard working lady having been a housewife before her husband walked away. She has a Kiosk in Namuyenje that she has been running for 2 years and earns a small  profit that helps her manage her family. She sells all kinds of products ranging from muffins to fresh vegetables to earn a living. Her dream is to expand her business further as well as to continue educating her children. Harriet needs a loan to help restock her business with more goods to increase her profits.

loans.use: Restocking her kiosk with more goods.

loans.name: Marelyn

texts.en:
Marelyn C. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin. She is 41 years old and married. To make a living, Marelyn owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community.

Marelyn joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Marelyn is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her third from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Kusikoyllor Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios, pertenecen al banco comunal “KUSIKOYLLOR”. El nombre del banco comunal es D. origen D. la lenguaje “Quechua” que traducido al español significa “Mujer bonita”. Este banco comunal está conformado por 17 miembros, ellos se reúnen una vez al mes en el local principal D. La Asociación Arariwa.  

Nuestros socios alternan sus diversas actividades con el comercio minorista en la ciudad del Cusco, una gran parte se dedica a la venta D. ropa, D. productos D. belleza, D. artesanía, etc. Otras socias alquilan carros (Taxis) pues así dan trabajo a personas que trabajan haciendo el servicio D. transporte en la ciudad. La socia Georgina y Lucia son profesionales en enfermería y trabajan en el Hospital Regional del Cusco. Otras socias se dedican a la venta D. artesanía (joyas, pulseras, huacos retratos, mantos, etc.). La socia Sonia cría pollos y después D. alimentarlos los comercializa. Una socia tiene un pequeño negocio D. hacer tejidos. La socia Valentina tiene su agencia D. viajes y ofrece a los turistas paquetes turísticos para todo el Valle Sagrado D. los Incas que conforma las ciudades D.: Pisaq, Calca, Urubamba, Ollaytaytambo y Machupicchu.       

Los socios solicitan el préstamo para que lo utilicen como capital D. trabajo y D. esta manera incrementar sus productos y aumentar sus ventas, para dar mejor calidad D. vida a sus familias.

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

(Las socias Vicky y Elvira no aparecen en la fotografía porque pidieron permiso a la junta directiva del banco comunal y se fueron antes D. tomar la foto).
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank “Kusikoyllor”, which means “Beautiful Woman” in the Quecha language. The group consists of 17 members who meet once a month at the main office of Asociación Arariwa. The members diviD. their time between various activities and managing their small businesses in the city of Cusco. Most of them are devoted to selling clothing, beauty products, handicrafts, and other goods. Other members rent out taxis, thus creating employment for people who work in the city’s transportation sector. Members Georgina and Lucia are nurse practitioners who work at the Regional Hospital of Cusco. Some sell handmaD. works such as jewelry, bracelets, Huacan paintings, blankets, etc. Sonia raises chickens for use in the dishes that she sells. Another member has a small business producing fabric. Valentina has her own travel agency where she offers visitors packaged tours of the various ancient cities around the Sacred Valley such as Pisac, Calca, Urubamba, Machu Picchu, and Ollantaytambo. The group is requesting a loan to use as working capital so that they can increase their products and improve their sales. This will proviD. a better quality of life for their families. The members value and appreciate this loan and commit to making their payments on time. (Group members Vicky and Elvira requested permission from the Communal Bank directors not to have their photograph taken. They were allowed to leave before the picture was taken.)

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Atta

texts.en: Atta is a forty-three year old married man with four unemployed children. He has owned a restaurant in his town since 1995 and serves delicious Lebanese food there. Atta is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy food products and to make some renovations to his restaurant.

loans.use: Buy food products and make restaurant renovations

loans.name: Mrs. Savet Nou Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan to 21 people who all live in Dak Por village in Takeo province.  The loan is coordinated through the village bank. All the members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Savet N. is the village bank president.  She is a farmer and owns 0.5 hectares on which she grows rice. Her husband, Mr. Y. Phal, is a construction worker who makes a small income to support the family. Although Mrs. Savet N. and her husband both work hard they still do not earn enough to fix up their house and make it livable.  In order to repair her house, Mrs. Savet N. is asking for a loan.  Mrs. Savet N. has three children, two of whom are in school and the third is a silk weaver.

loans.use: House repairs to make a livable home

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es: Don Maximo es casado, tiene  3 hijos menores de edad,  es pequeño productor ganadero con 23 años de experiencia, posee un parcela en la comarca Villa Alvarez de 33 mzs, con un poco de inventario ganadero, la cual presenta buenas condiciones tècnicas para el desarrollo del hato, con infraestructura de corral, galera, manga, para el desarrollo del ordeño, pastos mejorados, le brinda suplementos alimenticios y manejo fitosanitario al ganado, está solicitando su primer crédito para compra de terneros de desarrollo, con el objetivo de aumentar su inventario ganadero y obtener ganancias al momento de la comercialización, para lograr así un buen desarrollo de la inversión.,  es muy reconocido en su comunidad con gran liderazgo, sueña con tener un futuro mejor que mejore la calidad de vida del nucleo familiar.
texts.en:
Maximo is married and has three young children. He is a raiser of livestock with 23 years of experience and has a parcel of land in the region of Villa Alvarez with a small inventory of cattle. The land has good technical conditions for the development of the herd, with infrastructure for milking and improved pastures that provide food supplements and healthy plants to the cattle. He is requesting his first loan to purchase calves with the objective of increasing his cattle inventory and obtaining better profits at the time of sale, thus achieving a good development from this investment. Maximo is well known in his community for his great leadership, and he dreams of a better future and improving the quality of life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La señora María Auxiliadora L. tiene 55 años edad madre soltera tiene un hijo a su cargo por el cual ella se esfuerza en su negocio trabajándolo de lunes a domingos de seis y media de la mañana a cinco de la tarde para sacarlo adelante.
La señora L. antes de tener su negocio era ama de casa, pero mi hijo que esta fuera del país me brindo una ayuda económicamente y decidí poner mi negocio de venta de frescos y pan con mantequilla, ahora en mi tramo vendo papeles de regalos, gaseosas, productos Diana agua helada.
Tiene cuatro años de trabajar con nosotros en los cuales los financiamientos que ella ha solicitado es para surtir su negocio, comprando mercadería a precios cómodos no agarrando créditos a proveedores
texts.en:
María Auxiliadora L., age 55, is a single mother with one child. Her child is why she puts forth great effort in her business. She works from Monday to Sunday from six thirty in the morning until five in the afternoon to get her child ahead. Mrs. L. was a housewife before she had this business. Her son, who is outside of the country, gave her economic support. She decided to set up her business of selling refreshments and bread and butter. Now she sells gift paper, soft drinks, Diana products, and chilled water in her small shop. She has worked with us for four years. The loans she has requested in that time have been to stock her store. She buys merchandise at good prices and does not take loans from the providers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soft drinks and costume jewelry

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan L. is from the village of Yumbing, Camiguin Province. She is 41 years old. Susan is single and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Susan owns & operates a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Susan has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Susan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. Susan is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Susan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rispah

texts.en:
Rispah A. is married to Harold and they have two children who are in college pursuing different courses: Jane who is 22 years old and Robert 20 years old. They live within Vihiga town in Kenya's Western province.

Rispah runs a greenhouse and has been in the business for the last 5 years. She is applying for a second loan from Kadet Limited after successfully completing the first one. Rispah wants to use the money to expand her greenhouse, buy watermelon seeds, and expand her poultry by buying 300 chicks. Her clientele mainly include the supermarkets around where she sells green vegetables, eggs, and watermelons.
