Her dream and desire is to expand the greenhouse to accommodate production of a variety of vegetables and fruits to supply to all supermarkets in the Western province.

loans.use: Expand the greenhouse, buy watermelon seeds, and buy 300 chicks

loans.name: Emele

texts.en:
Emele M. is 51 and married with 5 children.  She owns a business venture, providing general  alteration & tailoring services to local community members.  Emele has 1 year of experience in this business.  Emele needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Emele joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Emele's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Emele M. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Margarit

texts.en:
Margarit A. lives in Sevan with her husband who is a pensioner. She has 3 children and all of them are married and live separately from their parents.

Margarit is a food technologist; she worked as a head of a laboratory for a bread-baking plant. After that, she worked as a food technology and culinary teacher at Sevan College. Margarit now manages her own clothes trading business in Sevan fair. 

Mаrgarit is a 5th cycle borrower from Nor Horizon, and now she needs an 800,000 AMD loan to buy an assortment of spring clothes  for her business. In the future, Margarit and her husband intend to become involve in bee-keeping, which will help them to increase their income.

loans.use: To buy an assortment of spring clothes for her business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN MARIA DE INQUILPATA” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

Martha tiene 34 años y tiene dos hijos de los cuales depende todavía de la socia, ella vive en la comunidad de Inquilpata del distrito de Anta del departamento del Cusco. Su principal actividad económica es la venta de comestibles como por ejemplo azúcar, fideos, arroz, leche, etc. ella vende sus productos en el Campo Ferial de la Comunidad Campesina de Inquilpata-Anta los días viernes. Su actividad económica complementaria es alquilar maquinaria para construcción de casas como por ejemplo vibradora y mezcladora de cemento. 

Martha es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia, ella requiere el crédito para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar y muchas cosas más.    
 
Martha se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Martha pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN MARIA DE INQUILPATA” de la Asociación Arariwa. Martha is 34 years old and has two children that depend on her. She lives in the community of Inquilpata in the district of Anta in the department of Cusco. Her principle activity is the sale of food products like: sugar, noodles, rice, milk, etc. She sells products at the Fair Grounds at the Country Community of Inquilpata-Anta on Fridays. Her complementary economic activity is to rent machinery for the construction of houses, for example a concrete vibrator and a cement mixer. Martha is an entrepreneurial and hard working woman that finds every opportunity to get ahead and with her daily strength helps her family at every opportunity, she needs this loan to buy merchandise like rice sugar, and many other things. Martha is grateful for this opportunity and is committed to completing the payments according to schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Martha needs the loan to buy merchandise, for example rice, sugar and many other things

loans.name: Wuiliam Enrique

texts.es:
Wuiliam tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero y vive en casa de su madre ubicada en la ciudad de Ferreñafe, conocida a nivel nacional por la elaboración de comidas típicas, se encuentra ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace un año a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su vivienda, el nos comenta que la bodega fue inicialmente instalada por su madre, pero ella viajó a la ciudad de Lima para trabajar, desde entonces el se ha hecho cargo del negocio y se vale de el para salir adelante.

Wuiliam trata diariamente de satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes ofreciéndoles productos de calidad y un buen trato, sus esfuerzos estan teniendo resultado y eso lo pone contento. El desea ampliar su negocio para poder percibir mas ganancias, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de abarrotes para lograr su objetivo.

Wuiliam es un joven bastante trabajador y responsable, su mayor anhelo es ampliar su negocio y convertirse en un empresario de éxito, en la zona donde vive el es muy conocido y estimado por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Wuiliam is 26 years old, single, and lives at his mother’s house in the city of Ferreñafe, which is known nationally for its traditional dishes. This community is located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past year, Wuiliam has been selling basic necessities and groceries from a store inside of his home. He says that his mother was responsible for starting the business, but she then had to travel to the city of Lima for work. At that point, he was left in charge of the business and was able to make it succeed.

Wuiliam tries every day to satisfy the demand of his customers by offering them high quality products and good service. He is happy with the results that came about from his efforts. Wuiliam wants to grow his business in order to generate more earnings. For this reason, he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN to invest in the purchase of groceries in order to achieve his goal.

Wuiliam is a hardworking and responsible young man. His greatest wish is to expand his business and become a successful businessman. He is well-known in the area where he lives and respected by his neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries to expand his business

loans.name: Izro

texts.en:
Izro D. is from the town of Banga. His friends say he is an understanding and a funny man. Izro is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Izro owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Izro has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Izro joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Izro has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Izro is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Izro from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children and improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is 37 years old and is married with two children, 5 and 8 years old. Both children are attending school.

Ben is a farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been farming for six years and has one employee. His products are milk, which he sells to the local market, and tea, which he sells to the local tea factory. Before he ventured into farming, Ben was running a timber business.

Ben’s biggest challenges in farming are animal diseases, lack of enough animal feeds, and poor marketing.

Ben has requested this Kes 35,000 loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help him provide for his family.

In future, Ben would like to acquire high-yielding dairy cows and increase his land to plant grass and build a good, modern dairy unit

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Sisi Catherine

texts.fr: A. Sisi Catherine est née en 1956 à Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Catherine vit depuis une vingtaine d’année au quartier Agbalilamè dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Catherine est mariée à MIGAN Pierre et est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Catherine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges familiales. Catherine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis vingt ans, Catherine vend du bois de chauffage à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Catherine vend de la bouillie de maïs accompagnée de pâté (fait à base de farine de blé). Catherine achète ses bois de chauffage à ONAB (Société de commercialisation de bois au Bénin). C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Catherine désire développer davantage son activité et augmenter son chiffre d’affaire, à travers ses ventes. C’est pour y parvenir que Catherine sollicite un autre concours financier de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Sisi Catherine A. was born in 1956 at Sèmè-Podji in Bénin. For twenty years, Catherine has lived in the Agbalilamè neighborhood of the Sèmè-Podji commune. She is married to Pierre MIGAN and is the mother of two school-aged children. Catherine lives together with her husband and children. The couple shares the various familial responsibilities. Catherine did not go to school. For twenty years, she has sold firewood from her home. As a side business, Catherine sells corn porridge accompanied with corn mush (made from flour). Catherine buys her firewood at ONAB (a wood marketing company in Bénin). She is a former client of ALIDé who repays her loans in full. Catherine would like to further expand her business and to increase her revenue through her sales. To achieve this, Catherine is requesting further financial assistance from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of firewood

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira V. is from the village of Centro Norte, Alcala, Cagayan. She is 42 years old and is married with three school-aged children.

Elvira owns and operates a restaurant, serving lunch foods to customers in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twleve years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

Elvira joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase food and drinks for her restaurant. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

Seen in the picture with Elvira is the ASKI Credit Officer who is helping her in the processing of her loan. 


About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food and drinks for her restaurant

loans.name: Esabel Mangubal's Group

texts.en:
Esabel M. is from the village of Yahong, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old. Esabel is the group leader of a four-member group. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Esabel M. Group.

Esabel is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Esabel owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Esabel has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Esabel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esabel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Esabel is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Esabel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Iringo Twebiseho, Ntungamo Group

texts.en:
It is now 16 years since N. Grace started up his farming business adventure in Kikuuto, Ntungamo. The married mother of 3 children is very aggressive and determined when it comes to lucrative business. She has since engaged herself in various farming practices, including banana growing, which is her main source of livelihood alongside growing coffee and her teaching profession. 

N. Grace's main drawbacks include the bad weather conditions, like drought, which reduces the rate of production in terms of poor quality and also the fluctuating prices. With this loan she is looking forward to purchasing more farm inputs to improve on production. Grace is very optimistic about producing more harvests and increasing sales revenue. With these improvements, she will be able to look after her family and pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: Towards purchase of farm inputs for increased crop production.

loans.name: Presca

texts.en:
Presca P. is from the village of Sta. Isabel Norte. She is 44 years old. Presca is married and has three school-aged children. Presca owns and operates a business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Presca has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2009, Presca joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from ASKI, which was for 10,000 PHP and was used purchase baby livestock to raise & sell.

Presca is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. This loan will be her fourth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisher-folk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell

loans.name: Amah

texts.fr: Mme A. Amah est née en 1979 à Gapé Agodokpé oû elle réside encore dans le Zio. Abandonnant très tôt ses études primaires, elle se livre aux travaux champêtres. Mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants, elle est très  attachée à son activité agricole qui lui procure des revenus qui l’aident à subvenir au minimum vital de sa famille. Très dynamique et honnête, elle sollicite un financement pour accroître sa surface cultivable et  acheter des engrais pour fertiliser ses sols.
texts.en: Mme A. Amah est née en 1979 à Gapé Agodokpé oû elle réside encore dans le Zio. Abandonnant très tôt ses études primaires, elle se livre aux travaux champêtres. Mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants, elle est très  attachée à son activité agricole qui lui procure des revenus qui l’aident à subvenir au minimum vital de sa famille. Très dynamique et honnête, elle sollicite un financement pour accroître sa surface cultivable et  acheter des engrais pour fertiliser ses sols.

loans.use: accroître sa surface cultivable et  acheter des engrais pour fertiliser ses sols

loans.name: Dolores Mercedes

texts.es:
El clienta Dolores Mercedes R. V.. Vive en el municipio santa Rosa Del Peñón departamento de león de la casa de la mujer 75 varas al norte. Soltera  trabaja actual mente en MINED santa Rosa del peñón desempeñan el cargo como Director de educación primaria  secundaria a cursado quinto año. En Magisterio tiene 24 años de estar laborando en esta institución. Esta clienta tiene 4 hijos a su cargo 
El cliente cuanta con una casa de habitación propia el cual la quiere mejorar.
El destino del crédito es para Compra de cemento y ladrillo para la construcción de una cocina esto le permitirá tener en mejores condiciones su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Dolores Mercedes R. V. lives in the municipality of Santa Rosa del Peñón, in the department of León. Her home is about 75 varas (a vara is approximately .8 meter) to the north. She is single and currently works as Director of Education for the Ministry of Education in Santa Rosa del Peñón, a job she's been doing for 24 years. Dolores has four children.

She has a house of her own which she wishes to renovate. The loan will be used to buy cement and bricks so a kitchen can be built and her living conditions improved.

loans.use: to buy cement and bricks for a new kitchen

loans.name: Eldemilia

texts.en:
Eldemilia S. is from the village of Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Eldemilia is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Eldemilia owns & operates a tricycle transport service. Eldemilia has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Eldemilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eldemilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Eldemilia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Eldemilia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is married and has two children. None of her children are currently in school. Betty has a business in agriculture, which she has had for five years.         

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 100,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase tomatoes.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Betty hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes buy food. In the future, Betty hopes to own a salon.        

Betty is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her standards of living.

loans.use: Tomatoes

loans.name: Putheary

texts.en:
Mrs. Putheary B. (pictured above) is 30 years old and lives with with her mother in a suburb of Phnom Penh, about 20 kilometers away. She has full-time employment. 

Putheary does not have her own motorbike for commuting and she spends a lot of money on traveling costs. Therefore, she is asking for her first loan of US$ 1,000 to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Gandjali

texts.ru:
Gandjali  C. 53 qoda. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Gandjali yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste s semyoy. 

Gandjali uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom. Gandjali delayet moloko sir i yogurt vmeste s jenoy. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi. Gandjali prodayet molochniye produkti u sebya doma tak kak on imeyet mnoqo kliyentov sredi sosedey.
texts.en:
Gandjali C. is 53 years old.  He is married and has two children.  Gandjali is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).   He is a refugee from the city of Fuzuli who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his family.

Gandjali has been a herdsman for seven years.  He and his wife make milk, cheese, and yogurt.  Now, he needs 2000 AZN to buy cows.   Gandjali sells dairy products out of his home, and many of his neighbors are customers.

loans.use: Buying cows

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel R. is 48 years old, married and has seven adult-aged children. He is from the village of Masabud, a part of the municipality of Clarin, Misamis Occidental province on the Mindanao islands. Samuel operates a transport service. He has been in business for over a year and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Samuel joined GDMPC to gain access to its financial services. Samuel is requesting a loan, his first, of 10,000 PHP that will be used to repair his existing vehicle so it can provide better service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair his vehicle for better service

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en: Teresia A. K. is a widow with two children aged between seven and three years old, whom she hopes to raise to the best of her abilities. Her business is located beside a busy highway where metal work is the major type of business. She has been making and selling such items as wheelbarrows, metal boxes, chicken feeders, etc. to serve the local people. She has been running this business for six years now and has three employees. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is poor records, which makes it easy for the workers to defraud the business. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 40,000 to buy scrap metal to grow her business. She hopes to expand her business and open other outlets in other towns. She describes herself as determined, goal oriented, ambitious, and God fearing.

loans.use: To buy scrap metal in order to make and sell more metal items.

loans.name: Issa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Issa D.   est  marié et  âgé de 41ans. Il vit dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Boundioba  dans la  troisième région (Sikasso) de la  république Mali, avec ses  cinq enfants et ses épouses. 
Issa D. excelle dans l’achat vente de bétails dans lequel il est très réputé.
Pour augmenter son capital il adhère au programme de  Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt. Monsieur Issa D.  a 5 ans d’expérience dans cette activité.
Il  compte acheter avec son prêt, des bœufs, des moutons et des  chèvres dans son village  Boundioba  et environnants pour les revendre au marché à bétails de Bamako (capitale du Mali) et à Koumantou, à une clientèle venant du Sénégal, un pays frontalier de la République du Mali s’agissant des bœufs  et quant aux petits ruminants aux bouchers de la place. Les ventes se font très généralement au comptant.   
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice de 50.000FCFA par mois qui sera réinvesti dans  l’entreprise. 
Il ambitionne ouvrir une boutique de vente d’articles divers à Kolondièba pour davantage diversifier ses sources de revenus.
texts.en:
Mr. Issa D. is married and he is 41 years old. He lives in a large traditional family in  
Boundioba is the third region (Sikasso) of the Republic of Mali. He lives with his five children and his wives. 

Issa D.'s specialization is the buying and selling of cattle, a business in which he has earned a high reputation.  In order to supplement his capital funds he joined Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner). It is his first loan.  He has five years' experience in the business.

He plans to purchase cattle, sheep, and goat livestock in his village, Boundioba, and in the neighboring regions for resale in the cattle market in Bamako (capital city of Mali) and in Koumantou. His clientele come from Senegal, a neighboring country to the Republic of Mali. They purchase beef cattle as well as small livestock from the butchers of the region. He completes his sales most of the time in cash.

He plans on earning a monthly income of 50.000FCFA which will be reinvested back into the business. He endeavors to open a general store to sell a variety of merchandise in Kolondieba as an additional source of income

loans.use: To purchase livestock.

loans.name: Finesse Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe FINESSE (3 célibataires et 1marié) avec une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames à SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passé ont été remboursé dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de tissus   avec SITAN T.. 
SITAN T.  compte acheter avec son  prêt,  25   rouleaux de tissus.
Elle s’approvisionne  à partir  des marchés de DAKAR et LOME .
Les pagnes  wax sont revendus au  marché de SANOUBOUGOU I à Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45.000 FCFA utilisée pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The four members of the group named Finesse (3 are single and 1 is married) have an average age of 30 years. They have 3 children each and the majority of them live in monogamous families in Sanoubougou I, one of the quarters in the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali). 

They are on their third loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner) and their goal is to satisfy client demand. Their previous loans were all successfully repaid. This group of women sells fabrics through Sitan T.. 

Sitan T. plans on investing her loan in the purchase of 25 rolls of fabric. 

She purchases her inventory in the market in Dakar and Lome. The wax cloths are resold at the market in Sanoubougou I and in Sikasso and to family, a clientele made up of men and women.  She completes her sales in cash. 

She expects to earn a monthly income of 45.000 FCFA and it will be used to cover her family's daily expenses.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics.

loans.name: El

texts.en: El M., age 28, sells new clothes at the mobile place, Phnom Penh City in Cambodia. From this she and her husband are able to earn $8 a day to support their family. They have only one child, who is studying in school. Recently, El M. sold nearly all her inventory to her buyers, and she wants to replenish her stock but she lacks capital. She is, therefore, asking for a loan in order to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Chao

texts.en:
Chao T. is a 47-year-old homemaker who lives in Reussey Keo commune, Phnom Penh City. She has spent most of her lifetime caring for her children, cooking delicious meals, managing cash flow and performing other duties in and around her house. Her husband is a construction supervisor who usually earns an average profit of $10 US, providing the whole family with a comfortable life.

Chao T. has four single children, one of whom works as a motor taxi (tuk tuk) driver. Unfortunately, his existing motorbike often breaks down while providing service. Therefore, Chao T. has decided to seek a loan of $1000 US from Kiva, which she will use to replace her son's broken motorcycle.

loans.use: to replace her son's broken motorcycle

loans.name: Ernestine

texts.en: Ernestine is 32 years old, married and has two children. She and her husband work together selling food. They have been in business for six years and hope to use this loan to expand their business. If she is able to earn additional income, she would also like improve her house.

loans.use: to expand a small food-selling business

loans.name: Darwin

texts.es: Darwin, de 24 años, es un joven muy amable y trabajador, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su querida hija Yuni de 2 años, quien es el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. El trabajo al que Darwin se dedica, es el cultivo de café, palta y plátano, los cuales después de la cosecha lleva a vender a la ciudad de Pichanaki, que es donde mejores precios obtiene por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que la ruta es muy accidentada. Con el tiempo, espera poder comprar más tierras, para incrementar la cantidad que produce normalmente. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, en sus primeros créditos fue muy puntual y espera serlo ahora también, en su banco comunal es un socio muy querido, ya que contagia su alegría al resto de socias. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono para fertilizar mejor sus tierras.
texts.en:
Darwin is 24 years old.  He is a very kind and hard-working young man who lives in his parents' home, together with his beloved daughter, 2 year-old Yuni, who is the main motivation behind all his efforts.

Darwin's business is growing coffee, avocado and bananas.  After he harvests his crops he takes them to the town of Pichanaki to sell as this is where he receives the best prices for them.

What Darwin most enjoys about his work is cultivating his land.  He has been in this business for 5 years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be transporting his products since the route is very rugged.  Over time, he hopes to buy more land in order to increase the quantity of crops that he produces.

This is Darwin's fourth loan with MFP.  He was very punctual in paying back his previous loans and he hopes to continue being punctual.  Darwin is a very well-liked member of his community bank because his happiness is contagious.  He will use the 2,500 Peruvian soles he has requested to buy manure so that he can better fertilize his land.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 19-year-old single man living with his parents and one sibling. Despite his young age, he started working as a mechanic four years ago. Today, he is the owner of a car repair shop. His work is specialized in repairing all types of vehicles from the inside and the outside. From time to time, this man has promotions and offers special prices on his products and services in order to make his shop a center of attention. He follows this strategy because it allows him to earn a good income. 

He is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new mechanical tools in place of his used ones. He intends to adopt a new business plan which will bring him superior profits.

loans.use: to purchase new mechanical tools.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: El señor Rubén nacido el 11 de Marzo de 1986 en Santa Cruz en provincia de la Guardia, el trabaja con su padre quien es agricultor, y el sr. Rubén también es agricultor, trabajan  en la parcela de su padre el Sr. Rubén es casado con la Sra. Sandra con un hijo pequeño. El se dedica a la agricultura y a rallar madera para los carpinteros, también tiene su vagoneta, con la misma vagoneta trabaja los sábados y domingos que son sus días libres, el dinero del  crédito lo utilizara en la reparación y mantenimiento de esa vagoneta, ya que también le ayuda a transportar sus productos al mercado de la localidad, es un joven muy trabajador y su deseo es poder comprar sus propias tierras para sembrar, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Rubén was born on 11 March, 1986 in Santa Cruz in the province of La Guardia. He and his father are both farmers and work together on his father's plot of land. Rubén is married to Sandra and they have a young son. 

In addition to his farming work, Rubén also cuts wood for carpenters. He also has a passenger car and provides transportation services on Saturdays and Sundays, which are his days off. 

Rubén will use this loan to pay for repairs and maintenance on his car, which he also uses to transport his products to the local market. He is a very hard-working young many and his goal is to be able to buy his own land to farm. He is thankful to the institution for the support he has received.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle repair and maintenance.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret M. is 38 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. Margret has a bar, which she has run for five years. She also has a second business running a poultry firm.
To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more sodas and beer for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Margret hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sodas and beer for resale.

loans.name: Erian

texts.en:
Erian is from the village of Malibud, Gingoog City. She is 29 years old. Erian is single. To make a living, Erian owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap, candies and biscuits in the local community. Erian has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Erian joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erian has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Erian is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and beverages. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Erian from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: improve his home.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a farmer in her native town of Litein in South Rift, Kenya. She is 47 and married, with six children between 25 and 7 years. Her farm produces milk and tea, with the help of one farmhand. She has been in mixed  farming for the last ten years.

Rosemary has requested a loan amounting to 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase poultry birds for her poultry business. She believes the business will grow and provide income to pay for the education of her five children who are still in school.  Rosemary states that milk price fluctuation is the greatest challenge in dairy farming. She, however, remains optimistic the venture into poultry will supplement the dairy business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Cristo Vive 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Gladis is the coordinator of her group, Cristo Vive 4 & 5 (Christ live). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their four children. She says that her biggest challenge is to give her kids the best education she can. After this first loan, she is planning to invest in her small food stall. With the commitment to develop her business and a good investment plan, she will be able to grow her business. Her future plan for her business is to have an improved and bigger business, something like a grocery store.

Gladis plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying different goods like fruits, vegetables, chicken, green peas, beans, etc. With the profits, she will expand her business by adding other goods like rice, flour, sugar, and many other goods especially for daily meals.

Gladis' group is located in the rural area surrounding La Romana. Her community is a batey (a company town), where most of the citizens are Haitians who emigrated to work in different industries in the Dominican Republic. This group is composed of 10 Haitian businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, chicken, green peas, beans, etc.

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en:
Ganbaatar, aged 47, lives in Darkhan city, the second largest city in Mongolia with his wife and four children in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic tent. His older daughter has a job, but she could not get a higher education until now and the other children are pupils in secondary school. 

Ganbaatar became a repairman in a private company this year. He also has three milk-cows for his house usage and sales to citizens of Darkhan city. Currently this is a major source of income for his family. His family moved to this city from another region in 2002 and they lived in a rental house at first. After that he was able to buy his own small-sized piece of land by saving some money from the productivity of his milk cows.
    
Now he needs to have one more milk cow with a calf to raise the sale supply to increase his family income. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to buying one milk cow with calf to increase his family income.

loans.use: to buy one milk cow with calf to increase his family income.

loans.name: William Alexander

texts.es:
William,  es agricultor, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 3 y 6 años de edad, poseen casa propia, él tiene mucha experiencia en la actividad agrícola, ya que desde joven inicio las labores agrícolas junto a su padre.
Hoy en día William se encuentra con sus nuevos cultivos, los cuales necesitan abono y tratamiento para plagas como herbicidas, para ello solicita un préstamo que le solvente la necesidad de fortalecer y prevenir riesgos de plagas en sus cultivos.
Para él, su objetivo como agricultor es que cada siembra le produzca buenos frutos, sanos y abundantes, así como también poder comercializar y alimentar a su familia.
texts.en:
William is a farmer who lives with his wife and two children, aged three and six, in their own home. He has a lot of experience in the farming business, since he was young when he began working in agriculture alongside his father. 

These days William finds himself with newly planted crops, which need fertilizer and treatments for maladies, such as herbicides. To that end he is seeking a loan to pay for the need to fortify his crops and protect them from maladies. 

For him, his objective as a farmer is that each harvest would produce a good yield, healthy and abundant, as well as to be able to sell them, and provide for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and herbicides for his crops.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es: Bernardo, tiene la edad 55 de  años, está casado y vive con su esposa cuatro hijos y la suegra. El pretende con el crédito realizar la asistencia de su plantación de café. El cuenta con un terreno cultivado con café y pretende invertir en insumos como abonos y fungicidas para obtener una mejor cosecha. El quiere implantar un  buen cafetal que de buena producción para vender un café de calidad. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y crecer con el proyecto del café. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Bernardo is 55 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife, their four children and his mother-in-law.  He plans to use his loan for his coffee plantings.  He has some fields planted with coffee and he plans to invest the money in fertilizers and fungicides in order to obtain a better harvest.  He wants to establish a good coffee crop that will yield good production so that he can sell high quality coffee.  Bernardo wants to generate as much income as possible for his own well-being and that of his family.  And wants to grow his coffee business.  This is the first loan that Bernardo has received from FUDECOSUR.  He had not previously taken any loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR offered him the loan with easy payments plans and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: with his coffee crop

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hard-working mother who lives happily with her husband and three children in a village. Farming is the main source of their income but due to financial difficulties, Jocelyn engages in cooking and selling food for meals and snacks in her food stall to earn additional income. She has been in this business for almost 10 years earning a net profit of only P8,000 a month.

She aims to improve her business to increase her income to cover all their household expenditures and support the education of their youngest child who is still studying. Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy ingredients (vegetables, pork and fish) to be cooked and sold in her food stall. 

She mentioned that she needs to work hard and strive harder to achieve her goals. She hopes that in the future, her business will grow and her youngest child will finish his studies. She believes that nothing is impossible to a person who has strong faith and determination.

loans.use: to buy ingredients (vegetables, pork and fish to be cooked and sold in the food stall.

loans.name: Peter

texts.fr:
Peter est le salarie, il est né au Rwanda et a 37 ans. Il est marié.

Peter est le pasteur. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter les matériels  d’un enfant qui va naitre bientôt (le matelas, un berceau et d’autre matériels pour le nouveau ne).

Dans les prochaines années, Peter voudrait poursuivre ses études de théologie. Il prévoit d’améliore le bien être de sa famille et avoir une bonne habitation.
texts.en:
Peter was born in Rwanda; he is 37 years old and married.

Peter is a minister. This is the first loan he has sought with ACB, and he aims to use his loan in order to buy goods for his soon to be born child (mattress, cradle and other items for the newborn). 

In the years to come, Peter would like to pursue his Theology studies. He would like to improve his family's living standards and build a good home.

loans.use: to purchase goods for his soon to be born baby (mattress, cradle and other items)

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en:
Delfina, a 36-year-old married mother of seven children, lives in the Philippines where she has had a junk shop for the past seven years that buys and sells recycled bottles and metals. A new member of HSPFI, she has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of recycled metals and bottles to sell.

In the future, Delfina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of recycled metals & bottles to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is married and blessed with two children, both of whom attend school. For the last two years, he has been managing a retail shop to support the family. Peter also rents out houses for more income. In the next 5 years, he wants to become an employer. Peter is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy sugar, cooking fat, rice and soap for resale.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking fat, rice and soap

loans.name: Anmoli

texts.en:
Anmoli is 35 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has four children. For the past three years, Anmoli has been working hard to manage his small bar, which serves snacks and drinks to local customers. 

To help expand his business, Anmoli has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase plastic chairs for customers to sit on, and will help Anmoli to generate greater profits and improve the quality of life for his family. Anmoli hopes that in the future he will be able to continue to grow his business. 

Anmoli is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Anmoli who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase plastic chairs

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is married to Mary, and together they have two children who both attend school. He is a carpenter and has been in the business for the past seven years. He earns a monthly income of KES 30,000 from his business.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He will use the loan to increase his stock of wood to make more furniture and purchase a wood cutting machine.

He will use the anticipated profits to expand the business by opening another outlet. His dream is to have three outlets in Nairobi.

loans.use: to purchase stock and another machine

loans.name: Gloria Betty

texts.es:
Gloria, por necesidad de dinero para comprar mercadería, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, ya que quiere invertir en sandias, piña, plátanos, papaya, bananos, para mantener frutas frescas para los clientes; Ella manifiesta que los prestamos anteriores le ayudaron para aumentar el negocio, y también logro pagar un lote, este es un avance en su vida y todo gracias a los prestamos.
Lastimosamente tuvo un atraso en su ultimo pago, pero espera salir bien con este nuevo prestamo.
texts.en: Gloria is requesting a new loan because she needs money to buy merchandise.  She would like to invest her loan in buying watermelons, pineapples, bananas, papayas and plantains to have fresh fruit available for her customers.  She says that her previous loans have helped her to increase her business and she has also managed to buy a plot of land.  This represents an advance in her life and it has all been thanks to loans.  Unfortunately, she suffered a delay in her last repayment but she hopes to do well with her new loan.

loans.use: to buy watermelons, pineapple, bananas, papaya and plantains

loans.name: Adela Ignacia

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra: Adela; La socia tiene 65 años de edad, es casada, y tiene 3 hijos, la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de bisuteria,ella realiza trabajos como pulseras,aretes y collares y lo vende en forma independiente,la socia quiere trabajar desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de bisuteria . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer hacer las manualidades como alambres,piedras,lana e hilos al por mayor.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Adela is 65 years old, married, and has three children. She continues with her costume jewelry business. Adela makes pieces such as bracelets, earrings, and necklaces and then sells them in an independent manner. She works from 8am to 9pm. Adela wants to expand and improve her costume jewelry business, so she is requesting a loan to buy materials for making these handicrafts such as wire, stones, wool, and thread in bulk.

She is satisfied with the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy wire, stones, wool, and thread in bulk.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 57 years old and widowed. She lives in the Philippines. Evelyn has a shop that sells coconuts and green bananas. She has had this business for 15 years. 

Evelyn is requesting a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy coconuts and bananas to sell.  She has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts and bananas.

loans.name: Yrma

texts.es: La señora Yrma se dedica a la elaboración de alfajores,  galletas y panes,  su estado civil es casada, nacida en el departamento de Cochabamba,  vive actualmente en la zona  Blooming de la ciudad de Santa Cruz de la Sierra. Ella se dedica a la elaboración de alfajores, bombones, queques, tortas y otros hace 4 años,  trabaja de lunes a sábado. Su negocio esta ubicado  en su mismo domicilio y distribuye en diferentes supermercados de la ciudad. La señora demuestra ser responsable y trabajadora con espíritu emprendedor ya que esta es su única fuente de ingresos para solventar los gastos de su hogar. El crédito otorgado a la señora es para la compra de insumos como harina y azúcar en mayor cantidad por época de fin de año . La señora esta muy agradecida con emprender por confiar en ella y poder darle la oportunidad de hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Yrma prepares shortbread wafers, cookies, and breads. She is married and was born in the Department of Cochabamba. Yrma currently lives in the District of Blooming in the city of Santa Cruz de La Sierra.

She has been producing shortbreads, bonbons, cupcakes, cakes, and other sweets for four years. Yrma works Monday through Saturday. Her business is located in her home and she distributes her products to different supermarkets in the city. Sra. Yrma has demonstrated that she is responsible and hardworking because of her entrepreneurial spirit. This is the only source of income that she has to cover her household expenses.

The loan being granted to Sra. Yrma will be used to buy supplies, such as flour and sugar in bulk, for the year-end season. She is very grateful to Emprender for trusting her and giving her the opportunity to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase flour and sugar in bulk.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en: Habiba is married to a mechanic and has five children. For the past six years, she has been selling wakye (rice and beans cooked together) and stew at Enyinase near Elmina. She assists her husband in paying their children’s school fees. Habiba will use her loan to purchase bags of rice and beans, and fish, and will use her new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase bags of rice, beans and fish

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is a 28-year-old motorcycle transport business owner from Trinidad, Bohol.  

He is single and hopes to have his own family soon.

Felix is able to support his family through his business and works hard to save for his future family.  Felix has requested this loan to buy motorcycle spare parts and gasoline.  Felix hopes this loan will improve his income.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts and gasoline.

loans.name: Norma Patricia

texts.es:
Norma de 30 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio de llamadas. Tiene ya algunos años con su negocio por eso quiere seguir invirtiendo en las llamadas ya que le ha ayudado a mejorar los ingresos de su familia. 

En la actualidad trabaja desde muy temprano atendiendo la central de llamadas para sus clientes.  Quiere con el préstamo poner más centrales telefónicas para tener más clientela ya que en ocasiones se llena el local.
texts.en:
Norma is 30 years old and is a hardworking woman who has many plans for her telephone call center.  She has had this business for a few years and she wants to continue investing in it because it has helped her improve her family’s income.

Norma begins her work very early in the morning attending to her customers at the call center.  She wants to use the loan to install more telephones at the call center so she can have more customers, since there are times when the center is completely full.

loans.use: to install more telephones at her call center.

loans.name: Nahida

texts.en: Nahida is a 33 year old married woman from Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan who supports 3 family members. She is requesting a loan of 600 JOD to buy perfumes. She plans on opening a shop to sell these perfumes. She hopes by doing so she can improve the living situation of her family. Nahida prefers not to have her photo on the internet, the above photo is of her husband.

loans.use: To buy perfumes for selling

loans.name: Hector Jesus

texts.es:
Héctor es un hombre de 23 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y la necesidad de trabajar no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas que deseaba, pero sueña con poder hacerlo muy pronto, en sus ratos libres le gusta hacer deporte y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, entusiasmo y gracias al apoyo de su Madre, Héctor puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de juguetes y regalos, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Héctor se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería, tales como: peluches, postales y juguetes diversos; de esta manera Héctor tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido, con ello él espera poder aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda iniciar sus estudios profesionales y ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: Para la compra de mercadería, tales como: peluches, postales y juguetes.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 50 years old. She is a wife and a mother to five children aged three to eighteen.  Her husband barely earn a living by driving.  With this challenge, Susana help her spouse by selling frozen food such as hot dogs, spring rolls and sausages. Susana dreams of expanding her business but lack the capital to do so. She is asking a loan to address her problem in limited funds. She will use her loan to buy more stocks of hot dogs, sausages and longganiza (sausages flavoured with indigenous spices). Her ultimate goal is to send her children to College.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of hot dogs, sausages and longganiza (sausages flavoured with indigenous spices)

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: A trained hairdresser. Mrs. Rebecca O. is 42 years old. She operates her saloon business at the urban center (Benin City) in Nigeria. She needs the sum of $500 to expand her business

loans.use: To buy driers for her business

loans.name: Fiodjidé

texts.en:
Fiodjidé D. was widowed about 12 years ago. Born in 1965, she had left her parents for her husband in Dévémé, where she current resides with her four children. When her husband died, she turned to farming, a daily business activity she is very active in. Her business has won her fame, and everybody admires her daring bravery. Today, given the poor soil in her area, she is requesting a loan of $650 to buy fertilizer for improving the soil ahead of the next rainy season, already beginning. The loan will also increase her agricultural production. The realization of this dream will lead her to affect changes in growing techniques and to improve crop yields, as well as her living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame D. Fiodjidé est veuve depuis une dizaine d’année. Née en 1956, elle quitta ses parents pour son mari à Dévémé où elle réside actuellement avec ses quatre (04) enfants. A la mort de son époux, elle fait de l’agriculture, son activité quotidienne. Très active, son activité fait d’elle une femme connue de tous qui admirent sa bravoure. Aujourd’hui, compte tenu de la pauvreté des sols de sa localité, elle sollicite un crédit de $650 pour acheter des engrais afin de mieux enrichir son sol pour la prochaine saison des pluies qui s’annonce et augmenter sa production agricole. La réalisation de ce rêve pourra l’amener à changer de techniques culturales et à améliorer ses rendements et ses conditions de vie.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo S. is 36 years old and lives with his wife and two young children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He is self-employed as a mechanic and normally makes around $4/day in revenue. His wife earns $2.50/day by weaving clothes and selling them. This couple hopes to use the loan to purchase a weaving machine in order to facilitate their business and to repair their house. In order to improve his family's standard of living, S. hopes to expand his wife's business by purchasing more weaving machines and hiring some workers to help her. Eventually, he would like to invest in building houses to rent to the garment workers.

loans.use: To purchase a weaving machine and to repair his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy iron and raw materials

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Rene is a driver in the public transportation industry and works from Trufi, an inter-city area of El Alto in La Paz. This is the source of his income to support his three sons; Rene lives in the city of El Alto.

The loan he currently seeks will be used to convert his vehicle to one that uses methane natural gas, which will allow him to increase his income 30 to 40% because the cost of [methane] natural gas is much less than petroleum or diesel.

It is Rene's fifth loan with IMPRO and his previous payment history is excellent. Moreover, he is more than qualified and approved for this loan, which will help him to continue working under more favorable conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva volunteer.

Rene es transportista de servicio publico y trabaja de Trufi inter – ciudad La Paz el Alto; esta es su fuente de ingreso para la manutención de sus tres hijos; Rene vive la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito que ahora solicita será utilizado para la conversión de su Vehiculo de gasolina a Gas Natural Vehicular; esta conversión le permitirá incrementar sus ingresos en un 30 a 40% en vista de que el costo de gas es mucho menor que el costo de Gasolina. Este es el 5to. Crédito de Rene con IMPRO y su historial de pagos es excelente, además de que la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo, de esa forma podrá seguir trabando con mayores beneficios.

loans.use: to convert his vehicle to one that uses natural gas

loans.name: Godliver

texts.en:
Godliver is a 33-year-old mother, who lives in the Vituka area in the city of Dar Es Salaam. She received training in business and entrepreneurship skills from the Youth Self Employment Foundation.

For the last three years, she has run a grocery store. She requests a loan of $400 to increase her business.

loans.use: Increase business

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Mr. Stephen E. is an auto electrician at Moree Junction near Cape Coast. He was once married with two children ages 11 and 8 years, but he is currently divorced. Stephen has his own shop where he works on all kinds of car batteries. Stephen is a hardworking man. He also repairs all types of car starters and alternators. He is a well-known electrician at Moree Junction.

Stephen is asking for a loan of US $1,000 to purchase car starters, second-hand batteries, and car alternators to enable him to meet the demand of his customers.

loans.use: To purchase car starters, second-hand batteries, and car alternators to enable him to meet the demand of his customers.

loans.name: Wajibika A Group

texts.en:
Suzana, age 32, is married with 2 children (ages 5 and 12). She is a hair dresser and owns a beauty salon, which she started in 2001. Each day, she works from 8am to 9pm and in one month she can make a profit of about $230.

Suzana and her subgroup request a loan to expand their businesses. Suzana's subgroup members have businesses dealing in selling food and clothing.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Rosalino

texts.en:
Rosalino B. is married and the father of three children. He owns a house in the General Resquin neighborhood in the city of Santaní. He has owned a general store for thirteen years and today is well known in the area.

The next step in his growing business is to invest money into buying a small truck to transport his goods faster and easier. The loan he is asking for will go towards purchasing a small truck. The loan will increase the size of his business and the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to buy articles of merchandise and invest in a truck

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier, is very connected to the labor of manufacturing brickworks and bricks for his family and has embarked on the construction of a bakery and with your help he wants to offer a variety of delicious breads to his community. His energy and hard working spirit has driven him down this path and he has it in his head to be able to offer a safe place to work for many young people in the city. With your help this young entrepreneur will realize his dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Javier, está muy vinculada a la labor de fabricación de tejas y ladrillos de su querida familia y ha emprendido la construcción de una panadería con su ayuda, desde la cual desea ofrecer una deliciosa variedad de panes a su comunidad. El ímpetu y su espíritu trabajador lo han conducido por el camino de los grandes propósitos y tiene en mente echar a andar este lugar para poder otorgar a jóvenes de su ciudad un espacio seguro de trabajo.Con tu ayuda este emprendedor joven hará realidad su sueño preciado.

loans.use: The implementation of a small bakery.

loans.name: Ni Ketut Hudiani

texts.id: Setiap pukul 09:00 wita Hudiani memberi makan 7 ekor babi peliharaannya.Pekerjaan ini tentunya sudah menjadi rutinitas kesehariaannya.  Kandang bambu  yang sederhana dimiliki dibelakang rumah,sebagai tempat untuk menampung babi yang dipelihara. Usaha ini sangat membantu dalam memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Hudiani memiliki 2 orang anak yang masih menjadi tanggungan. Semangat untuk berusaha yang dimiliki membuat suaminya sangat senang karena sangat meringankan beban sebagai bapak kepala rumah tangga. Karena penghasilan suami sebagai petani yang tidak menentu. Keuntungan yang sudah dirasakan sangat memuaskan.dalam 6 bulan 7 bibit babi ini bisa menghasilkan Rp.3.500.000,- bersih. Keuntungan ini digunakan untuk biaya sekolah anaknya dan sangat menunjang kehidupannya.Untuk kedepannya Hudiani akan membuat kandang yang permanen agar babi yang dipelihara semakin banyak.

loans.use: Membeli pakan dan membuat kandang

loans.name: Mariam's Dar .mburahati Group

texts.en:
Mariam is 26 years old and is a single woman. Mariam owns a small general store, which she started in 2002. Everyday, she works from 8am to 4pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $165 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Asia, who has business dealing in food vending.

loans.use: To  buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio César is 35 years old; his wife is 31. They have two school-aged children aged 10 and 9.

Julio César is the owner of a store that he operates out of his home. He also sells milk as he is the owner of several milk-producing cows. Julio opened his store eight years ago. It’s the only one in the neighbourhood and has a well-established clientele.

In spite of having little formal education (they only completed primary school), both Julio and his wife have done well because of their efforts and sacrifices. They now need a loan to buy items such as sugar, rice, flour, oil etc, so that they can better stock their store.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

Julio César tiene 35 años y vive en pareja con Juana que tiene 31 años de edad. Tienen dos hijos de 10 y 9 años respectivamente que aún van a la escuela.

Julio César es propietario de una despensa que funciona en su domicilio. Además se dedica a la venta de leche debido a que tiene varias vacas lecheras que le producen la misma. Comenta que inició su despensa hace 8 años, la misma es la única del barrio y actualmente ya cuenta con una clientela muy bien formada.

A pesar de la poca formación que tienen tanto él como su pareja, debido a que solo lograron terminar la primaria, han salido adelante con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio. Ahora necesitan de un préstamo para comprar mercaderías como: azúcar, arroz, harina, aceite, etc. y así surtir mejor su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, flour, rice, oil etc.

loans.name: Soyaya Group

texts.fr:
Created during the year 2001, SOYAYA Group consists of two serious, dynamic young women who put their heads together in running a business. One of the two sells local drinks, the other sells shoes, towels, and baby outfits. The members of this group have been very careful about reimbursing their previous loans appropriately.

They are on their 8th loan and are asking for a loan of US$ 725 to purchase a barrel of locally produced drink, 5 dozen shoes, 40 towels, and 3 dozen baby outfits.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Créée au cours de l’année 2001, l’association SOYAYA est un groupe de deux femmes solidaires et dynamiques qui mettent leur savoir faire dans l’exercice d’une activité commerciale. L’une revendeuse de boisson locale et l’autre revendeuse de chaussures, de serviettes et de trousseaux bébé. Les membres de ce groupe ont toujours été fidèles dans le remboursement de leurs crédits antérieurs.

Elles sont à leur huitième (8ième) prêt et sollicite un crédit de 300.000 FCFA pour acheter un tonneau de boisson locale, cinq douzaines de chaussures, 40 serviettes et trois douzaines de trousseaux bébé.

loans.use: Purchase of shoes, local drink, etc.

loans.name: Gladness' Group

texts.en:
Gladness has owned and run a salon in Arusha for ten years. She is 28 years old, married, and has one 10-year-old child. She works daily from 8:00am to 7:00pm and generates a monthly profit of approximately $300.

Gladness has taken out two previous loans through BRAC Tanzania. She paid both back successfully and on time. She is hoping to use this current loan to buy more materials to expand her business. She will be sharing this loan with her group members who also own small businesses in Arusha.

loans.use: To buy more materials to improve her salon.

loans.name: Men

texts.en: Mrs. Men C. L. owns a small grocery store in Kampong Prasath Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Thin Korng, is a dentist and farmer in the local village. Since it is the rainy season, Mr. Thin Korng needs to cultivate rice; unfortunateL., he does not have animals to plow. Thus, Mrs. Men C. L. decided to ask for a loan to hire a laborer with oxen to plow the field in order to cultivate rice.

loans.use: To hire a labourer with oxen to plow the field in order to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 50 years old. She is married with 2 children. She has owned a small general store since 2004. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $175.

Asha is now looking for a loan to buy more products in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more products in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank T. Nanor is a 40-year-old married man with a 15-year-old child. He is a pharmacist by trade, and he sells various kinds of drugs in his neighborhood such as blood tonic, pain killers, and malaria drugs. He notes that many local people patronize his store for first aid and so that he can cure them when they are sick.

He is now seeking a loan to meet his customers' demands by buying additional supplies of drugs, including certain drugs that he does not carry yet which are frequently sought by his customers. As a result, he hopes to generate an increase in his income to better support his family.

He is a member of the community known as the God is King Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each other's loans as social collateral (i.e., if one member does not promptly repay his or her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears), and they provide support for one another to repay their respective loans.

loans.use: To expand his inventory and to meet his customers' demands by purchasing additional drugs

loans.name: Rath

texts.en:
Rath A., 64, is a widow and lives with her two children in Prey Veng province. One child works in a garment factory, and the other is a motorbike taxi driver.  She grows rice and vegetables, earning around $2 each day.

Mrs. Rath A. has requested a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike so her son can operate a motorbike taxi business.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to use in a taxi service.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Bernardino R. le esta haciendo falta el piso y la losa de concreto en la parte posterior de su casa, por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para cubrir ese gasto ya que su ingreso es bajo y es mas difícil juntar  la cantidad que necesita para llevar acabo su mejora. Ya que para él es muy importante que su familia tenga lo mejor y que estén más cómodos en su casa. 
Cuando acudimos a su vivienda solo se encontraba su esposa la señora Magda Edith Tovar ya que Don Bernardino se encontraba en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Bernardino R.’s home is missing the floor and the concrete slab at the back of the house. At this moment, she does not have enough money to cover the expenses as his income is too low and it is hard to raise the amount of money necessary to make these improvements. It is very important to him that his family has a better life and they could be comfortable at home. When we went to his home, we only met his wife, Magda Edith Tovar as Bernardino was working at that time.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish his home floor and the back wall

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina M. is a 35 year old married mother of four children. At the moment, they are all in school. She sells baby clothes, pampers, powder, napkins, detergents, feeding bottles etc. by selling door to door. She balances her stock on her head and walks miles to her customers. She is requesting the loan to enable her to increase her stock and to make more income in order to provide her children with a good education. Sakina says she would be grateful for your assistance. Sakina would also like to save money to rent a store so that her burden of selling door to door would be minimized.

Sakina belongs to a village bank called ‘Yerempa Aba’ which means "We Will Not Give Up".

loans.use: To buy more supplies of baby clothes, napkins, pampers, baby oil, detergents and plastic materials.

loans.name: Vasil

texts.en:
Vasil is married with one adult daughter. He owns a truck and transports construction materials. He started this particular business because he enjoys this type of work. His clients like the way he treats them, so Vasil, has many steady clients.  He also tries to keep reasonable prices for his services.

Vasil would like to get a loan of 9,000 UAH to remodel his truck to be able to transport longer material. His business goal is to purchase a second truck as he has many orders from his clients.

loans.use: to remodel the truck

loans.name: Nurbibi

texts.ru: Раджабова Нурбиби проживает в районе Гиссар. Возраст 32 года , замужем и имеет двоих детей. Муж в России на заработках. Но  у него с работой проблемы в данный момент. Поэтому Нурбиби одна занимается обеспечением семьи. Уже около восьми лет она работает в столовой "Вохури".столовая находится на центральном рынке и дает неплохой доход. Сейчас Нурбиби планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить новый инвентарь. Это поможет улучшить качество обслуживания и привлечь новых клиентов. Погасить кердит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Nurbibi R. lives in the Gissar district. She is 32 years, married and has two children. Her husband is currently working in Russia; however he is having problems with work. This is why Nurbibi is now the sole provider for her family. For almost eight years, she has been working at the Vohuri cafeteria. The cafeteria is located in the central market and brings in a decent income. Currently, Nurbibi plans to obtain a loan in order to purchase new inventory. This will help her improve the quality of service and attract new clients. She plans to repay this loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase new inventory

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en:
Godwin is 30 years old and married with a child. He sells medicine to his customers.

Godwin hopes for the loan of N30,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. He hopes to expand this business. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Abdumalik

texts.ru: Абдумалик -мужчина ему 56 лет. Женат отец 6-х детей. Занимается купле-продажей скота.Ему этом деле помогают жена и дети. Старший и средний сын находятся на заработках в Российской Федерации и они помогают родителям. Наступление весны для Абдумалика-это сезон закупа скота, потому, что весной скот стоит дешево.Скот у пастухов. Второй год как Абдумалик сотрудничает с нами и он очень благодарен.
texts.en:
Abdumalik is a 56 year old man, married and is a father of six children. He buys and sells cattle. His wife and children are helping him in this business. His older and middle sons are now working in the Russian Federation and are helping their parents. The arrival of the spring is the season for buying cattle for Abdumalik because at this time cattle costs cheaper. The shepherds have the cattle. This is Abdumalik's second year working with us and he is very grateful.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Vo Thi

texts.en:
Liên Võ Thị (656060052) is a 55-year-old woman living in the town of Hưng nguyên. She is married and has 4 adult children. To making a living, Liên owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling food products in the local community. Liên has been engaged in this business for over 11 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 Vietnamese Dong (about US $117) a month from these activities.

In 2006, Liên joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liên has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 dong from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. Liên is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 dong which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the 3rd loan she has taken out from TYM Fund. Liên plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To expand store inventory

loans.name: Celea

texts.en:
Celea C. is from the village of Kapita. She is 45 years old. Celea is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Celea owns & operates a business making & selling food.
