While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling rice products in the local community. Celea has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Celea joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Celea has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. Celea is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Celea from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & as working capital

loans.name: Zukhro

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Каримова Зухро женщина 44 лет. Замужем имеет 3-х детей. Занимается продажей парфюмерии и хозяйственным товаром. Зухро от соседей узнав о нашей организации и решила кредитовать. Она за товаром ездить в Китай, чтобы увеличит товарооборот. Зухре помогает старшая дачка Зебо. Её дочка также торгует на другой точке мужской одежди.
texts.en:
Zukhro K. is 44 years old. She is married has three children. She sells perfume and household items. Zukhro learned about our organization from her neighbors and decided to take out a loan. She travels to China to purchase goods in order to increase her trade turnover. Her older daughter, Zebo, helps her in her business and also sells men's clothing at a different place.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of household goods

loans.name: Kasambya 1 Nabibuga Nuriat Group

texts.en: N. Nuriat is forty-seven years old, married, with eight children and two dependents in schooling. She has been dealing in poultry for almost two years. She is using the loan to purchase chicks, feed, drugs, etc. for rearing healthy poultry to meet her customers’ demands. Her business is improving because she is adding capital. She will supply chickens and eggs, in much volume, to the customers. She is an active businesswoman whose future hope is to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase chicks, feeds, drugs, etc for  poultry business.

loans.name: Razim

texts.en:
Razim was born in 1975, is married and has three children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan's Fuzuli region. He is now settled in Fuzuli region in the Garabulag village.

Five years ago, he started a cattle breeding business. Now he needs a loan of 1600 AZN to buy four calves to improve his cattle breeding business.

loans.use: To buy four calves

loans.name: Cagrielo Group

texts.en:
Frola is a member of the Cagrielo borrower group,she is 25 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children ara aged 4 and 1 years.

Flora started her own food business selling vegetable and fruits 4 years ago,she works 8 hours a day and earn monthly profi approximately 150,000 Tsh.

This is Frola first loan from BRAC,She requested loan amount 200,000 in order to buy more vegetable and fruits for sale.

With the profit she gain from the use of this loan Frola hopes to save more money and expand her business.
Catheline is another member of the same borrower group,she requested loan amount 200,000 Tsh from BRAC in order to expand her saloon business

loans.use: To buy more vegatable and fruits

loans.name: Inti Wara Group

texts.es:
El  centro focal Cascada esta ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto, a este pertenece la asociación “Inti Wara”,está formado por once miembros y trabajan junto a la familia de Pro-Mujer hace cuatro años aproximadamente.
Además de dedicarse al comercio de ropa, la mayoría de las integrantes han encontrado en los alimentos una actividad lucrativa. Algunas son carniceras, es decir ofrecen variedad de carnes (res, pollo, cerdo, pescado  y menudencias),  otras venden verduras, frutas y comida.   Todas afirman que necesitan capital para la compra de productos en mayor cantidad, con esto aumentaran sus ventas y mejoraran las condiciones económicas en sus hogares.

loans.use: COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS EN MAYOR CANTIDAD

loans.name: Freeland

texts.en:
Freeland is 26 years old and a resident of Barangay Lawig, Lamut, Ifugao. Through the sacrifices of his parents, he was able to finish his college education. Since he is still single, he is now helping them with their needs and he is also starting to save for his future.

Due to a lack of job opportunity, Freeland ventured into the vending business with a starting capital of PHP3,000.00. He sells cooked meats, rice cakes and frozen foods inside the school campus in their village.

He wants to improve and strengthen his business, but he lacks the business capital. He decided to seek financial assistance from the Kiva lenders a loan amount of PHP5, 000. He hopes that through this, his business will grow. He is positive that he will succeed with his determination and patience in the business.

loans.use: Additional capital for vending business

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian R. is currently in the business of selling groundnut (peanut) and simsim (sesame) and is requesting a loan to purchase maize (corn) to sell. Lilian is 29 years old and is widowed. She has 4 children and her children go to school.

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a store for groundnut and simsim.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase maize to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa C. is from the village of Tag-ibo, Iligan City. She is 40 years old, is married, and has six adult children.

Elsa owns and operates a specialized retail store, making and selling different accessories in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Elsa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials used to make the accessories and that would add up to their items intended for sale. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials used to make the accessories and that would add up to their items intended for sale

loans.name: C2577 Abizeranye Group

texts.en:
Pelagie K. is 31 years old, married with 2 children aged 2 and 8, and she also takes care of 1 dependent. Pelagie lives at Musha where she is the president of a group called ABIZERANYE and where they operate businesses selling a variety of goods.

Pelagie’s group is requesting their first loan from Vision Finance Company. This loan will allow them to purchase more inventory for sale in their shops to attract more customers and make more profits. Once their businesses are successful, they hope to create many other jobs as well as creating many sources of incomes.

loans.use: A variety of goods for sale such as sugar, salt,  rice, cooking oil, etc

loans.name: Nat's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Khkaing Nat is group leader of seven people who all live in Trapeang Tuem village in Takeo province. Mrs. Khkaing Nat is a vegetable seller in the local market. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it. So she decided to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables to re-sell. She hopes to increase the living conditions of her family. Her husband, Mr. Seng Thy, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Khkaing Nat has four children, three of whom are attending the local school while the youngest is too young to work or study because this child is three years old.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ludith

texts.es:
La señora Ludith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “10 de Agosto II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 43 años y es madre de 03 hijos, 01 que aun dependen de ella y esta estudiando.

Ludith, es una mujer trabajadora y por su espíritu optimista que siempre le ha caracterizado, por lo que hoy en día lleva 04 años, dedicándose al servicio de movilidad urbana en su motokar. Para trabajarlo, su esposo se encarga de trasladarse por diferentes lugares de la Ciudad. Se inicio con su primer préstamo del Movimiento Manuela Ramos y poco a poco fue ahorrando y con ese dinero fue comprando repuestos, para mejorar el servicio a los moradores de la comunidad. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará repuestos y aceites como: lubricantes, bocamasas, bujías; para así brindar un mejor servicio y atender mucho mejor al cliente.

Ludith, Se siente muy bien al pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres, que le ha ayudado a conocer mejor sus derechos y juntas  hacer que estas sean respetadas. Y agradece bastante al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciarse en el campo empresarial.
texts.en:
Ludith, 43, is a member of the "10 de Agosto II" communal bank which is in the Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is married and has three children, one of whom is still in school and dependent on her. Ludith is a hard-working woman whose optimistic spirit has always characterized her. For the past 4 years she has provided mototaxi transportation services. Her husband is the driver and he goes to various parts of the city. She began with an initial loan from Manuela Ramos Movement and little by little saved up enough to buy replacement parts to improve the service offered to area residents. With this 1500 sol loan she will buy parts and lubricants like brake pads, spark plugs, etc. to offer better service. Ludith is happy to belong to a group of women who have helped her to know her rights and, together, have seen that they are respected. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her to start up in business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy motorcycle replacement parts.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is a fashion designer. She makes lovely Nigerian designs for her customers and she also sells colorful sarongs. She loves her business because it involves skills and innovation. She is 38 years old and married with five children. Her children are still dependent on her and they go to school. She is a very hardworking woman and she helps her husband in meeting the basic needs of her family. She needs a loan of 60,000 nairas to purchase more sarongs to sell. 
She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Ehsonjon

texts.en: Ehsonjon is a hardworking, responsible man who lives with his wife and two children. In order to provide for his children's needs while caring for them, he decided to start his own business processing and selling dried apricots. His wife helped him by sharing her best recipes and processing secrets. Fortunately, his work has paid off, and his business has grown with more orders and new clients coming in every day. Ehsonjon is asking for a loan of US$1,500, which he will use to purchase needed supplies and to remodel his location. He hopes that by doing this he will increase his sales and income. You can be a part of this growth. Ehsonjon and his parents thank you for your generosity and kindness. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing dried apricots

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 41 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos menores de edad en el caserío San Pedro de Sasape, ubicado en el distrito de Illimo, a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización de animales menores, el compra ovejas, chanchos y aves de corral en los caseríos aledaños para venderlos en el Mecado Moshoqueque (mercado mayorista) de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Además posee una mototaxi (vehiculo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros) con la que genera recursos adicionales. Con estos ingresos el trata todos los dias de sacar adelante a los suyos.

Cesar desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas animales para comercializar, por ello esta solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1700 nuevos soles para realizar su objetivo.

Su mas grande anhelo es ver a sus hijos convertidos en excelentes profesionales. El es un padre responsable y muy trabajador, sus vecinos lo estiman mucho y siempre acuden a el cada vez que necesitan ayuda.
texts.en:
Cesar is 41 years of age, married and lives with his wife and their three young children in the San Pedro of Sasape settlement, located in the Illimo district, 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He is dedicated to the commercialization of young animals, the purchase of sheep, pigs and poultry in the adjoining settlements in order to sell them in the Mecado Moshoqueque (wholesale market) of the city of Chiclayo. In addition, he possesses a mototaxi (motorized vehicle used in the transportation of loads and passengers) with which he generates additional resources. With these incomes he tries every day to get ahead. Cesar desires to expand his business with the purchase of more animals to market. Because of this he is requesting, for the first time, a loan of 1700 new Soles from Edpyme Alternative to carry out his objective. His greater desire is to see his children become excellent professionals. He is a very industrious and responsible father. His neighbors respect him very much and always come to him any time that they need help.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more young animals for resale.

location.town: Sector San Pedro de Sasape - Illimo - Lambayeque

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna B. is a married woman who supports her family by running a general store and selling fruits and vegetables. She lives in Barangay Masulog, Canlaon City, Negros Occidental, with her husband and their four children who are 26 to 34 years old. Three of their children have their own families and the one who is still single is gainfully employed. Myrna has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store, and at her fruits and vegetables vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 18,000. Myrna is now borrowing PHP 11,000 so that she is able to add additional working capital to her general store and her fruits and vegetables vending business. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Myrna aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her businesses

loans.name: Mercy's Group

texts.en:
Mercy L. is from the village of Awallan, Baggao, Cagayan. She is fifty years old. Mercy is the group leader of a nine-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Mercy is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Mercy owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for her business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Mercy has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Mercy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercy  successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. Mercy is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be Mercy's ninth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-five branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Leida Johanna

texts.es:
Leida B. de 26 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento. Solo cuenta con luz como servicio básico. Su esposo es chofer en una pastelería con el tiene 4 hijos de 6, 5, 3,2 años.   

Leida inicio su tienda hace 4 años con arroz y enlatados. Al tener capital bien establecido decidió poner un local en las afueras de su casa. Aunque no tenia experiencia en esta actividad tuvo que continuarla para poder mantener su hogar. 

Ahora ella trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 20h00 todos los días. Tiene en el día un promedio de 20 clientes. Vende arroz, aceite y carnes, una de las complicaciones para su tienda son las lluvias. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, aceite, azúcar para su tienda. En el futuro quiere tener sucursales de su tienda en todo Guayaquil.
texts.en:
Leida B., 26, lives in a periurban area of Fortín de Guayaquil. Her house is cement and the only basic service it has is electricity. Her husband is a delivery man for a pastry shop; they have 4 children, who are 6, 5, 3 and 2 years of age. Leida initiated her store four years ago selling rice and canned goods. Once she had accumulated some capital, she decided to set up her store outside her house. Although she had no experience in this line of work, she had to stay with it in order to provide support for her home. Now, she is open for business from 7am until 8pm every day. She averages 20 customers per day. She sells rice, cooking oil and meats. One of the obstacles she faces in her store is the rains. She will use the funds to buy rice, cooking oil and sugar for her store. In the future she would like to have branch stores in all of Guayaquil.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For rice, cooking oil, sugar.

loans.name: Chorng

texts.en:
Mrs. Chorng N., 27, has had a small business selling a few items to neighbors in the village. She is able to generate US$ 3 or $4 a day from selling cooking ingredients, ice cream, and some fruit. She also relies on the income from her husband who operates a motor-taxi service around the community. 

Chorng N. is blessed with a young child who is enrolled in school and also depends on her. Chorng N. will be using her money to rent farmland where cashews are grown. She will harvest and sell cashews when they are ripe. This will provide her with extra income.

loans.use: To rent farmland where cashews are grown

loans.name: Vencedoras Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Vencedoras inicia su sexto ciclo con 14 socias, las socias son del Distrito D. Locroja, Provincia D. Churcampa, Departamento D. Huancavelica.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. animales, panadería, comida, agricultura y ganadería.
Como es el caso D. la Señora Octavia que es casada y tiene 6 hijos, Octavia se dedica a la venta D. animales, que compra D. las comunidades D. la zona. Además Octavia tiene una panadería, actividades que realiza con la ayuda D. su esposo e hijos. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. animales menores. Los sueños D. Octavia son que sus hijos sean profesionales e implementar con máquinas modernas su panadería.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamo como 200 soles, 300 soles, 500 soles, 600 soles haciendo un total D. 9,500 soles en prestamos en el Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
The “Vencedoras” (Triumphant Ones) communal bank starts its 6th loan cycle with 14 members, who are from Locroja district, Churcampa province, Huancavelica department. The members have different commercial activities like: animal sales, bakery, food preparation, farming and cattle raising. Such is Octavia’s case. She is married and has 6 children. Octavia sells animals that she buys in area communities. Besides, Octavia has a bakery. Her husband and children help her out with her work. She will use the funds to buy small farm animals. Octavia’s dream is that her children become professionals and to equip her bakery with modern equipment. The members need varying amounts: 200 soles, 300 soles, 500 soles, 600 soles, adding up to a total 9500 sol group loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy small farm animals.

loans.name: Anavil

texts.en:
Anavil, 40, is a rice farmer in Banga, South Cotabato. Her business in rice farming is a big help to her family. It is from that they get the food they eat every day. And also a way to repay the amount borrowed from Community Economic Ventures, Inc.

She is the mother of a 9-year-old child. She lacks capital to provide all the farm supplies needed for her farm. That’s why she sought help from CEVI and asked for a loan of 6,000 Php. This will really help with her business venture.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Demeeva's Group

texts.en:
Demeeva M. is the leader of the group. She is a resident of Kochkorka. M. is 32 and she is married with two daughters. Both daughters are preschool age, so they go to kindergarten. M.'s husband works as a barber. About three years ago, while working in her mom's store, M. began providing mobile services. In Kyrgyzstan, if a person needs to recharge credit on her/his cellphone, she/he can access someone like M. to complete this service. The initial investment in her business activity was 500 soms (about $10.70), and now she makes from 100 to 200 soms ($2.15- $4.30) a day, and about 3000 soms ($64.38) per month. M. wants to get a loan to purchase two bulls for fattening. In the future she wants to increase her number of livestock. 

Japarova G. is 31 years old. She has 4 children. Her two older sons study at school and her young daughter and son stay at home with G.. Her husband is a private entrepreneur. He is engaged in the wholesale of groceries. The initial investment in this business was 50000 soms ($1072.97), and they have been engaged in this business for 6 years. The monthly profit varies from 10000 soms ($214.60) to 30000 soms ($643.77). G. and her husband want to get a loan in order to buy food products to increase their turnover.

Asanalieva A. is the treasurer of the group. She is 27. Her husband works in construction in Bishkek. They have a 7-year-old son, who studies at school, and a 2-year-old daughter. A. sells fruits and vegetables at the market. She started her business activity two years ago with the initial investment amount of 8000 soms ($171.67), which she used to buy berries and currants, and she made a good amount of money. As a result, she bought a washing machine and earns 5000 soms ($107.30) per month. Now she needs a loan for purchasing more fruit and vegetables in order to increase the assortment. 

Mamytova E. is 43 years old. She is married and her husband works as a brick layer. They have two sons and a daughter, all of whom study in school. In order to make money when they are not studying, E.'s sons sell fuel. Three years ago, using the initial investment amount of 3500 soms ($75), E. began to sell fuel. Thanks to this activity she bought a fridge and makes from 3000 soms ($64.37) to 6000 soms ($128.47) per month. With the money received from the loan, E. will purchase and resell fuel to make money.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase bulls in order to increase the number of livestock

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani A. is a 40-year-old married woman from the village of Tagoloan Misamis Oriental in the Philippines. Lani has 3 school-age children. To earn a living, Lani owns and operates a business venture in the food sector by making and selling food. More specifically, her primary source of income is derived from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Lani has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2009, Lani joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. As a result, she is now able to engage in business activies and to improve her standard of living. Notably, Lani has successfully repaid a previous loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to prepare her food items for sale. Lani is now requesting another loan, this time in the amount of 8,000 PHP ($175), which will be used to expand her business. This loan would be the second loan taken out by Lani from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and it reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business

loans.name: Ing

texts.en:
Mrs. Ing C., shown in the photo, is 29 years old. Her husband, Mr. Kimsan Yi, is 29 and they have been married since 2000. They have a young son who attends school. They live in a small village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Ing and her husband have been farming for ten years. The couple also hope to create a new business raising ducks. Therefore, Ing is asking for her first loan of $500 to purchase ducks to raise.

loans.use: To purchase ducks to raise.

loans.name: Léontine

texts.fr: Née en 1957 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin, NOUTAÏ Léontine vit depuis sa naissance à Houédakomey à Porto-Novo. Léontine est mariée et mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont seulement un est à sa charge. Léontine vit seule avec son enfant et assure seule les différentes charges de la maison. Léontine n’a fréquenté que l’école primaire. Il y a près de huit ans que Léontine exerce comme activité la vente de glacières, ustensiles de cuisine en plastique, des sous-vêtements et des chaussures à Porto-Novo. Léontine achète ses produits au marché de Ouando à Porto-Novo et aussi à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Léontine a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés auprès de ALIDé. Dans le but de renforcer son capital et d’augmenter ses stocks de produits afin de rehausser son chiffre d’affaire, Léontine sollicite un quatrième crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1957 in Porto-Novo, administrative capital of Bénin, NOUTAÏ Léontine has lived her whole life in Houédakomey in Porto-Novo. Léontine is married and the mother of four children, all enrolled in school, of whom only one is under her care. She lives alone with her child and is the sole breadwinner for their family. Léontine was only able to attend primary school. She has been selling coolers, plastic kitchen utensils, underwear and shoes in Porto-Novo for almost eight years. She buys her merchandise in the Ouando market in Porto-Novo and also in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. Léontine has already received three loans from ALIDé which have all been correctly reimbursed. Wishing to add to her working capital and grow her inventory so as to increase her turnover, Léontine is requesting a fourth loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of underwear and plastic basins and pails

loans.name: Chong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chong D. is 53 years old and is the leader of a group loan, having been selected by its four members located in Prek Ta In village, Kandal province. With the loan, the members of this group will purchase supplies, equipment and other items to support their different purposes.
   
Mrs. Chong D. and her husband, Mr. Khoeun Sa, are fishermen who are able to earn a small income to support their family's living costs. For this fishing, Mrs. Chong D. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fish nets to support her fishing. This couple has a child who is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children.  One of her children is currently in school.  To support her family, Josephine has been running a salon for less than one year. Josephine is requesting a loan of 100,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy a hand dryer and hair oils, which will help gain more customers, and generate more profit. In the future, Josephine hopes to further expand her business.

Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Afterward, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.  These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance.  Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: To buy a hand dryer and hair oils for her salon.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), a MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines. When she received her previous loans, she invested the money in a hog-raising business and later expanded the business with more pigs. For supplementary income, she has also embarked on an electronic loading business for cell phones such as Smart load, Globe load, and Sun load.

Now on her second loan, she has requested 10,000 PHP as additional working capital for her E-load business and the maintenance of her hog-raising business. She is positive that her businesses will grow since she already has regular customers buying her pigs after four months and solid clients for her E-loading business at home.

She dreams of having a pig farm someday and to provide satisfactory E-loading to her customers. She hopes to have successful businesses that can provide her with a good life and enable her to move beyond the poverty line. She is grateful to ASHI for offering her happiness in life and group support in achieving her goals.

Carmelita’s long term goals are to build sustainable businesses and to fund her three children’s college education. With the support of ASHI and Kiva, she is hopeful that her businesses will generate a steady income to improve her financial stability and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: Additional working capital for her E-load and hog-raising businesses.

loans.name: Alfonsa

texts.en:
Mrs. Alfonsa M. is from Barangay Maquilao, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years of age, is married, and is blessed with two children of whom one is now a college student and the other is still an infant.

Alfonsa is presently engaged in selling RTW (Ready-To-Wear clothes) from GTY, as well as selling AVON Products and running a sari-sari (variety) store. She’s been engaged in selling GTY and AVON products for five years already and earns approximately Php 1,300 a month. Her husband also gives her regular support from his income as a mango sprayer.

Just this year, Alfonsa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. As a newly-recognized member of PMPC under its Regular Loan Program, she requesting a loan of Php 10,000 as her first loan, to be used as additional capital for her business selling RTW and AVON products.

Alfonsa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her general living conditions, especially in meeting her basic needs, saving for the future, loan repayments, her children’s education, insurances, and possible business expansions.


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business selling RTW and AVON products  and for her little sari-sari store

loans.name: Unidad Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Unidad está con formado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y esforzadas  una de ellas es Rosa Argentina C. M. quien tiene una kiosco en un colegio desde hace 11 años. Ella tiene 8 hijos pero solo cuatro están a su cargo 

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Gloria Elena S. Hernández quien tiene una mini panadería y comercializa productos Avon mientras Cecilia Alvarado tiene una pulpería.
texts.en:
The group known as Unity is made up of three hard-working, assertive women. One of them is Rosa Argentina Calera, who has had a kiosk at a high school for the last 11 years. She has 8 children, but is responsible for only four of them. The other members of the group are Gloria Elena Sanchez Hernandez, who has a small bakery and sells Avon products. Cecilia Alvarado has a general store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: En chiverias, gaseosas, pan, reposterias etc.

loans.name: José Ernesto

texts.es: El Sr. José Ernesto E. es originario del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, se desempeña como Técnico de Alfabetización en el Ministerio de Educación de dicho municipio donde tiene 2 años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda con el que compraría cerámica.
texts.en:
José Ernesto E. is from the Santa Rosa del Peñón municipality.  He has worked as a reading teacher in the Ministry of Education for 2 years.  
This is the first loan he requests with Ceprodel, with the objective of making some improvements to his home.  He would use the funds to purchase ceramics/tiles.

loans.use: To purchase ceramics/tiles.

loans.name: Alma's Group

texts.en:
Alma G. is from the village of Lemu Sur. She is 42 years old. Alma is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Alma is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Alma owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of products in the local community. Alma is just starting this business.

In 2010, Alma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alma is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Alma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 34 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is a married woman with five children; three attend school while two are too young for school. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family. 

She operates a grocery business, selling tomatoes, cabbage and green vegetables. In addition she sells charcoal contributing to her other source of income. Mishi faces a challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to build a house in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, green vegetables, cabbage and fried fish. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of tomatoes, green vegetables, cabbage and fried fish.

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna P. is from the village of Villalin, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 26 years old. Elna is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Elna owns and operates a business venture in the services sector providing transportation services. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating service-based activities. Elna has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Elna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to raise additional capital for her business. Elna is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Elna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.en:
Bahodur A. is 30 years old, married, and lives with his wife and 3 children. He has been a farmer for the past 4 years, which he began with the goal of supporting his household and above all to satisfy the needs of his children. For Sayali, agriculture is an activity that he likes to do. Within it, vegetable production is what he likes most, as it is easier to cultivate these plants and the product is profitable in season, which is annually. But the earnings are greater and beneficial for every farmer, especially when buyers purchase the production in great quantities and the expense of transporting the products is avoided as the buyers come to harvest and take it away themselves. Now Sayali wishes to borrow money which he wants to invest in seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants. Sayali is sincerely grateful to all of you.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds, mineral fertilizer, fuels and lubricants.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena S. is from Maquilao Tangub City. She is 33 years old. Rowena is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rowena owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling beauty products in the local community. Rowena has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Rowena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rowena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. Rowena is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Rowena from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Virginie

texts.en:
Virginie is 30 years old, married and has two children who are eighteen and twenty-one years old. Currently, both children attend school. Virginie sells a wide variety of items such as rice, sugar, salt and many other foodstuffs, which she has done for 2 years. Her husband works as a spare parts dealer for motorbikes and cars.  

Virginie will use the loan to purchase more items such as foodstuffs, soft drinks and other home products. With the new profits from her expanded business, Virginie plans to buy a plot of land where her commercial activities will be established. She dreams of having capital of two million in the future.

loans.use: To buy more items such as rice, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Moussa D.  est un homme marié de 38 ans, polygame   avec deux  enfants, il  réside à Siana, un village de la Préfecture    de  Kolondièba (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance de fréquenter l’école, Moussa s’intéressa très tôt aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment  à la réparation de vélos et mobylettes. 
Il dispose d’un magasin qui se trouve au bord de la route traversant son village Siana lequel il vend des pièces détachées pour vélos et mobylettes, des vélos neufs et occasions, en plus de ses activités de réparateurs. 
Pour augmenter son capital il décide d’adhérer au programme  crédit de  Soro Yiriwaso avec qui, il est à son premier prêt individuel.  
Il compte  acheter une importante quantité de pièces détachées à Bamako (capitale du Mali) auprès des grossistes. Il revend ses pièces en détail au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle diverse  et variée. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice de 30.000 FCFA par mois qui sera essentiellement pour achat des animaux et  payer les frais de santé et scolaire des enfants.
texts.en: Monsieur Moussa D. is a 36 year old married polygamous man with two children. He lives in Siana, a village in the District of Kolondièba (third largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali). As he did not have the chance to attend school, Moussa became interested at a young age in activities that generate profits, especially repairing bicycles and motorbikes. He owns a store on the side of the road that passes through Siana and sells spare parts for bicycles and motorbikes, new and secondhand bicycles, and offers to repair other bicycles. In order to increase his revenue he became a meme of the lending group Soro Yiriwaso and his asking for his first individual loan. He plans to use the loan to purchase a large number of spare parts from wholesalers in Bamako (capital city of Mali). He re-sells the individual parts for cash as well as for credit to a diverse clientele. He hopes to gain monthly profits of 30,000 FCFA [approximately 61 USD] which will be used to purchase animals and pay the school and health fees for his children.

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, milk, sugar, and toothpaste

loans.name: Mr. Vey Saut Village Bank Group

texts.en: In the village of Prey Kray in Takeo province, fifteen people have made up a village bank loan. Mr. Vey S. is the village bank president, who has been selected by the other members.  The members will use their portions of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' living situations. Mr. Vey S. is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land where he cultivates rice to sell to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Sok Koev Loem, is a seamstress in a garment factory. This couple supports four children: two are enrolled in the local public schoO., but the others are too young to work or study. Although they work hard, they earn only a small income. So Mr. Vey S. is asking for a loan to buy some piglets for breeding to start a new business.  With the rest of the loan he will fix his motorbike and rebuild his kitchen.

loans.use: To buy some piglets for breeding to start a new business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia U. is from the village of Cabisera 17-21, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 47 years old. Lydia is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Lydia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lydia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 28000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Lydia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette is 30 years old and works as a tailor in her own shop.  She is married to a technician and they have three children between the ages of 5 and 10 years.  All her children go to school. Jeanette has been very successful in her business, which she has been operating for five years. It has allowed her to purchase a house for her family.

Jeanette plans to use her loan to purchase more material to make the traditional Rwandan dresses for women. She plans to pay for her children's school fees with any profits.

loans.use: To purchase material to make traditional Rwandan dresses

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita, de 58 años es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Félix de 58 años y esta dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para mejorar su calidad de vida. La tienda de Margarita es una de las más visitadas en Puerto Ipoki, desde muy temprano por la mañana abre su tienda en espera de que sus vecinos lleguen a comprar las cosas que necesitan. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y atenta, ya que siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa y esta dispuesta ayudarlos en sus compras. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinos, lleva 4 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir. Con el tiempo, espera poder ampliar su tienda y llenarla de más mercadería, para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor variedad de productos. Es el primer crédito con MFP y esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus socias. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos, para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Margarita, 58, is a pleasant and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband Felix, 58, and works very hard in order to improve her quality of life.  Margarita's store is one of the most-visited in Puerto Ipoki.  She opens the store very early in the morning in anticipation of her neighbors coming to buy the things that they need.  She is a happy and attentive saleswoman, always receiving her customers with a smile and helping them with their purchases.  What she likes most about her job is talking with her neighbors.  She has been doing this work for 4 years.  The hardest part is spending the whole day in her store without being able to leave.

With time, she hopes to be able to grow her store and fill it with more merchandise, in order to offer her customers a greater variety of products.  This is the first loan with MFP and she intends to make all her payments on time, since she does not want to cause any problems for her communal bank where she is well-liked by the rest of the members.

With the one thousand nuevos soles she is seeking, she will buy more products to be able to improve her store.

loans.use: Buy more products to grow her store.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.ar: حسين عمره 40 سنة متزوج وله 6 اولاد يعمل في حدادة السيارات وبيع الاكسسوارات الخاصة بها، له في عمله 28 سنة. يحب عمله ويطوره بشكل مستمر يريد دائما التجدد والتطور في العمل،  يريد تأمين حياة افضل لأولاده وتعليمهم بشكل جيد فهو محب للعائلة مجد في العمل ونشيط يتميز بالدقة في العمل والنشاط وطلب التطور دائما يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة مخصصة لعمله في حدادة السيارات بالإضافة إلى الإكسسوارات اللازمة لبيعها. كما أن حسين يريد دعم محل الهواتف الخليوية، فهو يطمح بأن يصبح صاحب محل اكبر حتى يتمكن من التطور وزيادة مدخولة والربح بالإضافة إلى تربية أولاده بشكل جيد ومريح
texts.en: Hussein is 40 years old and married with six children. He works as a mechanic and merchandiser of car accessories. He has 28 years of experience in this line of work. He likes his work and is always finding new ways to develop his business. He enjoys improving his business and augmenting his income as much as he can. He would like to secure a better life for his children, as well as provide them with a good education, because he loves his family very much. He is serious about his work, and he has a strong work ethic. In addition, he stands out in his line of work due to his attention to detail, the energy he puts into his work, and his drive to constantly improve his business. With a loan from A.-Majmoua, Hussein would like to buy new goods and accessories for his car business. He aspires to one day own a bigger store so that he can improve his standard of living and increase both his income and his business profits. These things will better enable him to raise his children both well and in comfortable financiA. circumstances.

loans.use: To buy new products for his business in vehicle repair, in addition to increasing his stock of car accessories

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA”; Este banco está ubicado en el poblado de Oropesa,  provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ana; es  conviviente, la socia tiene 24 años de edad; la socia tiene 2 hijos de (6, 1) años de edad, la socia  alterna sus actividades del hogar con la agricultura, la socia tiene sus terrenos de cultivo, ella produce maíz, papa, cebolla, verduras y también tiene ganados, la socia se dedica desde muy niña a la agricultura actividad que sus padres le enseñaron muy bien. La socia ahora desea invertir el préstamo solicitado en la compra de semillas, abono para una nueva siembra. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas para un nuevo cultivo de tierras.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “VIRGEN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA” community bank. This bank is located in the town of en Oropesa, province of Quispicanchis and  departament de Cuzco.

This member's name is Ana. She is in a common law marriage and is 24 years old. She has 2 children, aged 6 and 1. She alternates between her household duties and farming. She has her crops, which produce corn, potatoes, onions, and vegetables. She also has cattle. She has worked in agriculture since she was very young and her parents taught her very well. Ana wants to invest the loan she asked for in buying seed for new plantings. 

Ana is very grateful for the loan and is committed to making the payments on the in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to invest in buying seeds for new crops.

loans.name: Dédé Marlène

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits cosmétiques  à domicile depuis 01 an, Marlène est célibataire .elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Ce premier crédit servira à se réapprovisionner en mèches et en produits de beauté pour satisfaire les besoins de ses clientes qui sont sans cesse croissants .Elle a  27 ans  et est déterminé à se battre dans la vie pour gagner son pain quotidien.
texts.en:
Marlène is single, and has been selling beauty products from home for one year. She obtains her supplies at the Grand Market in Lomé.

This first loan will allow her to re-stock on hair extensions and beauty products to meet the needs of her ever-growing customer base. She is 27 years old and determined to meet all of life's challenges in order to earn her daily bread.

loans.use: to buy and sell beauty products

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 66 years old, she has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 30 years.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer and pay for labor. She normally sells her produce at the local market

In future, Maria hopes to practice farming on a larger scale and become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mireidy

texts.es:
Mireydi 

600.000

Mireidy tiene 52 años, vive en la Aurora de Heredia y se dedica junto a su socia Amanda Carrillo a la distribución de helados en diferentes lugares del Valle Central principalmente en la zona de Heredia, lugar donde residen, para esto requieren el apoyo de un carro estilo Pick up, en el cual transportan los helados para distribuirlos a sus clientes y el cual con un préstamo solicitado por su socia se le realizaron las reparaciones respectivas para su circulación, según las leyes de Costa Rica.
En esta oportunidad se requiere del préstamo, ya que ante las dificultades actuales del mercado se desea introducir nuevas variedades de Helado y así poder abarcar otros segmentos, obteniendo un margen de ganancia más alto. Consideran que la línea que están distribuyendo actualmente se ha estancado   y se debe de innovar nuevas áreas para seguir siendo competitivas.
La clienta vive con su esposo y un hijo que está estudiando en la Universidad, ella se levanta temprano y realiza las labores del hogar, a las 8:30 am ella y su socia salen a repartir los helados en su vehículo, regresando al final de la tarde. La clienta tiene un excelente historial crediticio en Fundación Mujer, solicitando su crédito número 6.Estos préstamos le ha permitido crecer y le han servido para fortalecer su microempresa y brindar apoyo a su hijo que actualmente estudia en la Universidad.
texts.en:
Mireidi is fifty-two and lives in Aurora de Heredia.  She works alongside her business partner, Amanda Carrillo, distributing ice cream to different locations in Valle Central, mainly in the area of Heredia, where she lives.  She's uses a pickup truck to transport the products and distribute them to her customers.  They used the loan her partner requested to make repairs, according to Costa Rican laws, so they can drive around.

Mireidi needs a loan at this time because, in light of current market difficulties, she would like to introduce new kinds of ice cream to cover other market segments and obtain a higher profit margin.  They feel that the line of products they currently offer has stagnated so they've got to innovate with new ones if they want to stay competitive.  

Mireidi lives with her husband and a son, who studies at the university.  She gets up early, does the housework, and at 8:30 she and her partner go out delivering ice cream in her truck, returning in late afternoon. She has an excellent credit history with Fundación Mujer and this is her sixth loan.  The loans allow her to grow and have served to strengthen her microbusiness and provide support to her son in college.

loans.use: to introduce a new product line so she can improve her financial situation. She sells ice cream.

loans.name: Joner

texts.en:
Joner is 35 years old and is married with three children. He lives in the Philippines. For the past five years, Joner has operated a motorcycle transport, or habal-habal, business. 

Joner has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. He is requesting a loan of 14,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the utilities needed to maintain his business. In the future, Joner hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for utilities

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth es natural de Huancayo, la ciudad donde actualmente radica al lado de sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Sus deseos de emprender la motivaron a tener su negocio en su misma casa. Desde hace 6 años vende productos de primera necesidad en un espacio que disponía en su casa, ahí brinda una atención cálida y amable a sus clientes que recurren a su tienda. Todos los días atiende en su establecimiento hasta los fines de semana y en ocasiones sus hijos la apoyan cuando tienen tiempo libre. Las ventas aumentan cuando son  fechas festivas por ello su deseo es mejorar su tienda con más mercadería. Es una de las socias con mayor trayectoria en su grupo solidario que actualmente se mantiene a través del tiempo, siendo ella una de las que promueve la perseverancia y la responsabilidad en sus pagos. El dinero lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería ya que ha planificado renovar la mercadería que dispone.
texts.en: Elizabeth is a native of Huancayo, the city where she now lives with her 2 children in her own home.  Her desire to launch a business motivated her to set up a store in her own home.  For 6 years she has been selling basic consumer goods from a space in her house.  Here she provides warm and friendly service to the customers who patronize her store.  She attends to the store every day, even on the weekends, and occasionally  her children help her with the business when they have free time.  Her sales rise during holidays, and so she wants to improve her store by having more merchandise in stock.  She is one of the more experienced members in her communal bank, which has been able to keep going over time; in the group she promotes perseverance and responsibility in making payments. She will invest this money in the purchase of more merchandise, since she has planned on renewing the merchandise that she has available in her business.

loans.use: to buy products to restock her store

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George has operated his tailor shop in Naivasha town for the last ten years. He is 48, married to Hildah and they have four school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET by one of their field officers and this will be his third loan. He paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more fabric for making new clothes for sell.

In the future, George hopes to move into a more permanent place as his business grows.

loans.use: to buy more fabric for making new clothes for sell.

loans.name: Jose Anastacio

texts.es: El Señor José Anastaco tiene 50 años, es la de la comunidad de posoltega. El tiene su negocio que es compra venta y destace de cerdo. Tiene 6 hijos bajo su cargo José le enseña a ellos a ganarse la vida de forma muy honrada.  Solicitó su crédito para la compra de 3 cerdos. En un futuro desea incrementar la compra y venta de cerdos y que sus hijos se preparen pero que también sigan trabajando que con tanto esfuerzo él ha sacado adelante.
texts.en: José Anastaco is 50 years old, and he comes from the community of Posoltega. He engages in buying, selling and slaughtering pigs. He has 6 children whom he is responsible for, and he teaches them to earn their living in a very honorable way. He has requested a loan to buy 3 pigs. In the future he wants to improve the purchase and the selling of pigs; he also wants his children to study but also to keep on working in the activity he has carried out with much effort.

loans.use: To buy 3 pigs.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA 3”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maura; ella tiene 50 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artefactos como radios, calculadoras y relojes, ella vende en forma ambulatoria en el mercado de Urubamba desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de artefactos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artefactos como radios, calculadoras y relojes al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the SAYHUA 3 communal bank. The bank is located in Urubamba district, belonging to Urubamba province and Cusco department.

The member is Sra. Maura. She is 50 years of age and lives with her partner and has 4 children. Her daily activities are devoted to her business selling devices like radios, calculators and watches. She is a street vendor at the Urubamba market from 7:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. She wishes to expand and improve her sales and requests the loan so she can purchase devices such as radios, calculators and watches wholesale. 

The member is happy about the loan and is committed to making her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy devices such as radios, calculators and watches wholesale.

loans.name: Ganbat

texts.en:
Mr. Ganbat is 37 years old. He lives with his son, daughter and wife in their own house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He is a taxi driver, and has been running this business for many years. He also works at construction when he has orders for building or decoration. 

Recently, his house and fence became very bad, unstable and uncomfortable to live in. Especially, there is a need to make insulation on the walls, repair the roof and change the window sheets firstly. Likewise, the fence should be renovated and he is planning to rebuild it with brick. 

Therefore, Ganbat is requesting a loan to purchase necessary building materials to make a renovation to his house and fence.

loans.use: To purchase necessary building materials to make a renovation to his house and fence.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina Isabel de 37 años de edad, reside en casa propia junto a su hijo de 13 años y su hija de 3 años. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, de manera ambulante, en las principales zonas donde ella reside. Es muy conocida en la zona y muchas personas la prefieren ya que ella es una mujer dedicada a su trabajo pero sobre todo muy amable. Ella siempre trata de mantener lo más nuevo y al alcance del bolsillo en el mundo  de la moda, de tal manera que los clientes siempre la prefieran y sigan solicitando sus productos. Su deseo es poder ofrecer una mayor cantidad de prendas de vestir con el fin de que su negocio crezca cada día más. Esto la ha hecho tomar la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de variedad de prendas de vestir como: faldas, pantalones, blusas, camisas, vestidos, shorts, y de mas productos que permitan atraer a más clientes. De tal manera que sus ventas e ingresos se vean aumentadas y consecuentemente pueda mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Reina Isabel is 37 years old and lives in her own home together with her 13-year-old son and her 3-year-old daughter.  Her business is selling new clothes as an itinerant vendor in the areas around her home.  She is very well known in her area and many people prefer to buy from her as she is very committed to her work but, above all, she is very kind.  Reina always tries to keep the very latest products in stock and make them affordable to everybody.  For this reason, her customers prefer to buy from her and continue requesting her products.  Reina's wish is to be able to sell a larger quantity of clothes so that her business grows every day.

Reina Isabel has taken the decision to request this loan from INTEGRAL to invest in her business.  She will buy a range of clothes such as skirts, pants, blouses, shirts, dresses, shorts and other products which will enable her to gain more customers.  Her sales and income will increase and, consequently, she will be able to improve her own quality of life as well as that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a range of clothes such as skirts, pants, blouses, shirts, dresses, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with two children. 
Letecia has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.
Letecia is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Letecia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Holalie

texts.fr:
Holalie est une femme âgée de 27 ans. Elle est célibataire. 
Holalie travaille comme une revendeuse depuis 2007. Elle achète et revend des produits de beauté de femmes genre les laits corporels, les parfums, les maquillages, les tissages à toutes ces clientes au marché de Hédzranawoé à Lomé. Elle achète les produits auprès des grossistes de Lomé. Elle travaille  seule.
 Holalie a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter ces produits de beauté. Elle veut avec ses revenus supplémentaires, agrandir sa marchandise.
 Dans les prochaines années, Holali voudrait avoir une grande boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit avoir une vie heureuse.
texts.en:
Holalie is 27 years old and single. She has been working as a trader since 2007 and sells feminine beauty products such as body lotions, perfumes, make-up and hair weaves. She sells her merchandise at the market of Hédzranawoé in Lomé, and buys her products from the wholesalers in town. She works alone.

Holalie is requesting her first loan from WAGES so that she can restock on beauty products. She plans to use her extra revenue to expand her product range and, sometime in the next few years, would like to own a large shop. She will use her profits to live a happy life.

loans.use: to restock on beauty products.

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es: La socia Zoraida está solicitando el préstamo para abastecer su pequeña tienda de abarrotes y desea comprar por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, tarros de leche, menestras y otras cosas más. El anterior crédito a la socia le ayudo para incrementar sus ventas por lo tanto obtuvo buenas ganancias de la cuales lo destino para la alimentación y educación de sus hijos. La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Zoraida is asking for a loan in order to supply her little grocery store and she wants to buy, for example, bags of rice, bags of sugar, large containers of milk, beans and other items. 

The last loan helped her to increase her sales, which increased her profits and enabled her to feed and educate her children. She is very grateful for the loan and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, bags of sugar, large containers of milk, beans and other items to supply her grocery store

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 41-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman Jordan and the mother of four children.

Hanan is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase home furniture.

An aspiration of Hanan's is to purchase her own car.

Due to cultural issues, the man in the picture is Hanan's husband.

loans.use: to purchase home furniture

loans.name: Jose Cresencio

texts.es:
el sr. Jose Crecencio tiene 50 años de edad, esta casado y padre de 3 hijos, Jose se dedica a la caficultura desde hace varios años, gracias a su negocio recibe ganancias las cuales las necesita para el sustento de su familia. 
Don José utilizara el credito para comprar su propio sistema solar y poder iluminarse por las noches y no es dañina como los candiles, en zona donde él vive no se cuenta con el servicio de energía eléctrica y por las noches toda su vida les ha tocado alumbrase con candiles o rajas de ocote. esto mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia. nos comento que se siente muy feliz ya que esto es un paso grande para la comunidad donde el reside.
texts.en:
José Crecencio, 50, is married and the father of three children.  José has been a coffee grower for several years.  Thanks to this business he earns profits needed to support his family.

José will use the loan to buy his own solar generator so that he can have light at night that’s not damaging like candle light.  The zone where he lives does not have electric services and at night they have to use candles or pitch pine for illumination.  This will improve his family’s quality of life.  He told us that he feels very happy because this is a big step for the community he lives in.

loans.use: to buy a solar generator.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
El socio tiene 29 años de edad, es casado, tiene tres hijos .El alterna sigue con su negocio de molinera,el tiene una empresa donde muele granos de trigo,cebadas y habas y tambien ahora tiene un pequeño negocio de fereteria,el socio atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de molinera y ampliar el negocio de ferreteria . El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar granos para su molinera y tambien para comprar mercaderia para la ferreteria.
 

 
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
This member is 29 years old, married, and has three children. He continues with his milling business where he processes foods such as wheat, barley, and beans.
