In addition, he now manages a small hardware store. The member works from 8am to 6pm. Through these small businesses, he is able to help his children get ahead. The member wants to expand and improve his milling and hardware businesses, so he is requesting a loan to buy grain for milling and merchandise for his hardware store.

He is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete his payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy grain for milling and merchandise for his hardware store.

loans.name: Mariael

texts.en:
Mariael is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child. 

Mariael has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Mariael has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Mariael hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.es: Jaqueline de 29 años, vive en Puerto Colombia, municipio ubicado a orillas del mar caribe, con su esposo y alimentando en familia sus sueños de crecimiento y prosperidad futura, mediante su negocio de piñatería, ubicado en el centro de esta población; desde que Jaqueline inauguró su negocio, este  ha tenido una gran acogida por los habitantes porteños, debido a que su fortaleza es la capacidad de promoción de su propietaria y porque es uno de los pocos almacenes de piñatería que existen en Puerto Colombia, donde además,  los clientes  encuentran  bolsas de regalos, útiles escolares, de papelería, globos, desechables , piñatas infantiles,  recordatorios  etc. Su meta de crecimiento empresarial no se detiene y esta es la razón por la cual desea aumentar su capital de trabajo mediante los credikiva, por eso está aplicando al primero, que es también el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará juguetes, útiles escolares, para atender dos temporadas que vienen y usualmente las ventas se incrementan sustancialmente y ella debe estar preparada para responder a las necesidades, deseos e intereses de sus clientes reales y potenciales. Así mismo su meta es lograr construír condiciones excepcionales de bienestar, para que cuando su hijo, en camino,  llegue a su hogar fortalezca la felicidad que hoy reina en su familia.
texts.en: Jaqueline is 29 years old and she and her husband live in Puerto Colombia, a city located along the Caribbean Sea.  Together they feed her dreams of growth and a prosperous life through her piñata business, located in the population center.  Jaqueline’s business has been welcomed by the port residents ever since she began it.  Its strength is in her ability to promote it and because there are only a few piñata businesses in Puerto Colombia.  In her shop her customers can also find gift bags, school supples, paper goods, balloons, disposable items, children’s piñatas, souvenirs, etc.  Her goal of growing her business does not stop and this is why she wants to increase her working capital through a Kiva loan, and she is applying for her first loan though Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the money to buy toys and school supplies to stock up for two upcoming seasons when her sales increase substantially and she needs to be prepared to respond to her customers’ current and potential needs, wants, and interests.  Another goal is to create exceptional conditions of well-being so that her son will be happy when he is at home and also strengthen the happiness that reigns in the family.

loans.use: to buy tows and school supplies.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es: Saturnina tiene 54 años, es una mujer viuda que vive en su propio hogar junto a su unico hijo Yoni de 15 años; a quien brinda lo mejor. Sus años no son impedimento para seguir luchando por el mejor bienestar de su hijo y de si misma. Saturnina es una mujer triunfante y con muchas ganas de superación, se dedica a la venta de comida en el mercado de su localidad, cuenta con un puesto pequeño donde viene trabajando hace 10 años en esta actividad. Saturnina vende su comida desde muy temprano ya que la gente que lo consume sale satisfechos por lo delicioso que prepara.  La venta de comida le proporciona buenas ganancias, cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su hijo quien esta pendiente en los mandatos de sus consumidores. Su plan a futuro es adquirir más víveres para brindar mejor alimentación  a sus consumidores. Este será su crédito número 05 con MFP; sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro crédito con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles solicitados, adquirirá más víveres para brindar mejor alimentación a sus consumidores.
texts.en:
Saturnina, 54, is a widow and lives in her own home together with her only son, Yoni, who is 15 years old. She gives him the best. Her age doesn't stop her from continuing to fight for a better life for herself and her son. Saturnina is a joyful woman and has a great desire to improve herself.  

She sells food in her town's market. She has a small stall where she has been working for 10 years. Saturnina sells food beginning very early in the morning and her customers leave satisfied by the delicious things she prepares. She earns good money selling food, and her son provides her with his unconditional support, helping meet the demands of her customers. 

Her plan for the future is to buy more supplies so that she can feed her customers better. This will be her 5th loan with MFP. She knows that if she pays on time, she will be able to access other loans more easily and without complications in her village bank. With the 3,000 nuevos soles that she requested, she will buy more provisions to give better food to her customers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make meals.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en: Roselyn is married with two children. She is 30 years old and lives in Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. Roselyn sells food for snacks to earn a living and has had this business for two years. She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business. Roselyn has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business

location.town: Liloy-Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, ZAmboanga Del Norte

loans.name: 17 De Septiembre Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Salvadora de Jesús que se dedica a vender ropa usada, desde hace dos años tiene tres hijos menores y es madre soltera. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de pacas de ropa usada, Marisol vende ropa usada y ropa nueva, María Auxiliadora vende cosméticos de  la Avon.
texts.en:
This group was formed by three entrepreneurial women.  Salvadora de Jesus is one of the women and she has been selling second hand clothing for the past three years.  She is the single mother of three young children and will use the money from this loan to buy second hand clothing.
Marisol sells new and second hand clothing.  Maria Auxiliadora sells Avon brand cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is an embroidery expert. She has got great skills and her embroidered clothes are very much appreciated by her clients. 

She is a mother of 6 children and all of them are continuing their education. Razia's 3 elder daughters are also learning the art of embroidery and help her in her work. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for further improvement of her embroidery business. 

At the moment, it is wedding season and she has a good number of orders to fulfill. She is confident that her business will be improved as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy embroidery material for her embroidery business

loans.name: Jobir

texts.en: Jobir is young and purposeful man. He is married and has a little child. His wife is housewife and has been busy with up-bringing child. Jobir has been busy with taxi business more than 5 years. Jobir has a little income from this business. His income is not enough for providing family with good living condition. Jobir plans to go to Russia for finding job because his income from taxi business is too small. Jobir is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni to buy air ticket to Russia. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy air ticket to Russia

loans.name: Krum

texts.en:
Krum N. is 36 years old. Over 15 years he has worked as a police officer in Vratza. Krum N. is married and has two children. His wife does not work at the moment. She is keeping their 2 months baby.

Krum runs his own business because of his father in law. He opens a coffee and soft drinks shop on one of the main streets of the city and later Krum inherits and develops this business.

Now Krum N. needs $ 2 000 to buy a new professional coffee making machine and a refrigerator for soft drinks for his shop.

loans.use: To buy a new professional coffee making machine and a refrigerator for soft drinks

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is married and has two children, one of whom is going to school. He has been at his business for the last two years, which he started with funds he got from selling his cow.

Given the loan, he wants to diversify his business by offering different clothing and materials to attract a wider clientele.

He hopes to use the profit to save for future business expansion and cater for his familys needs.

loans.use: Purchase of additional stock for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: cow husbandry

loans.name: Blanca Esthela

texts.es:
Blanca has two daughters, who are 7 and 8 years old respectively , and a 3 year-old son. She is a single mother and has never received support from the father to help raise their children. Five years ago Blanca decided to use her entrepreneur skills to sell used clothing in order to better provide for her family. Blanca wants her children to get a good education, thus, allowing them to have a better chance to succeed in the future - this is what makes her sacrifice worthwhile.

Blanca sells her merchandise in street markets with help from her mother. Together they have been able to expand their business and to fulfill her clients demands she now needs a loan in the amount of US$375.00, which will be used to purchase new clothes. She promises to pay back the loan within 6 months. You could become an important part in Blanca family's life, she deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving her.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer.

Blanca tiene dos hijas de 7 y 8 años y un pequeño de 3 años de edad, ella es madre soltera y nunca ha contado con el apoyo de su pareja para el sostén de sus hijos, así que Blanca por ser una mujer emprendedora decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de ropa usada desde hace cinco años con el deseo de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, Blanca quiere que sus hijos puedan tener una buena educación y puedan tener mejores oportunidades en el futuro, esto es lo que la impulsa cada día a esforzarse más.

Blanca realiza sus ventas en los mercados ambulantes, donde recibe la ayuda de su madre, juntas han logrado hace crecer su negocio y para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes ahora esta solicitando un préstamo de $ 375 dólares, que destinará a la compra de ropa nueva que le han estado solicitando sus clientes, ella promete regresar este dinero en 6 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en la vida de Blanca y su familia, ellos te agradecen mucho la confianza y apoyo que les brindas.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Sevda

texts.en:
Ms. Sevda is a low income, vulnerable person. She is 39, married with four children and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Sevda and her husband (he is shown on the picture) run a family business together. Her husband sells meat in the local big market, while Sevda grazes the flock. In this season (autumn), lambs are cheap and it is thus a good chance to increase the number of sheeps. Therefore, Sevda applied for a $500 loan to Normicro Saatli branch. This amount could buy 8 lambs, which would make it possible for Sevda to earn $900 in six months' time.

loans.use: To increase her number of sheep

loans.name: Akouwa

texts.fr:
Ms. Akouwa A. was born February 19, 1975 in Lomé. She is single and a secretary in a cyber café. She also takes care of two (02) other people. With her small salary, she is not able to honor her responsibilities. To meet all of her family’s needs, she would like to sell telephone cards, in addition to her job as a secretary. To do so, she is requesting a loan of $400. This business will allow her to earn a profit that she will add to her secretary’s salary in order to meet her family’s needs.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 19 février 1975 à Lomé et célibataire, Mlle Akouwa A. est secrétaire dans un cyber et a deux (02) personnes à sa charge. Avec son salaire dérisoire, elle n’arrive pas à honorer ses responsabilités. Pour pouvoir subvenir à ces besoins, elle compte en plus de son poste de secrétariat vendre des crédits de communication. A cet effet, elle sollicite un crédit de $400. Cette activité lui permettrait de dégager d’autres bénéfices qu’elle ajoutera à son salaire afin de pourvoir à ses besoins.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of pre-paid telephone cards

loans.name: Koin

texts.en:
Mrs. Koin C. (age 47) and her family live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers north of Phnom Penh. Koin and her husband (also age 47), have been married for eighteen years and have four children. The two younger study in secondary school in the village.

Koin is requesting this, her fourth loan from Maxima, to purchase and prepare a second loom and to buy thread for weaving. She has been weaving for six years. Her daughter who will work on the second loom (see photo) learned at the same time as Koin. They said they can each finish about fifteen pieces in a month so they feel they will have no problem paying back the loan.

loans.use: To purchase and set up a second loom and buy thread for weaving

loans.name: Upendo

texts.en: Upendo (Swahili for "love") is a 30 year-old widow who runs a cafe in order to support herself and her 2 children (ages 12 and 15). She started this cafe in 2003 and now makes a profit of about $55 a month. There, she serves lunch and dinner and works from 10am to 10pm daily. She requests a loan to increase her food stock and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy food stock

loans.name: Maria Dora

texts.es:
María Dora Berrios is a single woman with a young daughter who has her own business selling cosmetics. She serves the general public in a small beauty salon. María began her business 15 years ago, applying all of her knowledge in the fields of beauty and fashion in order to purchase cosmetic products. Through the years her business has improved with the acquisition of better tools for use in her salon and also with increased sales of her cosmetics.

One need that is currently facing Ms. Berrios is that due to her lower income level, she believes it urgent to invest in the purchase of cosmetics and in remodeling her shop since the sector in which she is located is very competitive and the other salons are in better conditions. For this reason María sincerely requests to be granted a loan that she can invest in improving her salon and thereby continue to support her young daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, KIVA volunteer

María Dora Berrios es una dama soltera y con una pequeña hija que tiene su propio negocio de venta de cosméticos y un pequeño salón de belleza donde atiende al publico en general. Su negocio lo inicia desde hace 15 años aplicando todos sus conocimientos en el ramo de la belleza y la moda para adquirir sus productos de cosmeticos. A través de los años ha venido mejorando su negocio con la adquisición de mejores herramientas para utilizar en su salón y a la vez con la puesta en venta de sus cosméticos.

Una necesidad que pasa la señora Berrios es que debido a sus bajos ingresos económicos le urge invertir en la compra de los cosméticos y remodelación del salón ya que en el sector donde ella se ubica existe mucha competencia y los otros salones se encuentran en mejores condiciones. Por esta razón es que muy confiadamente, se acerca a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con Créditos que los invierte en el mejoramiento de su salón y así continuar manteniendo a su pequeña hija.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of cosmetics

loans.name: Michael

texts.es:
Michael A., is a 25 years old, hard-working young man. When he was a little boy his parents taught him the precious value of working. Michael married a beautiful young lady from his hometown of Ticuantepe. Michael and his wife live with their in-laws. The young couple has two children, one of the children is still a newborn. Preoccupied about his family, Michael works at a gas station as a service technician, and with his salary and the help of his father-in-law, he has begun the construction of his future home in a terrain in front of his father-in-law’s house. Michael managed to buy the land with the hopes of owning a home. Michael’s wife also began selling beauty products and cosmetics in order to support her husband and realize their dream of owing a home. Michael needs this loan to buy construction materials so their humble house can quickly become a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

Michael A., es un joven trabajador de 25 años que desde pequeño sus padres le enseñaron el precioso valor del trabajo, se caso con una linda joven de su pueblo Ticuantepe y actualmente vive con ella en casa de sus suegros en donde ha procreado dos hijos, uno tras otro de brazos aun, así que preocupado por su familia trabaja en una Gasolinera como Técnico de servicio y con su ingreso y apoyo de sus suegro ha empezado la construcción de su vivienda en un terreno frente a la casa de su suegro que logró comprar con la ilusión de vivir solos. También su esposa empezó a vender cosméticos a domicilio al crédito para apoyarlo en el sueño de su casa. Necesita este préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción y que su humilde casa pronto sea una realidad.

loans.use: To Buy Construction Materials

loans.name: Paula's Group

texts.en:
Paula C. Paula coordinates the activity of a group of five women, all of whom are entrepreneurs. Paula runs a well-established grocery store in the community. Everyday she receives visits from large numbers of people who want to purchase a variety of products, including rice, beans, vegetable oil, bread, peanut butter and the like. Her store also offers alcoholic and energy drinks. Paula plans on using her loan to purchase more products so that she can considerably increase her sales volume and revenue. That way, this entrepreneur will be able to improve her family’s standard of living.

The members of Paula’s group are: Yesenia María A. A., who owns a grocery store; Maxima Augustina D. L. S. D., who is borrowing for her jewelry store; Celeste R. C., who wishes to purchase silver jewelry, and Claudina V., who wants to buy beauty products for her store.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products to supply a grocery store.

loans.name: Recho

texts.en:
Mambo from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 25-year-old Recho M.. She is not married and has 1 blessed child aged 3. She has 1 more dependent who lives with her because he is an orphan. In 2000, Recho established her used clothing business. She now requires a loan in order to buy more stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

Secondhand clothes journey across the oceans from America and Europe and are then washed, ironed and sold in bulk by wholesalers in Dar es Salaam to retailers who then rewash and re-iron them for sale on the streets of Dar es Salaam and the surrounding towns and villages. These clothes are becoming increasingly popular, especially among the younger generation, because they are so cheap and because of the general appeal of anything Western or modern. Many people argue that the popularity of the West’s cast-offs is damaging the local cloth and garment industry. There are many people who still appreciate the beauty of traditional Tanzanian dress, however, the growing market in used clothing and its importance to many micro-entrepreneurs cannot be denied.

loans.use: To buy more stock in bulk.

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es:
Maria Elsa C. is from the sector of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega, where she devotes herself to working with the goal of improving her home, which has gotten to a state of disrepair. For this reason she has invested in reconstruction. Because of her economic difficulties, however, she had to stop the process.

Today Ceprodel has come to the rescue by soliciting credit that would allow her to purchase the construction materials she needs for the reconstruction of her home. She is confident that this way she will be able to succeed and have better conditions in which to live.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria Elsa C. es originaria del municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega donde se dedica arduamente a trabajar con el propósito de mejorar su vivienda ya que ha sido muy maltratada desde hace varios años y por este motivo ha invertido en la reconstrucción de esta, sin embargo a pesar de las dificultades económicas al haber iniciado con la construcción se vio en la tarea de detener el proceso por falta del recurso económico.

Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito que le permita la compra de los materiales de construcción para su reconstrucción de su vivienda. Es por este motivo que espera muy confiadamente ya que de esta manera logrará salir adelante y tener mejores condiciones para vivir.

loans.use: Purchasing construction materials

loans.name: Arshad

texts.en: Arshad is single. His brother is pictured. He was born in 1987. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, the Kalbadjar region, and he has settled in the Surakhani region. He has run this business for 4 years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy more foodstuffs to grow his profits.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy has had a business selling secretarial services in Arusha for eight years. She is married with two children, ages 5 and 12. She also cares for two dependents who are also 5 and 12 years old. Lucy works from 7:30am to 6:00pm daily to earn a monthly profit of approximately $200 per month.

Lucy has previously taken out two loans through BRAC Tanzania. She paid back both loans successfully and on time. She is hoping to use this current loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand a secretarial business.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos P. Meléndez lives in the small town of Armenia in the province of Sonsonate. For five years now, Santos has been running a small business selling sandals and CDs. He lives with his wife and four children, all of them school aged. His large family gives him various costs and economic complications, but at the same time, it's family that gives him inspiration and a desire to advance. The journey hasn't been easy; in the beginning Santos lacked work capital and no banking institution trusted him nor loaned him money. This forced him to borrow money from individual lenders that sometimes charged him interest costs much higher than that of the loan itself. With courage and faith in himself Santos never stopped believing in his dream. Santos P. dreams about opening a store selling milk products and clothing, which will guarantee a decent education for his children. For now, Santos is looking to expand his business. This is the reason why he is requesting a loan to buy more sandals and CDs, which will help his small shop to grow and develop.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Santos P. Meléndez vive en el pequeño pueblo de Armenia, en el departamento de Sonsonate. Desde hace ya cinco años, Santos maneja un pequeño negocio de venta de sandalias y discos musicales (cd´s). Junto a él, viven su esposa y cuatro hijos, todos pequeños y todos estudiantes en la escuela. Su amplia familia le provoca múltiples gastos y complicaciones económicas, pero a la vez, es la misma familia, quien se vuelve su inspiración y fuerzas de avanzar. El camino no ha sido fácil, pues en sus inicios, Santos carecía de capital de trabajo, y ninguna institución bancaria confiaba en el, ni le prestaba dinero. Esto lo forzó a prestar dinero a prestamistas individuales, que le cobraban tasas de intereses a veces más altas que el préstamo mismo. Con valor y fe en sí mismo, Santos nunca dejo de creer en su visión. Santos P. sueña con abrir una venta de de lácteos y ropa, que garantice a sus hijos, una educación decente. Por ahora, Santos busca expandir su negocio. Es por esto que solicita un préstamo para comprar más sandalias y cd´s, que ayuden al crecimiento y desarrollo de su pequeña venta

loans.use: Purchase of sandals and CDs to sell

loans.name: Alaxpacha Group

texts.es:
Alaxpacha, Traducción el Español: 'Espacio del más allá, cielo' . Es decir, es el espacio superior donde se encuentran el sol, la L. y las estrellas.
El tejido de chompas, mantillas y  otras prendas, en lana de alpaca es la actividad principal de 13 mujeres ansiosas de crecer en sus negocios. Agrupadas en una asociación denominada Alaxpacha”,  trabajan en el centro focal Los Andes que pertenece a la institución Pro-Mujer.
Ya finalizados sus trabajos los venden a pedido, en tiendas de artesanía y ferias de la ciudad de La Paz.
Ellas quieren exportar sus productos al interior y exterior del país, por lo que necesitan mayores créditos para la compra de materia prima, (fibra de alpaca) además de  acceder a capacitaciones donde aprendan a promocionar sus productos de manera mas calificada. De esta manera lograr crecimiento personal y económico, para el bien de sus hogares.
texts.en:
"Alaxpacha", the English translation: 'from beyond space, sky'. Which means the the space where you find the sun, moon and stars. Knitting sweaters, shawls, and other garments out of alpaca wool is the main work of 13 women eager to grow their businesses. Their group is in an association called Alaxpacha, and they work in the region of Los Andes for an institution that belongs to Pro-Mujer "Pro-Women". Once they complete their work, they sell them in craft shops and fairs in the city of La Paz. These women now want to export their products inside and outside the country, so they need a larger loan for the purchase of raw materials, (alpaca fiber) in addition to access training where they can learn to promote their products. This way, they will be able to achieve personal growth and economic development for the good of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase alpaca fiber/material

loans.name: Nget

texts.en: Mrs. Nget T. is a villager in Andoung Thmor Village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Hao T., own a small piece of land where they cultivate rice. They have four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others attend the local school. Although Mrs. Nget T.’s family members have jobs, they still cannot afford to build a house so she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She hopes to improve her living conditions with this new loan of $300. Her husband appears with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy timbers to build a new house.

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Candida Rosa Martínez P. tiene la edad de 40 años, su estado civil es soltera, ella tiene 2 hijos de los cuales tiene 1 varón de la edad de 18 años que cursa recientemente el 5 año de secundaria y una mujer de 21 años de edad que estudia bionalisis clínico, sus propósitos son seguir adelante en su negocio por lo que este le genera los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, en sus deseos esta el realizarle mejoras a su vivienda y también a la de su mama para que cuando se aproxime la temporada de invierno no pase dificultades en su vivienda por lo que agradece mantener la mano amiga de fundación león 2000 y otras organizaciones.


Su actividad económica es la venta de tortillas, que su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación en león, el tiempo que tiene de poseer el negocio es de 35 años, sus inicios comienzan desde la edad de 13 años que empieza vendiendo las tortillas por su barrio y mas tarde el negocio que era de una tía de Doña Rosa pasa a las manos de su mama Doña Paula pero debido a la edad de su mama decide dejarle el negocio a Doña Candida Rosa el financiamiento es para la compra de 10 quintales de maíz ya que la compra de este producto lo realiza de forma semanal y así obtiene mas ingresos y así podrá seguir manteniendo este negocio por lo que ha existido en toda su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Candida Rosa Martínez P. is 40 years old, single, and has 2 children, a 18 year-old son in 5th grade, secondary and a 21 year-old daughter who studies clinical bioanalysis. It is her goal to get ahead with her business as it generates the necessary income for her family and it is her wish to improve her dwelling as well as the one of her mother in order not to have difficulties during the winter season and therefore she is thankful for the helping hand from "Fundación León 2000" and other organizations.

She sells tortillas, her business is located at her house in León and she has been doing this for the last 35 years. She started selling tortillas in her neighborhood at the age of 13. Doña Rosa, the owner of the business, passed it on to her mother, Doña Paula, but due to her age she decided to pass on the business to Doña Candida Rosa. The loan will be spent on the purchase of 10 "quintales" (quintal = 100 lbs.) of corn, as this product is bought on a weekly basis which allows higher income and this way she can maintain the family business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua A. lives in Asokwa, a suburb of Obuasi in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. She is 35 year old, married, and the mother of five children; three are in senior high school and two are in junior high school. She sells tomatoes and other food items like beans, maize, yam, cooking oil, and salt fish on top of a table in the local market. She does not have sufficient working capital to run her business profitably. With the loan, she will purchase good quality stock to upgrade her inventory and the increased income will enable her to provide her children with a good education so they can have a better future. Akua is grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To purchase food items to sell

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Xuyến  năm nay 33  tuổi,  Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2002. Hiện nay chị Xuyến đang chăn nuôi và kinh doanh hàng tạp hóa còn chồng chị làm nghề chụp ảnh. Đây cũng là những  công việc đem lại  nguồn thu nhập chủ yếu cho gia đình chị với thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị Xuyến mong muốn được vay 12.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm các mặt hàng kẹo, bánh... phục vụ nhu cầu tiêu dùng của bà con trong dịp Tết.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Xuyến is 33 years old. She has been participating in TYM Fund since 2002. Today, Xuyến is raising livestock and has a general store. Her husband works as a photographer. These are their main sources of income and provides 4,000,000 VND per month. For this loan cycle, Xuyến hopes to borrow 12,000,000 VND to purchase snacks and foods to sell as her customers prepare for the upcoming Tết (Chinese/Lunar New Year) celebrations.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grocery Store

loans.name: Pasos Firme Group

texts.en:
Ana operates a variety store. In her store she is able to offer a wide variety of products including meats, vegetables, coffee, sugar, stove-top gas for cooking, and men’s and women’s clothing. Aided by Esperanza International, Ana has been able purchase materials in greater bulk to gain savings advantages and offer wider product variety to her customers. Ana has encountered some setbacks over the life of her business, including the death of loved ones, but her ambition remains to own her own home and to encourage the prosperity of her children (ages: 32, 30, 27, 24, 22, 20).

Ana is not alone in her quest to succeed through entrepreneurial activities. Ana is a member of the micro-finance bank “Pasos Firme”. Along with four other women, Ana is seeking additional loan funds from Esperanza to encourage growth in her business. Other member’s of Ana’s micro-finance bank run similar entrepreneurial ventures including selling fried food and ice cream, and used clothing sales.

On behalf of Esperanza and this group of business entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you for your support!

loans.use: Purchase additional needed inventory for variety store

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
As a wife and mother, Annalyn started a business so she could help her husband in supporting the needs of their family.  She put up her snack vending business wherein she sells different foods that are very affordable.  Aside from snacks, she also raises chickens for additional income.  Her income of PHP 2,100 a week is being used for a rolling store for her business.  She seeks to improve her business by borrowing a loan of PHP 5,000 and she promises to pay on a weekly basis.  Through the loan, she can increase her merchandise and her income.

To prepare for her children’s education, Annalyn and her husband are now starting to save.  They want their children to finish their studies and hopefully not experience the hardships in life.

Annalyn is 31 years old.  She is married to Anderson and he works as a tricycle driver using their own motorcycle. They have three children: 8-year-old Hannah Pauline, 2-year-old Andrea Lewelyn, and their new born baby Justine Lloyd. The family is living a simple life in Nuesa, Roxas, Isabela.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Wofunira Development Association (B) Group

texts.en: Ruth has had her poultry business for about 5 years now.  She has 400 broiler chickens that she raises.  People come to her home and buy these chickens to take to the market to sell.    Ruth says that the market for broiler chickens is very large so it is able to support the large number of people who do it. Ruth buys her chickens from Uga-chick.  Uga-chick is a place where many Ugandan poultry farmers buy day-old chickens.  Although this practice does not differentiate her from other poultry farmers, she tries to be competitive in the market by spending extra money on food supplements.  The important thing with broiler chickens is that they are heavy.  If you just feed the chickens a lot of food, they will grow heavy, but not as heavy as if you spend a little extra for supplements.    Ruth has four older children who stay around her home.  She says that although they are now old (32, 30, 28, and 25), they still depend on her.  She also has 3 small children that she cares for.  Two of these children are from her late brother and one of them is a grandchild.  These children all need their daily needs met as well as school fees.    Ruth is requesting a loan of 250,000 USH.  This will allow her to buy the critical supplements as well as four bags of feed.

loans.use: Food for her chickens as well as supplements to make them fat.

loans.name: Halim

texts.en:
Halim has been selling used car spare parts for 25 years. He prides himself on his competitive prices. His clients can be individuals or car repair men. He is 46 years old and lives in Nabatieh, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children.

Halim decided on doing this business because he wanted to improve his income. His business has done well right from the start. This is the first time that Halim is requesting a loan. He wants to borrow $2000 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise needed for his work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase used car spare parts

loans.name: Mrs. Hon Soam Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank, which consists of eighteen members, is located in Sdau Kanlaeng village in Kandal province and they plA. to use the loA. which they obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Hon S. is the village bank president, who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a 1.5 hectares of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she faces a problem because she does not have enough money to hire laborers to harvest the rice. Thus, she decided to ask for a loA. for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Rath Chhin, is a construction worker. Mrs. Hon S. is a 49 year old mother of six children, two of whom are construction workers, while the other three are employed in a garment factory, and the remaining one attends the local school.

loans.use: To hire laborers to harvest rice.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en:
Abigail O. is married with one child and has received an education through junior high school.

Since 2004 she has worked as a trader selling weave-ons and wigs at Zion Church in Cape Coast. While Abigail works as a trader, her husband is employed as a driver. Abigail uses her income to pay for school fees, rent, utilities and food.

She will use the loan to purchase additional hair products for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abigail plans to give a quality education to her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional hair products to sell

loans.name: Mukhtaran Munir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
My name is Mukhtaran and I have lived in Borewala, Pakistan for the past 12 years. Borewala is famous for its shrines. My husband, M. A., runs a grocery shop in the community.  I operate a clothes-embroidery business, which provides good income.  I have saved that money for a rainy day. I’m applying for a loan to diversify my husband’s grocery shop.

I’m the group leader of three other women from my area. Rubina Kosar baji wants a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to resell. Qaisra baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Rasheedan Begum baji wants a loan to buy supplies (wires, switcbboards, switches and tube lights) for her electric shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee each other's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mamadou D. est un enseignant dans une école privée dans le quartier de Château d’Eau Nord à Mbour  sa ville natale. Il habite la maison familiale  avec sa femme, ses enfants et sa mère. Avec le prêt qu’il sollicité, il veut réfectionner le toit et décor intérieur. 
.
texts.en:
Mr. Mamadou D. is a teacher in a private school in the Château d’Eau Nord neighborhood in Mbour, his native town. He lives in the family home with his wife, his children, and his mother. With the loan that he is requesting, he wants to repair the roof and the interior decor.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: repairing his home

loans.name: Fawazu Group

texts.en:
Fawazu is the group leader of Fawazu group. There are two members in this group and they each want to take a loan to progress their business and make it larger. So they are requesting a group loan of 28,000 Afghani.

Fawazu wants to take a loan for her carpet-weaving business.

Gullah wants to take a loan for her bakery business.

They are very thankful to Kiva lenders who are able to support the whole world.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Precilla

texts.en:
Precilla P. is from the village of San Simon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 37 years old. Precilla is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Precilla owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling specialty food products like "bibingka" in the local community. Precilla has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Precilla joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Precilla has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Precilla is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Precilla from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental
